channel.title: Comics on Instagram.hk.cn
channel.description: Recent content in Comics on Instagram.hk.cn

item.title: 1 Villain Gave Superman The Ultimate Choice Save Earth Or Save Krypton
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman must choose between saving Earth or the last remnants of Krypton, forcing him to confront his dual heritage. Superman defies Brainiac and saves both Metropolis and Kandor, proving his love for both his adopted and birth planets. Superman’s outsider status makes his connection to humanity even stronger, leading him to always choose both worlds. Literature ReviewSuperman is a man of two worlds: he came from the planet Krypton. but he grew up on Earth.

item.title: A Fan-Favorite Justice League Partnership Has Officially Broken Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKenan sacrifices his friendship with Bat-Man to protect him from learning Superman’s secret identity. The Justice League of China becomes a private entity, free from government influence. Super-Man’s decision to betray his friend is a temporary solution to keep Bat-Man safe. Literature ReviewSuper-Man and Bat-man, two heroes from the Justice League of China, are calling it quits after Kenan Kong chooses to join the Super-Family. Warning! Spoilers ahead for Action Comics #1059!

item.title: All For One Goal My Hero Academia Reveals The True Meaning Of Its Villain s Name
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAll For One’s ultimate move in chapter #408 reveals the true meaning behind his name and his obsession with One For All, as his goal is to reclaim his brother Yoichi through it. All For One’s fixation on Yoichi is evident in chapter #407, where he views Yoichi as one of his possessions and is enraged by his defiance. This fuels his obsession with subduing Yoichi and obtaining One For All.

item.title: Captain America Is Marvel s New Ghost Rider in Jaw-Dropping Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain America channels the supernatural as Marvel’s newest Ghost Rider, with Steve Rogers trading in his patriotic persona for the haunting aesthetics of the Spirit of Vengeance. Digital artist Kode Abdo expertly combines the iconic elements of Captain America and Ghost Rider, resulting in a visually stunning and wholly original artwork that has received overwhelming praise from fans. This captivating fusion introduces a compelling crossover concept for Marvel, with Steve Rogers assuming the role of Ghost Rider and becoming a canonical addition that fans would eagerly embrace.

item.title: Cementing Ms. Marvels Role in X-Men Mythos Marvels Star To Lead Kamala s Mutant Journey into New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKamala Khan, the beloved Ms. Marvel, will face the challenges of being a mutant in her hometown of Jersey City during the ongoing Fall of X, battling mutant hatred and iconic X-Men villains. The upcoming limited series, “Ms. Marvel: Mutant Menace,” will explore the consequences of Kamala being revealed as a mutant and potentially being forced to work as a hero in the shadows. Iman Vellani continues to bring Kamala Khan’s unique voice to life, integrating her into the X-Men mythos while staying true to her cultural and Inhuman identity.

item.title: Daredevil Shares His Powers With One Surprising Cosmic Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil and the Silver Surfer team up in a 2013 comic due to an alien’s request for the Avengers’ assistance. Both heroes possess unique vision abilities - Daredevil has radar powers and Silver Surfer sees people through their souls. The Silver Surfer struggles to use his sight on Earth, and both heroes bond over their surprisingly similar powers. Literature ReviewDaredevil is one of Marvel’s greatest street-level heroes, which is why it’s so surprising he shares his powers with one major cosmic hero.

item.title: Lois Lane Exposed the Real Tragedy of Superman s Secret Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLois Lane sees through Clark Kent’s perspective in the story “Glasses” from Mysteries of Love in Space #1, and discovers the loneliness he feels trying to fit into a world he wasn’t made for. Clark Kent made himself smaller to use his strength and heart for others, desperate to ensure no one else would feel left behind the way he has his entire life. Lois realizes that Clark needs someone to share his secret with, someone who can understand his burdens and guilt.

item.title: Loki Isn t the Enemy Thor Deserves, But The Enemy He Needs
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Immortal Thor #3 explores a deeper purpose to the long-running Loki vs. Thor feud, revealing Loki’s role as an antagonist is meant to help Thor grow as a hero. Loki prepares Thor to face a new villain by trapping him on a rune planet and forcing him to answer a riddle, ultimately teaching Thor a valuable lesson. Despite the extreme methods used, Loki’s actions demonstrate their care for Thor, and the importance of their complicated role in shaping Thor’s ongoing journey.

item.title: One Quirk is Enough My Hero Academia Reveals The Strongest Hero May Not Be Deku
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s victory over All For One marks a crucial point in his character arc, showing his growth and belief in his own quirk and himself. His victory is achieved through his ingenuity and understanding of his quirk, avoiding clich√©d power-ups. All For One’s defeat is a result of the collective efforts and sacrifices of numerous heroes, highlighting the importance of unity and relying on others as Bakugo acknowledges that he couldn’t have won alone.

item.title: Samurai Isekai Series Mixes Manga s Most Popular Genres To Explosive Effect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSamurai in Another World offers a unique twist on the isekai genre by combining ancient Japan with fantasy, creating a distinctive and exciting setting. The protagonist, Ginko, is a samurai from the Warring States period who finds fulfillment in the fantasy realm filled with stronger foes, giving her the opportunity for honor and adventure. Alongside the main goal of slaying a mythical dragon, Ginko faces obstacles from both enemies and allies, adding complexity and depth to the story, making it a promising manga with potential for an anime adaptation.

item.title: Talent Equal To Gojo Jujutsu Kaisen s Next Strongest Hero Will Shock Fans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHiromi Higuruma’s talent impresses even the powerful Sukuna, who compares him to the genius Gojo. Higuruma’s natural talent for cursed energy puts him in the same league as Gojo and Sukuna, considering he has been a sorcerer only for two months. However, Higuruma’s lack of combat experience may be his downfall in the battle against Sukuna. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen has been looking for Gojo’s replacement since his death in battle against Sukuna, and an unlikely sorcerer could step up.

item.title: What They Call A Genius Boruto Two Blue Vortex Confirms The Difference Between Naruto & Boruto
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBoruto’s training with Sasuke reveals his incredible talent and ability to learn techniques quickly, contrasting with Naruto’s struggle. The latest chapter sets up the goals for new villains and clears up mysteries, showcasing Boruto’s potential to be one of the strongest in the franchise. Boruto’s mastery of Sasuke’s techniques, along with his learning of other powerful techniques, suggests he could surpass his father and become the strongest ninja in history.

item.title: ‚Äú[SPOILER]... Take Down Superman‚Äù 1 Unexpected Teen Titan Has the Ultimate Superman Failsafe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Batman/Santa Claus: Silent Knight #4, Blue Beetle surprisingly takes down Superman by using his scarab armor’s ability to generate Kryptonite radiation. Blue Beetle’s hidden skill makes him a major threat to Kryptonians like Superman, elevating him to a higher echelon of power status in the DC Universe. This feat establishes Blue Beetle as one of the greatest heroes capable of standing up against a rogue Superman, when needed.

item.title: ‚ÄúAcross the Clowniverse‚Äù The Harley Quinn Multiverse Collides in Spectacularly Meta Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn recruits variants of herself to stop Brother Eye in a multiversal showdown. The upcoming issue features an army of non-canonical Harleys, including her Heroic Harlequin and barbarian counterparts. Harley will have to put her trust in herself and her chaotic team to defeat the dangerous Brother Eye. Literature ReviewHarley Quinn pulls herself together in an amazing cover that sees her team up with an army of her variants for an epic multiversal fight.

item.title: ‚ÄúAgents of Waller‚Äù Green Arrow s Family Expands Even Further with a Major Betrayal
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow’s long-lost allies return, but they’re working for the enemy. Green Arrow must uncover why his closest companions are betraying him. Waller’s mission is to tear Green Arrow’s family apart, but he won’t let that happen. Literature ReviewGreen Arrow‚Äôs team gets bigger as some of his closest associates return. But have they turned against him and allied themselves with Amanda Waller? The next family reunion for Green Arrow may just be his deadliest.

item.title: ‚ÄúCome for the Hot Orcs, Stay for the Political Drama‚Äù G. Willow Wilson Talks High Fantasy Series THE HUNGER AND THE DUSK (Interview)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Hunger and the Dusk is a high fantasy series that offers intricate detail, political intrigue, fantastical worldbuilding, and romantic entanglements. The story is set in a world at war, where humanity and orcs must form an unlikely alliance against a monstrous threat. It explores themes of personal drama, political tension, and complex relationships. The series, co-created by G. Willow Wilson and Chris Wildgoose, has received enthusiastic response and praise for its refreshing take on familiar fantasy elements and its impressive worldbuilding.

item.title: ‚ÄúEveryone Thinks Youre So Stoic‚Äù Doctor Strange Calls Out Blade Cool Reputation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlade’s cool and stoic personality is not as admired by other characters, such as Doctor Strange, as readers may think. Doctor Strange confronts Blade about his lack of level-headedness and cool demeanor, causing further strain on their friendship. Marvel is breaking down the stoic archetype by showing how characters like Doctor Strange find it insufferable to be around someone like Blade. Literature ReviewWhile Blade may have a reputation as a cool-headed badass, Doctor Strange disagrees, calling out the vampire hunter’s notoriously “stoic” personality.

item.title: ‚ÄúFlesh and Blood‚Äù DC Confirms Batmans Greatest Asset (Its Not His Weapons)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s mortality is his greatest strength and motivates him to think outside the box to beat his enemies. The Batman of Zur-En-Arrh lacks the risk of death, making him careless and less effective as a superhero. Despite initial setbacks, Batman’s grounding in mortality will ultimately lead him to victory over Zur-En-Arrh. Literature ReviewBatman faces off with his toughest opponent, but Bruce Wayne‚Äôs greatest assets may ensure his victory (and it‚Äôs nothing in his utility belt).

item.title: ‚ÄúId Do Anything to Make It Stop‚Äù DCs Original Sandman Reveals the Cruel True Nature of His Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSandman’s gas exposes victims to their past wrongdoings, causing them to experience the pain they inflicted on others. Dodds’ connection to Dream of the Endless justifies the extreme nature of his power. As a regular detective, his ability to create potent hallucinations is explained by his link to Dream’s cosmic power. Wesley Dodds: The Sandman #4 is available now from DC Comics. Literature ReviewWhile Wesley Dodds’ Sandman doesn’t have any official superpowers of his own, a reveal about his trademark gas means he’s basically a metahuman.

item.title: ‚ÄúThe Captain vs The Creeper‚Äù Shazam Faces His Most Surprising Opponent Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam is set to face his strangest opponent yet: the Creeper, in the upcoming issue of Shazam #9. Despite the Creeper being a street-level character with moderate strength, it’s unclear if he will receive a powerful upgrade to challenge Shazam. It is speculated that the Creeper may possess a magic relic or be under a spell to enhance his strength in order to stand a chance against Shazam. Literature ReviewSolicitations reveal that Shazam is about to face off with the most unexpected DC superhero around, the Creeper!

item.title: [SPOILER] Isn t Heroic Enough for the Justice League - & DC Just Proved It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAquaman’s recent actions in Outsiders #2 reveal his destructive and irresponsible behavior, causing a major threat to the world. Aquaman’s hunting of sea monsters nearly wiped out an entire species, leading to chaos and danger. Aquaman’s selfish actions and disregard for the safety of others question his suitability to remain a member of the Justice League. Literature ReviewThe Justice League’s reputation is sterling, but one iconic member just proved he is not heroic enough for membership.

item.title: [SPOILER] s Anti-Wonder Woman Contingency Shows Batman How It s Done
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Canary outsmarts Batman by creating a contingency plan for Wonder Woman that actually works. Black Canary assembles a team to rescue her sister from Themyscira, using strategic tactics to battle through Amazons and Wonder Woman. Black Canary’s plan focuses on distracting and holding back Wonder Woman, rather than killing her, making her a smarter and more effective strategist than Batman. Literature ReviewSomeone in the DC Universe has finally come up with a contingency plan for Wonder Woman that works, something even Batman has yet to do.

item.title: 1 Early Threat Explains Why Batman Originally Refused to Trust Superman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s distrust of Superman stems from his fear of unchecked power, which leads him to test Superman’s moral limits on killing. Superman’s loving upbringing and lack of significant trauma make him more willing to kill dangerous criminals like the Joker, which clashes with Batman’s no-killing rule. The conflict over the Joker’s arrest and Superman’s willingness to kill him strains the relationship between Batman and Superman, leading to Batman’s stockpiling of anti-Kryptonian measures for protection.

item.title: 1 Fan-Favorite Justice League Member Is About to Retire for Good - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTed Kord, the original Blue Beetle, may be retiring from superhero life due to the aftermath of a recent attack. Jaime Reyes, the current Blue Beetle, relies on Ted for guidance and support, so Ted’s retirement will have a significant impact on him. The upcoming Blue Beetle #7 will address whether Jaime can help Ted overcome his challenges and continue his superhero career. Literature ReviewOne Justice Leaguer is still shaking off a devastating attack, but a future solicitation makes it sound like this older legacy is calling it quits.

item.title: 1 Forgotten Titan Could Tip the Power Balance in the DCU
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBunker, a forgotten star of the Teen Titans, has the potential to be one of the strongest members of the team. In a story called “It’s a Bunkerful Life,” Bunker fights against Titan clones and displays his incredible power and ability. Bunker’s addition to the Titans would raise the team’s power level and make them nearly unstoppable, but his place in the current timeline is unclear. Literature ReviewA largely forgotten Teen Titan from DC’s New 52 era shows his immense strength by holding his own against the combined might of the Titans.

item.title: 1 Founding X-Men Hero Is Stronger Than Every Avengers Member, Marvel Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs the original five teen X-Men are ripped out of the timeline, they meet an older version of a major mutant hero. Their new mentor reveals they beat all the Avengers’ biggest villains single-handed, but there’s one threat they need the original X-Men to help them beat… Original X-Men #1 is coming from Marvel Comics December 20. Literature ReviewX-Men unleashes a founding member’s maximum power, revealing that the Avengers can’t hold a candle to them.

item.title: 1 Marvel Hero is Trying to Retcon the X-Men s Entire Krakoa Era
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYXavier plans to use time travel to kill Moira X and erase the current Earth-616 timeline, including the existence of Krakoa, as a means to defeat Enigma. The Enigma Dominion threatens to absorb all conscious life on Earth if not stopped. Xavier’s destructive plan could lead to his imprisonment and the loss of years’ worth of character development and storytelling. Literature ReviewRise of the Powers of X #1 reveals Xavier’s horrific plan to beat the Enigma Dominion… by killing a young Moira X and erasing Krakoa from history.

item.title: 1 MCU Villain Taught Marvel a Huge Lesson It s Still Applying
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJ. Jonah Jameson remains a constant character in multiple universes, including the MCU and Marvel Comics. The upcoming Ultimate Spider-Man comic introduces a new version of Peter Parker with a family and new villains, but J. Jonah Jameson is still exactly the same. The fan outcry about keeping J.K. Simmons as J. Jonah Jameson in the MCU seemingly influenced Marvel Comics’ decision to maintain the character’s consistent portrayal. Literature ReviewJ.

item.title: 1 Subtle Detail Reveals How Spider-Man Inspired His Greatest Enemy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNorman Osborn, known as the Green Goblin, now tries to be a hero and draws inspiration from his former nemesis, Spider-Man. In Red Goblin #4, Osborn’s use of Spider-Man’s iconic hand gesture reveals his admiration for the web-slinger, and more critically, his former enemy’s influence on his attempts at heroism. Osborn’s familiarity with Spider-Man’s motions and their long history of battling each other makes it natural for him to recognize and emulate Spider-Man’s gestures now that he is striving to be a Marvel hero.

item.title: 1 Superman Power Could Drain His Other Abilities if He Used it Too Much
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s heat vision, while a powerful ability, drains his solar battery quickly, rendering him powerless if overused. Superman’s power is not infinite; his abilities are fueled by the energy he absorbs from sunlight, and his reserve of stored solar energy can be burned through by overuse of his powers, especially heat vision. Despite his god-like abilities, Superman is still mortal and has clear limitations, as shown in Action Comics #1058.

item.title: 1 Superman Villain Becomes a Doomsday-Level Threat in Chilling Official Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe variant cover features Lex Luthor, clad in his imposing Warsuit and brandishing kryptonite as he looms over a defeated Superman. Superman and Lex Luthor’s precarious partnership takes center stage in Superman #12. The imagery in the cover art hints at a potentially dire outcome for Superman, leading fans to speculate about the possibility of another The Death of Superman storyline. Literature ReviewAn iconic villain reaches Doomsday-level threat status in a chilling variant cover for an upcoming Superman comic, teasing a grim fate for Kal-El.

item.title: 1 Teen Titan s Vampire Transformation Makes Beast Boy s Powers Look Weak
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiss Martian undergoes a supernatural transformation into a vampiric creature, showcasing her impressive shape-shifting abilities. Miss Martian partners with other heroes to fight against the Draug, a new vampire threat, using strategic tactics to defeat them. Miss Martian’s shape-shifting prowess surpasses Beast Boy’s, as she effortlessly adapts to grotesque forms and displays mastery in mimicking various species. Literature ReviewBeast Boy faces an unexpected challenger within the Teen Titans as one member’s vampire transformation rivals his renowned shape-shifting abilities.

item.title: 1 Thor Attack Unleashed Millions of Symbiotes Across the Galaxy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVenom #4 revealed Thor’s pivotal role in the ancient history of Marvel’s deadliest alien race, the symbiotes. Thor unintentionally unleashed billions of symbiotes on the populations of countless planets; the full extent of the repercussions of this is still not fully clear. While Thor saved Earth from Knull, his actions led to the long chain of events that would result in the creation of Venom and later Carnage, Marvel’s most iconic symbiote characters.

item.title: 1 Tragic Connection Makes Starfire s Bond to Nightwing Stronger Than Batgirl s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStarfire and Nightwing share a unique bond due to the trauma of witnessing their parents’ deaths. Starfire’s origin story highlights the unbreakable bond she shares with Nightwing, making their love triangle with Batgirl even more compelling. Titans #6 is on sale now from DC Comics! Literature ReviewNightwing has had a lot of iconic love interests over the years, but one dark connection gives him a special bond with Starfire.

item.title: 1 Underrated MCU Hero Already Proved They re Powerful Enough to Beat the Hulk
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMonica Rambeau, aka Photon, proved her superior strength by blowing a hole through a zombified Hulk with a single shot. She possesses Hulk-killing power, as shown in Secret Wars, but that’s not even close to the limit of her powers. In her solo limited series, it is revealed that Monica has the power to collapse an entire universe, making her stronger than the Hulk on a cosmic scale. Literature ReviewWhile this hero-in-question’s still new to the MCU, and relatively underrated, they’ve already proven to be more than capable of taking down the Hulk!

item.title: 1 Unexpected Batman Villain Has the Grossest Beast World Transformation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman villain Killer Moth undergoes a disgusting transformation into a giant cockroach in the crossover event “Beast World.” This is not the first time Killer Moth has been transformed, as he previously became the demon Charaxes in a prior storyline. Despite being a low-level criminal and not inspiring fear, Killer Moth’s multiple transformations make him an interesting and intriguing rogue among many in Batman’s history. Literature ReviewOne Batman villain’s “Beast World” transformation is just the latest, greatest, and grossest metamorphosis he has experienced over the years.

item.title: 1 Wonder Woman Quote Confirms Why She is The DCU s Most Important Leader
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s best quote emphasizes the importance of diplomacy, showcasing her commitment to conflict resolution through words and compassion rather than physical force. Diana’s ability to navigate complex challenges with a focus on dialogue, compassion, and conflict resolution positions her as DC’s preeminent leader. Tom King’s ongoing Wonder Woman series captures the essence of Diana, depicting her as both a warrior and a hero dedicated to fostering peace‚Äîan ethos in line with Gail Simone’s timeless characterization.

item.title: 10 Absolutely Stunning Peach Momoko Variant Covers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeach Momoko is a highly talented artist known for her breathtaking variant covers for major comic publishers like Marvel and DC. Her artwork combines enchanting and horrifying elements, with delicate watercolor and inking techniques. Momoko’s covers honor the essence of iconic characters, capturing their intensity, beauty, and darkness with stunning detail. Literature ReviewThe talented artist Peach Momoko began her meteoric rise to fame due to her stunning covers for Marvel Comics, delighting fans with whimsy and terror.

item.title: 10 Alien Species That Should Be Terrified the Predator Has Joined the Marvel Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPredators have crossed over into the Marvel Comics universe during the Predator vs Wolverine crossover, opening the possibility for future hunts of Marvel characters. The Imperial Guard, Kree Empire, Skrulls, Chitauri, Kronans, Klyntar, Brood, Makluan, Sakaarans, and Nova Corp are all potential targets for the Predators in the Marvel Universe. Hunting the Imperial Guard, Kree, Skrulls, Chitauri, Kronans, Klyntar, Brood, Makluan, Sakaarans, or Nova Corp would provide the Predators with different thrilling challenges and opportunities to test their skills and technology.

item.title: 10 Avengers Love Interests Who Became Superheroes In Their Own Right
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe love interests of many Avengers are becoming superheroes themselves, taking center stage and showcasing their own spectacular abilities. Modern comics are correcting past wrongs by giving more depth and agency to female characters who were previously depicted as mere love interests or victims. Several Avengers’ love interests, such as Mary Jane Watson, Gwen Stacy, Sharon Carter, Peggy Carter, Pepper Potts, Jane Foster, Liz Allan, and Betty Ross, have all embraced their superhero identities, proving to be powerful and capable heroes in their own right.

item.title: 10 Barely-Used Marvel Aliens Who Could Return as The Next Major Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Rigellians, though currently a galactic laughingstock, have the potential to become a significant threat to Earth if they can establish themselves as true players in the cosmic scene. The Cotati, who have plant-controlling powers, could wreak havoc on Earth’s ecosystem if they were to return and become a major threat. The Kronans, known for their brutality and advanced technology, are potentially one of Marvel’s most dangerous alien races and could pose a major threat to the universe.

item.title: 10 Best Colossus Fights in Marvel History (Ranked by Power Level)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYColossus is one of the strongest members of the X-Men ‚Äì which means that for better or worse, he has gone up against some of the strongest characters, heroes and villains alike, the Marvel Universe has to offer. This list ranks 10 of Colossus’ best fights according to the power level of his opponent. In many cases, Piotr Rasputin has proven himself one of the most formidable fighters in the Marvel Universe, but at times, he has been on the losing end of severe beatings.

item.title: 10 Best Devil Fruit Powers in One Piece
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Glare-Glare Fruit eaten by Viola only has a few uses in battle, but its power is excellent for espionage purposes since it gives the user clairvoyant and telepathic abilities. The Bird-Bird Fruit, Model: Phoenix is used by Marco in aerial combat, and is one of the few Devil Fruits with a healing ability. While the Rumble-Rumble Fruit is weak against the Gomu-Gomu Fruit, it is much more versatile and has many more functions.

item.title: 10 Best Elseworlds Batman Stories
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Elseworlds imprint explores alternate continuity versions of its classic characters, including many incredible reimaginings of Batman and Gotham City. With stories set in the past and far flung future of the DC Universe, alongside alternate histories, the many Elseworlds incarnations of Batman have offered writers the opportunity to tell a wide range of stories. With Elseworlds returning with more Batman stories, now is the time to revisit some of the best.

item.title: 10 Best Far Side Comics Where Dogs Act Like Humans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe frequent use of anthropomorphic dogs in Gary Larson’s The Far Side comics provides hilarious and absurd commentary on human behavior and societal norms. Throughout the long run of The Far Side in syndication, Larson masterfully combined visual gags with clever humor, using puns and unexpected situations to create laughs. The collision of dog and human culture in The Far Side comic strips highlights the quirks of human culture, as well as humans’ relationships with their canine companions.

item.title: 10 Best French and Belgian Comics From The Smurfs to Blue is the Warmest Color
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFrance and Belgium’s Bandes Dessin√©es (BD) comics have major cultural significance, with iconic characters like Tintin and the Smurfs. BD comics tackle diverse genres, from playful cartoons like Cubitus to existentialist horror like Sandcastle. These comics have worldwide reach, inspiring major movies and standing the test of time with their iconic designs and compelling stories. Literature ReviewKnown as the ’the¬†Ninth Art,’ Franco-Belgian comics have major variety, from the fun of The Smurfs to the tragic romance of Blue Is the Warmest Color

item.title: 10 Best Green Arrow Trick Arrows in DC Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow’s trick arrows, such as the Flashbang Arrow and Microphone Arrow, give him a versatile range of weapons. The iconic Boxing Glove Arrow allows Green Arrow to attack from a distance without being lethal. The EMP Arrow and Phantom Zone Arrow are powerful trick arrows that give Green Arrow an advantage over technology and superpowered opponents. Literature ReviewGreen Arrow has countless iconic trick arrows to get the job done.

item.title: 10 Best Juggernaut Fights in Marvel History (Ranked by Power Level)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJuggernaut’s battles vary in power level, but his first fight against the X-Men was iconic yet unimpressive. Juggernaut’s greatest accomplishment has to be when he defeated the Hulk one-on-one. It wasn’t until the Juggernaut used god-tier magic to fight Doctor Strange that he displayed his most impressive power during battle, making that fight his all-time best. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut has been in countless fights throughout his Marvel Comics history, but only a few show his true power.

item.title: 10 Best Manga Time Skips That Changed Everything
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTimeskips in manga often redefine the series, taking the story to greater heights and showcasing character growth and maturity. Manga like Magi , Animal Land , and Vinland Saga have successfully utilized timeskips to elevate their stories and explore new themes. Even the most famous stories such as Naruto and One Piece made successful use of this instrument. Timeskips can bring about genre changes, political discussions, and character development, making them impactful and memorable in manga storytelling.

item.title: 10 Best Manhwa on Webtoon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWebtoon offers a wide variety of manhwa across every genre, from underrated gems to popular titles. Each manhwa has something unique to offer, whether it’s exceptional art, social commentary, or thought-provoking themes. From romantic dramas to thrilling mysteries, Webtoon has something to please fans of every genre, making it home to some of the best graphic stories ever told. Literature ReviewWebtoon has a little of something for everyone with well over a million titles to choose from.

item.title: 10 Best Manhwa Which Deserve Anime Adaptations
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYManhwa and manga share similarities, such as popularity in genres and powerful storytelling through visuals and character writing. The Makeup Remover critiques beauty standards and emphasizes the idea that beauty is not universal, while showcasing individualized looks. Twilight Poem stands out with its stunning artwork, balanced tragic elements, and emotional character writing, making it deserving of an anime adaptation. Literature ReviewLots of manhwas have the potential to be great anime adaptations, but these titles prove their worth with their captivating storylines and artwork.

item.title: 10 Best Marvel ‚ÄúWhat If‚Äù Stories From the Early ‚Äò80s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWhat If? series in the 80s introduced groundbreaking and bizarre alternate fates for Marvel heroes, some of which were folded into the main canon. Notable What If? stories include Doctor Doom focusing on Mephisto instead of becoming a villain, Spider-Man saving Gwen Stacy but facing dire consequences, and Captain America sacrificing himself as President. Other stories explored outcomes like the Phoenix obliterating Earth, a compressed Clone Saga for Spider-Man, the Fantastic Four without powers, and Conan becoming a gang leader in New York.

item.title: 10 Best Nightwing Love Interests in DC History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing has had a complicated romantic history, with this list chronicling his love interests from his first crush through the present day. Nightwing’s romantic partners have ranged from criminals like Liu and Shawn Tsang to fellow superheroes like Helena Bertinelli, Starfire, and Batgirl. Despite his many love interests, Nightwing’s most enduring and fitting romance is with Barbara Gordon, aka Batgirl. Literature ReviewNightwing’s love life has been at the center of his character development over the years; this list ranks his best love interests, past to present.

item.title: 10 Best Ongoing Manhwa of 2023
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYManhwa, like manga, has seen tremendous success globally, with popular ongoing titles like Solo Leveling , Noblesse , and The God of High School . Manhwa offers additional benefits, such as colored pages and immediate global access, that make it an appealing alternative to manga. The ten series highlighted in this article showcase the range and quality of manhwa content available, indicating the beginning of a manhwa content revolution.

item.title: 10 Best Revenge Manhwa
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRevenge manhwa offer readers the satisfaction of seeing despicable characters get what they deserve. Revenge stories create morally gray characters that add depth to the plot. Revenge manhwa have gained popularity, leading to the use of the revenge trope in increasingly more series. Literature ReviewRevenge manhwa offer readers the unique satisfaction of seeing the most despicable characters get what they deserve and these series do it best. Be it petty or violent, revenge stories have always been popular and these manhwa execute the revenge trope to perfection.

item.title: 10 Best Romance Manga With Adult Leads
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRomance manga with adult leads offers a refreshing change from high school love stories, allowing mangaka to explore more complex components in mature relationships. Perfect World and Tokyo Tarareba Girls explore bittersweet complexities and self-discovery in adult romance. My Androgynous Boyfriend and Smoking Behind the Supermarket With You feature adorable couples with vibrant chemistry. Literature ReviewWhile many popular anime and manga series that fall within the romance genre tell high school love stories, there are plenty of series for adult fans.

item.title: 10 Best Selling Manga Of 2023
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe manga industry has had a successful year, with new adaptations helping to attract new audiences to the source material. Oricon’s list of top-selling manga includes both classic franchises and new titles, highlighting the diversity in the market. Blue Lock , a non-Shueisha manga, has become the overall top-selling manga of the year, thanks to the success of its anime adaptation and its timely release during the World Cup.

item.title: 10 Best Shonen Manga Panels of All Time, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSoul Society’s fate rests in Ichigo’s hands as he confronts the daunting task of saving it, creating an emotionally impactful scene in Bleach. Netero’s shocking cruelty challenges Meruem’s ideals and offers a thought-provoking exploration of human nature in Hunter x Hunter. Satoru Gojo’s ethereal declaration of being the most honored one showcases his unparalleled power and character in Jujutsu Kaisen. Literature ReviewShonen manga has a myriad of beautiful panels full of interesting compositions and thematic richness, here are ten of the genre’s most iconic panels.

item.title: 10 Best Short Manhwa Every Fan Needs to Read
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShort manhwa may lack complex worlds and intricate stories, but they can still tell meaningful and emotional stories that are memorable and impactful. The characters and their development in short manhwa can be original and entertaining, creating a familiar yet refreshing experience for readers. Short manhwa in genres like drama, romance, and horror offer plenty of worthwhile options for fans who are looking for a quick and satisfying read.

item.title: 10 Best Superhero Spy Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpy and superhero genres have long been well-matched in comics, bringing out the best fight scenes and complicating moral dilemmas. Iconic comic runs like “Nick Fury: Agent of SHIELD” and “The Winter Soldier” expanded the spy genre in superhero fiction, pushing boundaries of censorship and incorporating political thriller elements. Spy organizations like SHIELD and Checkmate, as well as characters like Nick Fury and Black Widow, have become integral parts of the Marvel and DC Universes, offering complex narratives and visually stunning art.

item.title: 10 Best-Selling Comics of All Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman: The 10 Cent Adventure #1 is a shocking one-shot that sets the stage for the Bruce Wayne - Murderer storyline. Fantastic Four #60 presents the Fantastic Four as relatable humans and reinvigorates the superhero team’s public image. X-Men #1, the highest-selling comic book of all time, introduces two new rosters for the Xavier Institute team and marks the end of Chris Claremont’s 16-year career on the X-Men series.

item.title: 10 Biggest Batman Failures in DC Comics History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s failures have resulted in the deaths of innocent people, such as Commissioner Gordon’s wife, Sarah Essen, at the hands of the Joker. The Justice League almost met their demise because of Batman’s failsafes, which were compromised and used against them by Ra’s al Ghul. Batman’s own actions allowed Maxwell Lord to hijack the Brother Eye satellite, leading to a destructive rampage and endangering the world’s heroes. Literature ReviewBatman has numerous accomplishments to his name, but he‚Äôs also got a few failures.

item.title: 10 Biggest Superman Failures in DC Comics History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s failure to notice and acknowledge Superboy’s departure from Earth demonstrates his fallibility as a hero. The haunting memory of leaving an astronaut behind in a shuttle explosion reminds Superman of the lasting impact of his mistakes. Superman’s decision to let his son Jonathan leave Earth with his Kryptonian grandfather ultimately leads to years of captivity and regret for Clark. Literature ReviewSuperman isn‚Äôt immune to making grievous mistakes. Despite his many victories, the Man of Steel also has a few failures hanging over his head.

item.title: 10 Children of Wolverine Who Were Just As Deadly
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s many children have inherited his deadly skills, with some of them even proving to be just as deadly, if not deadlier. The combination of powers from their father with iconic heroes or villains make them formidable threats, or heroes in their own right. Born in different realities, children like Wild Thing, Raze, and Rien show how Wolverine’s powers can be upgraded beyond belief. Literature ReviewWolverine has many sons and daughters in the Marvel multiverse, but only a few of Logan’s children can truly claim to be as deadly as their father.

item.title: 10 Classic 1970s Peanuts Comic Strips
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe 1970s was a pivotal decade for Peanuts ,as it maintained long-time fans and attacted new followers; with the ’70s comprising the mid-point of the iconic series’ run, it can be seen as the era when Peanuts both found its form and its groove. The comic strip continued to innovate in the ’70s, introducing new characters and situations while keeping old gags fresh. Peanuts consistently maintained its balance of heart-warming comedy and deadpan humor, offering punchlines that continue to resonate seven decades after the series’ debut, and more than twenty after it ended.

item.title: 10 Coolest Transformations in DC s Beast World Event (So Far)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics’ Beast World event sees heroes and villains transformed into astonishing new animal forms. The coolest beast transformations include Killer Croc’s monstrous form and Power Girl as a literal Flamebird. Characters like Harley Quinn and Red Hood also undergo unique and wacky transformations in this exciting event. Literature ReviewAs DC’s Beast World event kicks into full gear, tons of heroes and villains have been transformed, and some of them are cooler than others.

item.title: 10 DC Comics Round Robin Pitches That Deserve Another Chance
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow leads a new black-ops Justice League to take on evil in Justice League Redacted. Firestorm faces off against Darkseid in a thrilling return in Firestorm: Fourth World Problems. Justice League Queer, an all-LGBTQ+ team, offers an opportunity for more LGBTQ+ representation in comics. Literature ReviewDC Comics‚Äô Round Robin tournament teased a lot of interesting ideas for full-length miniseries, but these 10 pitches deserve a second chance. There are a lot of pitches DC Comics brought to fans‚Äô attention during its Round Robin competition that unfortunately just haven‚Äôt seen the light of day as a fully actualized series.

item.title: 10 Early 2000s X-Men Stories That Should Influence Their MCU Portrayal (Besides New X-Men)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe early 2000s X-Men storylines are perfect for live-action adaptations in the MCU, with New X-Men being a standout choice (which is why it’s excluded here). The Ultimate Universe is ideal for adaptation, offering compressed and reworked narratives that make characters more badass, such as the Ultimate X-Men. From standalone character storylines to arcs that could open the door for more storylines to come, these are the 10 best early 2000s X-Men storylines the MCU needs to adapt!

item.title: 10 Eye-Catching Marc Silvestri Uncanny X-Men Covers (Ranked)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarc Silvestri’s covers for Uncanny X-Men are iconic, and provide a detailed insight into his stellar contributions to the series in the late 1980s. Silvestri, along with inker Dan Green, expertly used color and perspective as core elements of their incredible run of Uncanny X-Men covers for Chris Claremont’s run on the series. Silvestri’s covers for the “Inferno” crossover event in particular showcase his ability to create visually stunning group shots, which do a great deal of work to evoke the atmosphere of the story, even before the reader opens the comic.

item.title: 10 Far Side Comics With Intentionally Corny Punchlines
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNeighborhood dogs band together to take down a common foe, the mailman, in a comically absurd and corny scene. A town’s karate enthusiasts are called to heroism against invading aliens, showcasing a confident anticipation and monster movie aesthetic. Alien friends have a humorous exchange when one requests six fingers instead of the usual five for a greeting, highlighting the species’ polydactyl nature and corny humor. Literature ReviewThroughout its newspaper run, Gary Larson‚Äôs The Far Side was always a prime showcase for intentionally corny (yet still hilarious) humor.

item.title: 10 Fights That Permanently Changed Batman s Body
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s relationship with Catwoman has left permanent scars on his chest, serving as a reminder of their complicated dynamic. Batman’s dedication to his secret identity as Bruce Wayne becomes challenging when he sustains injuries that are difficult to explain away, such as missing teeth. Batman’s exposure to fear toxin has rendered him immune to its effects, strengthening his ability to face his fears and continue fighting crime. Literature ReviewBatman has been fighting criminals for decades, and in that time he’s taken some pretty nasty hits that have left permanent scars on his body.

item.title: 10 Funniest Addams Family Comics Starring Gomez & Morticia (From the Original Comic Strip)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUnderstanding each other’s hobbies is an important part of a lasting romance, as shown when Gomez recognizes Morticia’s unusual interest in arranging living flowers. Gomez and Morticia’s love for their children is evident, even when they may not agree with their choices, like when they are horrified to discover Pugsley’s involvement with the Boy Scouts. The Addams Family’s unique traditions, such as waiting for Santa Claus by the fireplace with intentions to burn him, demonstrate their twisted charm and pride in their unconventional lifestyle.

item.title: 10 Funniest Cable & Deadpool Moments From Their Comic Book Team-Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeadpool and Cable’s initial encounter is hilariously mirrored their first fight, as they discuss their impending testosterone-driven battle. Deadpool’s deadpan question about it being a “testosterone thing” highlights his awareness of being a fictional character. Cable literally blows Deadpool’s mind, not once but twice, showcasing his newfound powerful telekinetic abilities. Deadpool’s request for Cable to “blow his mind” becomes a literal explosion in the back of his skull, giving the reader a laugh along with Cable.

item.title: 10 Funniest Far Side Comics with Deliberately Terrible Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLarson’s The Far Side comics often use deliberately “bad” art, which adds to the humor and surprise of the gags. The use of bad art in the comics allows for clever visual jokes that require the reader to interpret the image with the right context. Larson’s stick-figure comics are some of his best, using the simplicity of the art style to create new and clever rules for the characters and their world.

item.title: 10 Funniest Far Side Comics With Talking Animals
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAnimals in The Far Side comic strip engage in hilarious and surreal situations, such as giraffes getting stuck in gopher holes. The strip turns drinking contests on its head, with camels competing to see how long they can go without water instead of alcohol. The Far Side takes well-known stories, like the Three Little Pigs, and transforms them into funny scenarios, like a heavy-breathing wolf huffing and puffing on the phone.

item.title: 10 Funniest Far Side Dinosaur Comics Starring Tyrannosaurus Rex
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFar Side comics often depict T-Rex as a powerful yet comically flawed creature, from its tiny arms to its limited intellect. Gary Larson’s iconic comics blend humor with dark and surreal elements, creating bizarre worlds where dinosaurs dine on cereal and become domesticated. Larson found funny ways to use every part of the T-Rex - from its bones to its eggs to just its shadow. Literature ReviewGary Larson’s The Far Side is obsessed with dinosaurs, but it puts particular effort into bringing Tyrannosaurus Rex down a peg.

item.title: 10 Funniest Garfield Comics Starring Garfield s Nemesis Mrs. Feeny
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGarfield’s mischievous antics often lead to a tumultuous and hilarious relationship with Mrs. Feeny, adding an extra layer of humor to the comics. Absurd situations, visual gags, and clever wordplay are key elements that make Garfield comics so celebrated and humorous. Mrs. Feeny’s inventive and over-the-top responses to Garfield’s antics, as well as Garfield’s relentless pursuit of revenge, contribute to the ongoing and amusing feud between the two characters.

item.title: 10 Funniest Garfield Comics Where Garfield Beats Up Jon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGarfield may be known for his sarcasm, but he can also get violent. Garfield often targets Jon, often with a smug excuse for attacking him. Garfield has beat up Jon to wake him up, to get attention, or by accident when he’s trying to kill a fly. Literature ReviewJim Davis’ cartoon cat Garfield may be famous for his laziness and wisecracks, but when Jon actually irritates him, the claws come out.

item.title: 10 Funniest Peanuts Comic Strips of the 1990s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDespite the ’90s being associated with other trends, Peanuts remained wildly successful throughout the decade. New characters were introduced, adding new storylines to the strip while maintaining its trademark humor. Snoopy’s alter ego as an attorney is comical, as he always loses his cases, resulting in depressed clients. Literature ReviewMore than 40 years after its debut, Peanuts was still going strong in the 1990s thanks to the hilarious and timeless comic strips by Charles Schulz.

item.title: 10 Funniest Peanuts Comics Where Charlie Brown Takes on Lucy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn one comic, Charlie Brown accidentally kicks Lucy’s finger while attempting to kick a football, giving him a rare moment of victory. Another has Charlie Brown subtly pointing out Lucy’s lack of listening skills, a departure from their usual dynamic. In one other notable entry, Charlie Brown challenges Lucy’s behavior and suggests that she and her brother should get along better, but Lucy dismisses his advice with laughter. Literature ReviewLaughter reigns supreme as Charlie Brown squares off against the formidable Lucy in these ten uproariously funny Peanuts comics by Charles M.

item.title: 10 Funniest Peanuts Comics Where People Hate Charlie Brown
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCharlie Brown is constantly mistreated and made fun of by the other kids in Peanuts. Despite his mistreatment, Charlie Brown tries to handle situations with good sportsmanship and humor. Charlie Brown is often singled out and excluded by his friends and even his own sister, leaving him feeling left out and misunderstood. Literature ReviewCharlie Brown isn’t the most popular member of the Peanuts gang, and that’s never more true than in these comics where kids hate on the blockhead.

item.title: 10 Gamechanging Wolverine Moments From His Early X-Men Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUncanny X-Men #133 showed fans how deadly Wolverine truly is, establishing his reputation for slicing people to bits. Uncanny X-Men #212 marked the first in-canon fight between Wolverine and Sabretooth, sparking their iconic rivalry. Uncanny X-Men #142 proved that Wolverine could be killed, showcasing that his healing factor isn’t unbeatable - and those are just three examples of how Chris Claremont’s Uncanny X-Men run made Wolverine the character he is today.

item.title: 10 Greatest Image Comic Launches That Define 90s Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYImage Comics was formed in the 1990s by disillusioned Marvel artists who wanted greater control over their work. Cyber Force, ShadowHawk, Gen 13, The Maxx, and Stormwatch were among the top first issues from Image Comics in the 1990s. Spawn #1 was the book that put Image Comics on the map and laid the foundation for Todd McFarlane’s multi-media empire. Literature ReviewImage Comics was one of the biggest publishers of the “extreme” 1990s, and these are the best first issues the decade witnessed from the company.

item.title: 10 Greatest Moments From HITMAN, Garth Ennis Underappreciated DC Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHitman introduces Tommy’s superpowers in a brutal shootout, setting the tone for the entire series. Hitman’s first arc involves Tommy being hired to assassinate the Joker, shocking DC fans. Hitman features a hilarious and memorable moment where Tommy pukes on Batman, showcasing the series’ inclusion in the wider DC canon - and these are just a few of the greatest moments in Garth Ennis’ series! Literature ReviewGarth Ennis’ Hitman is woefully underrated as it not only features A-listers like Superman & Batman, but it’s also badass.

item.title: 10 Gruesome Deadpool Injuries Readers Cant Unsee
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeadpool’s healing factor is unparalleled, allowing him to recover from gruesome injuries like decapitation and dismemberment. Deadpool suffers from the injuries themselves before his healing process kicks in, exposing readers to every vivid detail of his violence-induced wounds. From being cut in half by Captain America’s shield to having his head crushed by an anvil, Deadpool has endured some truly horrific injuries throughout the Marvel Universe. Literature ReviewDeadpool has one of the most impressive healing factors in comic book fiction, which means his injuries can be the most gruesome.

item.title: 10 Hilarious Far Side Comics That Make Fun of Artists
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThese Far Side comics hilariously highlight the strip’s irreverent treatment of art and artists, showing their flaws and shortcomings. Far Side creator Gary Larson playfully mock the concept of artistic value and subjective interpretation, suggesting that art should not be taken too seriously. Several of these Far Side comics creatively reimagine historical art and famous artists, providing whimsical and exaggerated origin stories for their works. Literature ReviewSome say that art can be divided into highbrow and lowbrow, but in the Far Side, it’s all just a joke.

item.title: 10 Indigenous Marvel Characters Perfect To Join The MCU After Echo
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEcho marks a change in Indigenous representation in Marvel, with Native American folklore and history incorporated into the show. Marvel can subvert inaccurate representations of Indigenous characters by utilizing their comic book mythology with sensitivity and nuance. Characters like Danielle Moonstar, Warpath, and Wyatt Wingfoot have the potential for future appearances in Marvel projects. Literature ReviewEcho has opened the doors for Indigenous representation in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Here are more iconic characters for future MCU projects.

item.title: 10 Invincible Villains Fans Wish Could Have Died Twice
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDavid Hiles: A teacher turned villain who kidnapped and killed innocent high school students with explosives. Battle Beast: Fierce warrior who only lived for battle, but fans weren’t sad to see him meet his end. The Sequids: Parasitic hive-mind that tried to destroy the universe by taking control of Earth. Literature ReviewThere are plenty of antagonists in Invincible, but only 10 are so particularly vile that fans wish the worst possible fates would come to them.

item.title: 10 Justice League Kids in Continuity Who Could Lead DC s Next Generation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne has undergone remarkable character growth, making him the top choice to lead DC’s next Justice League. Trinity, Wonder Woman’s daughter, possesses the essential qualities for an outstanding leader and could surpass Damian if solidified within continuity. Despite his leadership potential, Jon Kent often defers to Damian Wayne, showing his character as a follower rather than a leader. Literature ReviewThe Justice League has been busy saving the world and making babies!

item.title: 10 Manga With The Best Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYManga relies heavily on visually appealing artwork to capture readers’ attention and appreciation. The top-ranked manga series are known for their stunning and captivating artwork. Each manga mentioned in the article showcases unique and impressive art styles that enhance the storytelling experience. Literature ReviewThese ten manga stand out for their dazzling and gorgeous art. From breathtaking landscapes to intricately designed characters, manga is a canvas where talented artists bring their visions to life.

item.title: 10 Marvel Heroes the Predator Should Fight Next (After Taking On Wolverine)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Predator is familiar with fighting Wolverine from the limited series Predator vs Wolverine, but there are plenty other Marvel heroes for the Predator to fight. Iron Man would challenge a Predator’s tech, Captain America would challenge its tactics, and Black Panther would be almost a perfectly even match. Out of every hero, Deadpool would be the most valuable. Not because he’d put up the best fight, but because Predators could hunt him again and again due to his healing factor.

item.title: 10 Marvel Villains Introduced in 2023 That Could Be Major Threats In the Future
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel has introduced some incredibly powerful and intriguing villains this year, setting the stage for epic conflicts in the future. Villains like Mother of Horrors, Cubisk Core, and General Strange pose major threats to the Marvel Universe and its heroes. The expansion of Marvel’s cosmic landscape gives these villains the opportunity to become even more significant antagonists, operating at unimaginable levels, going forward. Literature ReviewThis year introduced a host of dangerous new villains to the Marvel Universe; here’s a look at who could be the biggest threats of the next year.

item.title: 10 Marvel Villains the Predator Would Absolutely Hunt
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel villains with high levels of insanity, such as the Green Goblin, would attract the attention of Predators due to their unpredictable behavior and potential for mayhem. Predators would be drawn to hunting villains like Sabretooth, who possess similar attributes to Wolverine, such as animalistic tendencies and a healing factor. Above all else, Predators would want to hunt the seemingly unkillable villains like Juggernaut and Thanos, even if they would likely lose.

item.title: 10 Most Brutal 1 vs 1 Fights in Avengers History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAvengers face god-tier villains in intense one-on-one battles, like Captain America defeating the villainous Kleiser. Captain Marvel and Thor engage in a bloody and rage-filled battle across the entire planet. Iron Man and Captain America’s iconic conflict in Civil War leads to a brutal and destructive confrontation between the two heroes - and that’s just a few of the many brutal one-v-one battles in Avengers lore. Literature ReviewThe Avengers aren’t known as Earth’s Mightiest Heroes for no reason, & their reputation extends to those around them.

item.title: 10 Most Brutal 1 vs 1 Fights in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperheroes don’t make names for themselves by fighting off faceless goons all the time. Rather, their most iconic moments come from memorable one-on-one fights, both against major villains, and at times, other heroes. The Justice League’s members prove time and time again why they are the premiere superheroes in the DC Universe by displaying their power in epic fight scenes. With DC’s endless Multiverse, there are always opportunities for Justice League teammates to find themselves in brutal physical confrontations with one another, as several entries on this list depict.

item.title: 10 Most Brutal 1 vs 1 Fights in X-Men History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe X-Men fight against super-villains in brutal combat, with intense one-on-one fights being arguably the most intense. Wolverine’s fights with Deadpool and Sabretooth are particularly gruesome and filled with relentless violence. Magneto’s fights, including his brutal killing of Tarn and ripping Apocalypse in half, showcase his ruthless power. Literature ReviewThere is no shortage of epic fights in X-Men, and a great many of them are one-v-one. Here are the 10 best single combat battles in X-Men history!

item.title: 10 Most Brutal Large-Scale Battles in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJustice League has engaged in massive battles with powerful individuals like Prometheus and the Joker, facing near-defeat but managing to overcome the odds. Their wars have extended beyond individual villains, with conflicts against forces like Starro the Conqueror and Darkseid, showcasing the League’s commitment to protecting the Earth. They’ve also faced apocalyptic scenarios, combating undead armies and vampire threats, demonstrating the League’s resilience and determination in the face of overwhelming odds.

item.title: 10 Most Creative Ideas Fantastic Four Introduced to Marvel Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Fantastic Four introduced iconic characters like The Skrulls, Adam Warlock, and The Inhumans, who have become major players in the Marvel Universe. The Negative Zone and Galactus, two significant elements of the Marvel mythos, were first introduced in Fantastic Four comics, showcasing the team’s ability to create epic storylines. The Fantastic Four pioneered the concept of a shared universe, where events in one character’s comic could impact others, setting the stage for interconnected storytelling in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: 10 Most Dangerous Creations From Wolverine s WEAPON PLUS Program
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain America’s existence helped create the villainous Weapon Plus Program, and his ‘Weapon I’ codename serves as a reminder. Luke Cage’s invincibility is a result of Weapon Plus experimentation, making him a potential threat if his good nature were to change. Typhoid Mary’s deadliness is owed to Project Psych, which twisted her into a vicious villain who can cause extensive carnage with her powers - and that’s only a few of the many living weapons created by Weapon Plus!

item.title: 10 Most Devastating Green Lantern Corps Failures in DC History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Guardians’ creation of the Manhunters resulted in the slaughter of an entire sector, proving emotionally detached policing was a mistake. John Stewart’s controversial decision to kill fellow Green Lantern Mogo caused widespread criticism among his peers. Kyle Rayner’s decision to hide the death of his son from his love interest Soranik Natu permanently ended their relationship and broke her trust. Literature ReviewThe Green Lantern Corps is an organization with a lot of mistakes in its history.

item.title: 10 Most Effective Defensive Powers in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAquaman’s ability to attack people’s minds makes him a formidable threat, even to advanced beings. Plastic Man’s stretchy physiology makes him virtually indestructible and able to protect others. Animal Man has access to the powers of any creature, giving him near-limitless defensive abilities. Literature ReviewWhen it comes to the Justice League‚Äôs members keeping themselves or others safe, these 10 special abilities are the best in the team‚Äôs history. The Justice League is one of the best superhero teams ever created and not just because of their ability to play offense.

item.title: 10 Most Heartbreaking Invincible Deaths (That Were Never Reversed)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRus Livingston was a victim, not a villain, and paid the ultimate price when Invincible ended his life to stop the spread of the Sequids. Angstrom Levy could have found redemption, but his life was tragically ended when he was decapitated by Robot during a sudden betrayal. The Guardians of the Globe, the world’s greatest defenses, were brutally slaughtered by Omni-Man, leaving only the Immortal as the sole survivor of the shocking and violent betrayal.

item.title: 10 Most Important Darkseid Moments That Defined DC History & Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarkseid’s debut in Superman’s Pal Jimmy Olsen #134 establishes him as an intimidating presence and top-tier villain. The introduction of the Anti-Life Equation in Forever People #5 drives Darkseid’s motivations and desires throughout his existence. Darkseid’s tragic love story with Suli shapes his cold heart and fuels his anger, hate, and bitterness. Literature ReviewOne of the DC Universe’s most powerful villains, Darkseid has played a role in several major stories.

item.title: 10 Most Powerful Time Travelers in Marvel Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel Comics characters embrace time travel, with iconic figures like Cable, Kitty Pryde, and Doctor Doom showcasing their time-traveling abilities. Characters like Cosmic Ghost Rider and Ravonna Renslayer possess powerful time-traveling devices and abilities, granting them control over elements, energy, and the ability to weave through time and space. Reed Richards, also known as Mr. Fantastic, and Kang the Conqueror are highly knowledgeable in time travel, using advanced technology and their intellect to manipulate the timeline and conquer the universe.

item.title: 10 Most Powerful Version of Doomsday in Superman Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDoomsday is the one of the few characters in the DC Universe, who can instill fear in Superman and has pushed him to the brink, including killing the Man of Steel in the famous “Death of Superman” storyline, which introduced the villain. Different versions of Doomsday have appeared over the years, each one more dangerous than the last. Some surprising versions of Doomsday, like Jimmy Olsen and Alfred Pennyworth, have proven to be even stronger and more capable than the original.

item.title: 10 Most R-Rated Invincible Injuries That Characters Somehow Survived
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInvincible’s arm is nearly destroyed when he punches Allen, but with 11 surgeries, it is fixed and healed properly. Bulletproof is heavily scarred and in serious pain after surviving an explosion, but chooses not to fix his appearance. Invincible is ripped in half and Eve’s face is punched in, but they are restored to full health thanks to Eve’s powers. Literature ReviewThere‚Äôs plenty of violence to be found in Invincible, but only a few jaw-dropping injuries stand out as the most horrifying in the entire series.

item.title: 10 Most Surreal Calvin and Hobbes Comics About Dinosaurs
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCalvin’s whimsical imagination brings dinosaurs to life in detention, showcasing Watterson’s surreal storytelling brilliance. Watterson’s art speaks volumes in a dialogue-free comic, capturing the humor and charm of Calvin’s dinosaur daydreams. Calvin’s mischievous antics and his mother’s patient parenting collide in a humorous comic where a candy-eating dinosaur becomes part of the daily routine. Literature ReviewPrepare for a trip to the wild world of Calvin and Hobbes, where dinosaurs take center stage in ten of the most fantastically surreal comic strips.

item.title: 10 New York Based Marvel Heroes Who Should Run Against Luke Cage For Mayor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s tenure as mayor or New York City, following Kingpin Wilson Fisk’s time in office, has been controversial, with the hero not living up to his potential as the city’s leader. With another election coming up, this could prompt one or more of the city’s other heroes to enter the race. New York is in many ways the epicenter of hero activity in the Marvel Universe ‚Äì but Fisk’s laws making superhero activity illegal have majorly impacted the city’s vigilante population.

item.title: 10 Nightwing Quotes That Prove He s Already Earned His Own Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing’s way with words sets him apart as a hero and connects with readers, making him a natural fit for DC’s next cinematic venture. Dick Grayson’s rhetorical skills have saved his life many times, as well as frequently highlighting what makes him a distinct, unique hero, apart from his original mentor and adopted father, Batman. Over time, Nightwing has come to acknowledge his similarities to Batman, actualizing own potential to be a formidable and respected hero.

item.title: 10 of the Most Badass One Sith From Star Wars Legacy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe One Sith is a new Sith regime that rejects the Rule of Two and allows for the introduction of multiple Sith at once. Darth Krayt founded the One Sith and is both powerful and ruthless, making him a truly badass Sith Lord. Darth Talon, Darth Nihil, Darth Stryfe, and other members of the One Sith demonstrate their badass nature through their power, loyalty, and violent escapades. Literature ReviewThe One Sith rejected the Sith Rule of Two in the Star Wars: Legacy era, meaning there were a lot featured Sith Lords.

item.title: 10 Outrageous Quotes From Cable & Deadpool
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeadpool’s gloriously random quote about not going to France during a fictional war perfectly captures his outrageous personality. Deadpool’s reference to Normandy and Bridgette Nielsen while attacking German guards is the epitome of outrageousness. Cable’s meta quote about taking the easy way out with a ridiculously large gun showcases the hilarious contrast to his characterization in Cable & Deadpool and that’s just some of the many outrageous quotes in this series!

item.title: 10 Pieces of Art That Show How Disturbing New Ultimate X-Men Franchise Will Be
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeach Momoko’s art style combines cuteness and gore, using elegant watercolor brushstrokes. Her artwork for Ultimate X-Men is disturbing yet captivating, showcasing visceral and gory imagery. She has a knack for merging Japanese folklore with Marvel characters, creating unforgettable and grotesque scenes. Literature ReviewPeach Momoko has become an A-list artist, and her most disturbing images show why her Ultimate X-Men will be like nothing else we’ve seen before. Writer/artist Peach Momoko is a full-fledged star at Marvel Comics and her incredible work will be on full display in the new Ultimate X-Men series.

item.title: 10 Punisher Quotes That Proved Marvel s Hero is Completely Unhinged
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Punisher’s bloodthirsty nature is evident in his chilling quotes and battle cries, like when he screamed, “Spider-Man deserves to die!” The Punisher’s duality is revealed when he admits to finding release and pleasure in killing, despite claiming to be apathetic. The Punisher’s unhinged and violent nature is demonstrated when he immediately jumps to violence, even towards someone who saves his life, like Batman. Literature ReviewPunisher is one of the most unhinged characters in Marvel Comics - obvious by his actions, but also by his words.

item.title: 10 Scariest Jojo s Bizarre Adventure Stands That Are an Absolute Nightmare in Battle
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPurple Haze is known to be one of the most dangerous Stands in the series, producing a virus so deadly that even its user refrains from using it. Wonder of U is a terrifying, sentient Stand that can manipulate Calamity, which is a negative force of energy related to fate. C-Moon evolves into Made in Heaven, which has the horrifying ability to accelerate time by manipulating gravity; it’s the main force that causes the main universe to be rebooted multiple times.

item.title: 10 Scariest Versions of Spider-Man in Marvel Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTraditionally known as Marvel’s “Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man,” over the years the Multiverse has allowed for versions of Spider-Man that are not just less-than-friendly, but are in fact terrifying. From Ghost-Spider, to Man-Spider, to Spiders-Man, there are some truly wild version of the Webslinger scattered throughout Marvel’s Multiverse. While even some of the scarier Spider-Men remain heroic, some have become villains, turning away from the values instilled in Earth-616 Peter Parker early in his superhero career.

item.title: 10 Shocking Moments From the Original Ultimate Marvel Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Ultimate Universe pushed the boundaries of what happened to iconic Marvel Comics characters in every conceivable way. From a cannibalistic Hulk and Blob to a predatory Wolverine and incestuous Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver, the Ultimate Universe had no shortage of shocking moments. Among the most shocking, however, were the more gruesome moments, like Hulk ripping Wolverine in half, the Thing crushing Doctor Doom’s skull, and Spider-Man dying. Literature ReviewMarvel Comics Ultimate Universe pushed the boundaries of what fans could handle, from horrific gore to character changes.

item.title: 10 Strongest Digimon So Powerful They Broke The Anime Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSome of Digimon’s strongest creatures, like Piedmon and Alphamon, possess awe-inspiring powers that can warp reality. Digimon franchise has introduced over 1,000 types of digital monsters, but ten stand out for their unrivaled raw power. From Piedmon’s unpredictable tactics to Omnimon’s unbeatable fusion, these Digimon are virtually unstoppable in battle. Literature ReviewWith each new story, the Digimon universe adds more powerful digital monsters to help or hinder the DigiDestined, but who are the most powerful?

item.title: 10 Thanos Quotes That Prove He ll Always Be Marvel s Greatest Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos’s philosophical rhetoric is as poetic as it is devastating, with the character’s impressive way with words often leaving a lasting impression on readers. Thanos’s words have the power to leave everyone, including Marvel’s greatest cosmic entities, in awe of his oratory skills. Thanos’s iconic quotes showcase his cold core and his ability to instill fear and awe in his enemies, solidifying his status as Marvel’s greatest villain. Literature ReviewThanos knows how to give speeches and memorable quotes just as well as he knows how to wipe out universes.

item.title: 10 Things Only Invincible Comic Fans Know About Damien Darkblood
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamien Darkblood has a power called “heat resistance” that matches his ‘demonic’ nickname. Unlike the TV version, comic Damien Darkblood is a terrible detective and is laughed at for his failed investigation. Darkblood’s outfit and speech pattern are inspired by Watchmen’s Rorschach, and his appearance is influenced by Hellboy. Literature ReviewInvincible’s Damien Darkblood has quickly become a fan-favorite character from the Amazon series, but only comics fans know his full story.

item.title: 10 Truly Epic Brian Azzarello Hellblazer Moments
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn turns the tables on animal-torturing children, showing his unyielding righteousness and dark sense of justice. John’s shower scene in prison reveals his cunning and ability to strike fear into the hearts of his fellow inmates. John’s hitchhiking adventure leads to a twist, saving a kidnapped woman and showing that he can be a reluctant hero. Literature ReviewBrian Azzarello’s run on Hellblazer broke new ground for John Constantine, and here are the top 10 best moments from it.

item.title: 10 Ultimate Spider-Man Moments That Helped Marvel Websling Into the New Millennium
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man’s origin in the Ultimate Universe was tied to two major villains - Norman Osborn (Green Goblin) and Otto Octavius (Doc Ock). Ultimate Spider-Man featured cover art that tried to be “new” and “cutting-edge” but ended up looking weird. The early 2000s lingo used in Ultimate Spider-Man, like “wigged out” and “busted,” helped modernize the story but doesn’t hold up well today - and those were just some of the ways the Ultimate Universe brought Spider-Man into the new millennium.

item.title: 10 Unforgettable Garth Ennis Hellblazer Moments
