Frieza’s ultimate plan with his newfound power is unclear, but it could involve becoming the new God of Destruction or starting a multiversal civil war. Literature ReviewAfter unlocking Black Frieza, the beloved Dragon Ball villain can shake up the Dragon Ball Super story by ending the God of Destruction Beerus.

item.title: From Wayne Manor to the North Pole Santa Reveals Batman s Unanswered Christmas Wish
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSanta reveals Batman’s heart-wrenching Christmas wish: to have his parents back after their tragic deaths. Bruce Wayne’s enduring belief in Santa Claus, even after his parents’ death, showcases the childlike wonder that persisted within him. The revelation of Batman’s love for Damian highlights their profound father-son bond beyond the mentor-prot√©g√© relationship. Literature ReviewThe season of cheer has transformed into the season of tears as Santa reveals Batman’s heartbreaking and unmet Christmas wish in DC’s holiday special.

item.title: G.I. Joe & Cobra Debut Jaw-Dropping New Weapons - Created from Transformers Tech
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYG.I. Joe and Transformers are connected through the shared Energon Universe, with new weapons derived from Energon. In Duke #1, Duke goes AWOL to uncover the secrets of the Transformers and is helped by Dr. Adele Burkhardt. Duke #1 is on sale now from Skybound Entertainment! Literature ReviewIn the new shared Energon Universe, G.I. Joe and Cobra are both racing to claim Transformers’ Energon - using it to create upgraded weaponry.

item.title: G.I. Joe Just Created a Huge Problem with Snake Eyes Codename
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYG.I. Joe: A Real American Hero #301 continues the story started by writer Larry Hama over 40 years ago, with a new twist involving the resurrection of the original Snake Eyes. The issue explores the question of who will become the definitive Snake Eyes now that the original character has returned, with potential options including Sean Collins reverting to his codename Throwdown or Dawn Moreno adopting a new codename. Readers will have to stay tuned to G.

item.title: G.I. Joe Legend Larry Hama s 10 Favorite Joes (And the 5 He Hates Most)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Toyfare: The Toy Magazine #9, from 1998, G.I. Joe legend Larry Hama listed his ten favorite Joe characters…along with his five least favorite. Both Hama’s favorites and least favorites contain some surprises, as well as some obvious picks. Larry Hama recently returned to the series once again, as Skybound Entertainment resurrected the classic G.I. Joe: A Real America Hero title, picking it back up with issue #301. Literature ReviewG.

item.title: G.I. Joe Officially Introduces a Major Villain to New Canon with a Blood-Soaked Massacre
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Energon Universe era of G.I. Joe has arrived, and with it comes one of the franchise’s most formidable villains. Duke #1 introduces the major villain behind M.A.R.S. Industries, which will be immediately familiar to long-time fans of the franchise. A brutal massacre in Duke #1 proves that this villain is going to be more bloodthirsty in the Energon continuity than ever previously depicted. Literature ReviewDuke #1 sees the introduction of a major G.

item.title: G.I. Joe Promises Epic Fight Between Two Beloved Joes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYG.I. Joe is coming back in the Energon Universe with the release of Duke #1, the first in a series of miniseries featuring new and familiar characters. Duke and Mercer, two beloved G.I. Joe characters with different backgrounds, will have an epic fight scene in the upcoming Duke series. The fight between Duke and Mercer will be intense, and fans will have to keep reading to discover who will come out on top and what it means for the future of G.

item.title: G.I. Joe Reveals 3 Heroes Are Making Their Energon Universe Debut
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDuke #4 introduces classic G.I. Joe characters Stalker and Rock ’n Roll, building out the new Energon Universe continuity. The surprising cover reveals Baroness working alongside Duke, indicating her own hidden agenda. The identity of the dark-haired, bearded Joe on the cover is still unknown, but it promises even more guest stars in the upcoming Duke and Cobra Commander series. Literature ReviewThe cast of G.I. Joe continues to fill out in Skybound’s new Energon Universe continuity, and now three classic Joes have entered the fray.

item.title: G.I. Joe s New Continuity Was Inspired by Jonathan Hickman s X-Men Reboot
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSkybound Entertainment’s new G.I. Joe titles are inspired by Jonathan Hickman’s successful X-Men reboot, which has shaped Marvel’s mutants. The new Duke and Cobra Commander miniseries will tell one big story, while being designed to be read independently or together. The Energon Universe’s G.I. Joe aims to replicate the success of Marvel’s X-Men reboot and bring a fresh sense of urgency to the franchise. Literature ReviewG.I. Joe is being rebooted in the Energon Universe, and writer Joshua Williamson revealed he’s taking inspiration from Jonathan Hickman’s X-Men.

item.title: Galactus Ultimate Attack Proves He Could Destroy Thanos (Even with the Infinity Gauntlet)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGalactus shows he can defeat Thanos, even with the Infinity Gauntlet, with the right amount of prep time in Silver Surfer Rebirth: Legacy #5. Galactus is one of the most powerful beings in the Marvel Universe, with very few peers, such as the Living Tribunal and the One-Above-All. The Infinity Gauntlet has a weakness: it can only work in the universe it was created in, and Galactus could exploit this weakness to defeat Thanos.

item.title: Galactus Faces the Living Tribunal in Mind-Blowing Fanart of Marvel s Cosmic Gods
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStunning fan art depicts a titanic struggle between Marvel’s cosmic beings Galactus and the Living Tribunal. The potential conflict between Galactus and the Living Tribunal could result in catastrophic destruction. The Living Tribunal’s immense power surpasses even Galactus, making the outcome of their battle inevitable. Literature ReviewIn an epic new piece of fan art from BossLogic, Galactus takes on the Living Tribunal in a battle sure to destroy the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Garfield 10 Funniest Holiday Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn one example, Garfield and Santa’s social media interaction adds a contemporary twist to the classic strip, showcasing its ability to stay relevant. Another comic cleverly intertwines humor and realism by depicting Jon’s struggles with the Homeowners Association, a relatable scenario for many readers. The running gag of Garfield and Odie attempting to catch a glimpse of Santa Claus on Christmas Eve is humorously portrayed in a different strip.

item.title: Gearshift Deku s Most Powerful Quirk In My Hero Academia Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeku’s most powerful Quirk in My Hero Academia is Gearshift, which allows him to manipulate the speed and trajectory of objects he touches. Gearshift goes beyond ordinary super-speed Quirks, as it can bend the laws of physics and inertia, allowing Deku to move at supersonic speeds. However, using Gearshift comes with consequences, such as immobilization and a time limit of five minutes, making it a last resort for Deku.

item.title: General Zod s New Empire Exposes the 1 Enemy He Hates More Than Superman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGeneral Zod now commands New Krypton, building the empire he’s always craved. However, his obsession with Superman’s father Jor-El threatens to bring it all tumbling down, and expose Zod’s true nature as a destroyer. Kneel Before Zod #1 is on sale from DC Comics on January 2! Literature ReviewGeneral Zod is one of Superman’s most dangerous enemies, but it’s not actually the Man of Steel who drives the Kryptonian warrior.

item.title: General Zod s Return Begins, as Superman s Nemesis Reveals Powerful New Army
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGeneral Zod is returning with a new Kryptonian army, as teased in the preview for Action Comics #1060, and this time he may be too powerful for Superman to handle. Zod has created an army of new Kryptonians, and is hiding this from the United Planets. If Zod succeeds in unleashing his new army, nowhere in the DC Universe will be safe from their terrifying power. Literature ReviewGeneral Zod is one of Superman’s most dangerous enemies, and now that he’s gotten everything he’s ever wanted, he’s begun building an army to keep it.

item.title: Genius Marvel Theory Explains Secret Reason the MCU Revolved Around Tony Stark
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMagic is not as powerful as it seems in the Marvel Universe. Science, represented by Iron Man, holds the true power, explaining why the MCU was so effectively anchored by Iron Man during its formative phases. Iron Man’s ability to think and strategize scientifically sets him apart from other superheroes who rely on magic or other sources of power. Science consistently counters and strips away magic in the Marvel Universe, proving its dominance, with Iron Man as its favored champion.

item.title: Genius My Hero Academia Twist Changes the Final Battle Completely
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShigaraki steals Deku’s Danger Sense quirk, introducing the possibility of Deku being quirkless for the final battle. Deku’s potential return to being quirkless brings his character full circle and could see him truly become a great hero as teased. The purpose of One For All in My Hero Academia is undecided, and saving Shigaraki may come at a great cost for Deku. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia just teased that Deku’s final battle may be completely different than fans anticipated with one simple yet unexpected twist.

item.title: Ghost Rider Final Vengeance Sees a Marvel Supervillain Become the New Spirit of Vengeance
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGhost Rider’s spirit has departed from Johnny Blaze and bonded with a villain, spelling trouble for the Marvel Universe. The new Ghost Rider’s identity has not been revealed yet, adding to the suspense and anticipation for fans. The potential for destruction and violence is high with a villain possessing the Spirit of Vengeance, presenting a threat to everything Ghost Rider stands for. Literature ReviewThe forthcoming Ghost Rider: Final Vengeance #1 will see a super-villain become the new host for the Spirit of Vengeance–but who will it be?

item.title: Ghost Rider Just Proved He Really Can Replace His Hellcycle with ANYTHING
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGhost Rider proves he can transform any vehicle into a blazing ride, including an office chair. Different Ghost Riders have used various vehicles throughout history, not just motorcycles. Robbie Reyes, the featured Ghost Rider, is the “All-Rider” with the ability to convert any vehicle into a flaming ride. Literature ReviewGhost Rider’s Hellcycle is his primary ride, but now Robbie Reyes has proven he can make one out of literally anything.

item.title: Ghost Rider Unleashes a Major New Power That Betrays His Purpose
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Ghost Rider’s use of his power to absolve the corrupt of their sins goes against his vital purpose and could lead to the end of Johnny Blaze’s time as the Spirit of Vengeance. In Ghost Rider #21, Talia and Johnny confront Talia’s former mentor and the cult of children he has indoctrinated. The Ghost Rider absorbs the evil possessing the children, leading them to realize their actions and be forgiven.

item.title: Ghost Rider vs Hulk Unleashes a New Weapon of Vengeance Hellfire Grenades
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGhost Rider gets a fearsome new weapon - hellfire grenades - in his battle against the Hulk in Incredible Hulk #7. The previous issue introduced a Ghost Rider resembling a WWII soldier, who attacks the Hulk with his hellfire pistol and grenades. The hellfire grenades slow down the Hulk but do not stop him, hinting at a bigger threat that the Ghost Rider has emerged to face. Other Ghost Riders should consider using these grenades too.

item.title: Godzilla s Strength Proves Every MonsterVerse Titan Is Way Stronger Than You Thought
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGodzilla’s strength is truly put to the test in his recent battle against Superman, proving that he has Superman-level strength. Godzilla’s victory over Superman elevates the status of every Titan he’s ever fought, showing that all the Titans in the MonsterVerse are as strong as Superman. The Titans in the MonsterVerse are way stronger than fans ever imagined, making them a truly terrifying force to reckon with. Literature ReviewGodzilla’s strength has been well noted in the MonsterVerse, but his latest battle confirms he & the other Titans are way stronger than fans thought.

item.title: Gogeta Vs Vegito Death Battle Already Settled the Strongest Super Saiyan Debate For Good
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVegito is stronger than Gogeta due to the method of fusion used, as the Potara fusion does not require one person to lower their power level like the Fusion Dance does. Death Battle! used every appearance of the two characters across different media to settle the debate, ensuring their analysis was comprehensive and considering canon and non-canon sources. While Death Battle! concludes that Vegito is stronger, Gogeta fans may still disagree and find counterarguments, such as Whis’ claim that Gogeta is stronger than Beerus.

item.title: Gohan s Best Dragon Ball Look Gets a Super Saiyan Powerup in Sick New Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGohan’s Supreme Kai clothing from the Majin Buu Saga is considered one of his best looks in the anime and manga Dragon Ball. Fan artist @DBSKAKERU1 creates impressive Dragon Ball fanart that rivals professional illustrations, showcasing their talent and skill. The fanart image depicts Gohan wearing his Supreme Kai clothing while powering up to the Super Saiyan level, creating a unique and badass design that fans can appreciate. Literature ReviewGohan has a lot of different looks in Dragon Ball lore, with the unique Kai costume he gets from Kibito getting a Super Saiyan upgrade in new fanart!

item.title: Goku Can Already Give Ultra Instinct a Massive Power-Up With One Classic Technique
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGoku’s Ultra Instinct form can be made even stronger by using the Kaio-ken technique. Goku has previously used the Kaio-ken to boost his god-like powers during the Dragon Ball Super anime. Combining Ultra Instinct with the Kaio-ken would likely make Goku the strongest fighter in the Dragon Ball franchise. Literature ReviewGoku’s newest Ultra Instinct form is incredibly powerful, but one trick used in Dragon Ball Super could make it multiple times stronger.

item.title: Goku s Newest Ultra Instinct Is His Strongest Dragon Ball Form Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGoku debuts a new version of Ultra Instinct, powered by his emotions, which makes him stronger than ever. This new form erases the weakness of being influenced by Goku’s emotions and allows him to reach unprecedented levels of power. The true nature and extent of Ultra Instinct’s power have yet to be explored, but Goku is likely to continue discovering new forms with the involvement of powerful beings like Whis or Frieza.

item.title: Golden Age Hollywood Meets Ruthless Incan Gods in ST. MERCY GODLAND
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe return of St. Mercy brings a new chapter, featuring a new cast and new dangers, as 1930s Hollywood meets the American West and Incan Gods. St. Mercy: Godland continues the stunning story of Mercedes Oro, known as St. Mercy, delivering occult and supernatural elements within its historical fiction context. The series’ heroine, Mercy, faces a bloody conflict as she struggles to protect cursed Incan gold. Literature ReviewSt. Mercy is returning from Image Comic imprint, Top Cow, and a partnership with EP1T0ME, bringing a clash between Incan Gods and Hollywood.

item.title: GOLGOTHA MOTOR MOUNTAIN #1 (Review)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGolgotha Motor Mountain #1 offers a stomach-churning taste of body horror with unusual characters, promising an ooze-filled, slimy, psychedelic sci-fi horror story. The series keeps readers in the dark, heightening the horror aspect, as even the reader doesn’t know what’s happening, or have all the facts they need to understand what the protagonists are up against. Golgotha is a dangerous township filled with degenerate characters, and the mystery of the old rock crash landing adds to the already existing danger.

item.title: Good Omens Set a New World Record in a 2023 Marked by Kickstarter Success Stories
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGood Omens broke records on Kickstarter in 2023, with a new adaptation raising over $3 million from almost 37,000 backers. Other pop culture franchises, such as The Expanse, Power Rangers, and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles also found success on Kickstarter in 2023. Crowdfunding is increasingly popular, and no longer the province of indie projects. Literature Review2023 saw Pratchett and Gaiman’s Good Omens scoop a new record, as the Kickstarter for a new adaptation performed better than anyone had imagined.

item.title: Gotham s Best Friendship 2 Misunderstood Batman Rogues Make the Perfect Team Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPoison Ivy and Killer Croc share a genuine friendship that goes beyond collaborating on crimes. Killer Croc reveals his fear of needles, and Poison Ivy is there for him in a vulnerable moment. Both Poison Ivy and Killer Croc are misunderstood villains with complicated pasts, which draws them closer together. Literature ReviewGotham villains are not normally portrayed as being best friends, but these two supervillains have a kinship revealed in one touching scene.

item.title: Gotham s New Vampire Hunter Has the Perfect Weapon for the DCU s Next Vamp Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman teams up with Santa Claus to battle vampires in Gotham City, bringing a festive twist to the crime-fighting scene. Santa Claus and his vampire-killing reindeer, Prancer, prove to be a formidable force against the Draug. Jeff Parker creatively weaves together Santa Claus and vampire lore, delivering an entertaining and logical narrative in this holiday special. Literature ReviewGotham ushers in a new guardian, a vampire hunter with a shocking identity and a weapon that promises to redefine the DCU’s supernatural battles.

item.title: Gotham s New Villain Is a Terrifying Reimagining of an Underrated Killer
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMoth-er, a new villain in Batman: Gargoyle of Gotham, takes a creepy twist on Killer Moth’s schtick. The Gotham in this storyline is devoid of Batman’s usual rogues’ gallery, but it’s just as twisted. Moth-er is far more unsettling and sinister than Killer Moth, with his ferocious attacks and wicked claws. Literature ReviewAn unsettling new villain comes to Gotham that vastly improves a motif popularized by one Batman rogue. Witness the debut of the creepy foe, Moth-er!

item.title: Gotham s Nightmare-Fuel Reinvention Finally Gives Two-Face the Perfect Superpower
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTwo-Face holds the key to saving Gotham City in Batman: City of Madness. Two-Face’s intimate connection to the nightmarish world of the Gotham Below makes him a crucial ally for Batman. Two-Face may very well prove to be the hero Gotham needs, even more than Batman, in the face of the Batman Below’s monsterous plans for the city and its inhabitants. Literature ReviewBatman has saved Gotham City countless times, but in the city’s latest dire moment of need, it’s not Batman who rises up, but Two-Face.

item.title: Grant Morrison s Favorite Wonder Woman Character Isn t Who You d Expect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGrant Morrison reveals their love for Wonder Woman’s kanga pet, Jumpa, showcasing their passion for animals in comics and the inspired element of the kangas in early Wonder Woman stories. Animal sidekicks were once popular for superheroes, and Morrison has included super-pets in their work, such as Bat-Cow in their Batman run, showcasing their love for animals. Jumpa and the other super-pets, including kangas, are an important part of Wonder Woman’s history and the legacy of super-pets lives on thanks to creators like Grant Morrison.

item.title: Green Arrow Officially Replaces Batman as DC s Anti-Justice League Contingency Plan
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow takes a page out of Batman’s book by spying on his fellow Justice League members to uncover the truth behind their disbandment. Oliver’s son questions the wisdom of spying, but Oliver is determined to uncover potential threats and doesn’t buy the League’s voluntary disbandment. Like Batman’s Brother Eye, Oliver’s surveillance could lead to severe consequences if the League members are uncompromised and discover the spying, potentially alienating Oliver from his friends.

item.title: Green Arrow Roasts Batman With a Heartbreaking Insult (And He s Not Wrong)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow’s scathing insult about Batman’s parenting hits him hard, exposing the strained relationships with his children. Despite Green Arrow’s claims of great parenting, his own history with Roy Harper shows his own struggles. Bruce grapples with issues across the board with all his children, with his least strained connection likely being with his daughter Cassandra Cain, though even they have encountered their share of challenges. Literature ReviewGreen Arrow lands a devastating verbal blow on Batman with a heartbreaking insult that promises to send the Dark Knight into sulk mode.

item.title: Green Arrow s 10 Most Bizarre Trick Arrows
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow’s trick arrows range from the bizarre to the useful, like the Sun Arrow that creates a sun but was only used once. The Fountain-Pen Arrow aids in following criminals with a line of ink, a common tool in his quiver. The Mirror Arrow allows for surveillance with mirrors, doubling as ricochet surfaces, and was seen in World’s Finest Comics. Literature ReviewGreen Arrow is known within DC Comics lore for his iconic trick arrows, but some of these arrows are less iconic and much more bizarre.

item.title: Green Arrow Showcases New Costume & Arrow Car Ahead of New Era
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow #7 marks Oliver Queen’s triumphant return to Earth-0 after a harrowing journey through time and space, setting the stage for a thrilling new era for the emerald archer. Oliver Queen indulges in a well-deserved makeover, treating himself to a fresh wardrobe and an upgraded vehicle, the Arrow Car. The debut of Green Arrow’s new ride and uniform symbolizes the beginning of an exciting new chapter for the character, promising readers a captivating and dynamic narrative ahead in the DC Comics realm.

item.title: Green Lantern Confirms DC s Humans Share 1 Superpower That All Aliens Lack
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEarthlings possess an incredible courage that sets them apart from other alien species, making them valuable Green Lantern recruits. Hal Jordan and other Earth-based Lanterns have proved that humans excel at overcoming fear, making them ideal candidates for the Corps. Earth’s high number of qualified ring-slingers is evidence of humanity’s overwhelming courage and strong willpower, ensuring a continuous supply of Green Lanterns. Literature ReviewGreen Lantern has seen hundreds of alien species in his time and he reveals there‚Äôs one thing that gives humanity an advantage over all of them.

item.title: Green Lantern Cosplay Debuts His Best Costume Design You ve Never Seen Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern cosplayer breaks tradition with a visually striking and unique costume design, showcasing the boundless creativity of the cosplay community. Instagram user Tchalla Uchiwa takes the creative reins in crafting this cinematic precision Green Lantern cosplay, with special attention to the intricate mask and armor elements. Collaboration between Uchiwa and Opium Shots elevates the cosplay to superhero artistry, seamlessly integrating the costume into dynamic action sequences and adding a realistic glow to the Lantern ring.

item.title: Green Lantern Cosplay Nails the DC Hero With 1 Extra Detail
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThis Green Lantern cosplay, from NYCC 2023, impresses with a detailed costume build and glowing green eyes, setting a high bar for other cosplayers. Photographer Elano Dallmeyer captured the intricate details of this Green Lantern cosplay, highlighting the cosplayer’s commitment to authenticity. The inclusion of glowing green eyes pays homage to John Stewart, one of the Corps’ most iconic members, while seeming to draw inspiration from several other versions of the character to create a unique look.

item.title: Green Lantern Finally Fixes a Major Fan Criticism of His Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHal Jordan defeats his nemesis Sinestro with a powerful mecha construct created with his new Power Ring upgrade. Sinestro’s newfound powers allow him to create a giant kaiju construct that threatens to destroy the Earth. Despite criticism for lacking imagination, Hal proves he’s a creative Green Lantern by producing an amazing mecha to defeat Sinestro. Literature ReviewWhen Green Lantern‚Äôs nemesis threatens to burn the Earth, Hal Jordan whips up a construct that saves the day and proves his critics wrong.

item.title: Green Lantern Just Hacked His Ring to Replicate a Major Kryptonian Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDespite no longer being a part of the Green Lantern Corps, Hal Jordan still has a ring and is utilizing his new Power Ring to unlock a surprising Kryptonian power. With his new Power Ring, Green Lantern is able to filter various lights from his vision, allowing him to locate and destroy a cloaked drone, angering Sinestro. Green Lantern’s new ring has enhanced his abilities and granted him vision comparable to Superman, suggesting the potential for even more power and further Kryptonian abilities in the future.

item.title: Green Lantern Lore Changes Forever with 1 Animated Character s Comics Debut
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern #6 introduces Razer from Green Lantern: The Animated Series as a new ally in Hal Jordan’s adventures. Jeremy Adams, writer of the animated series, brings Razer into the DC Universe, giving fans hope for closure to the show’s unresolved storyline. Fans of Green Lantern: The Animated Series are excited to see Razer and the possibility of an eventual reunion with Aya, the AI of the Interceptor. Literature ReviewRazer, a character that debuted in Green Lantern: The Animated Series, makes his debut in the DC Universe, hopefully to resolve a dormant cliffhanger.

item.title: Green Lantern Lore Changes Forever with a Brand-New Corps
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKorg, a possible son of Sinestro, leads a rebellion against his abusive caretaker and forms his own corps. Sinson, as he now calls himself, idolizes Sinestro and wants to follow in his footsteps. Sinson teams up with Lor-Zod, the son of General Zod, and his leadership skills may have a major impact on the Green Lantern mythology. Literature ReviewA new corps comes to the universe when the potential progeny of Green Lantern‚Äôs greatest enemy steps up to lead a new collective of tween villains.

item.title: Green Lantern s New Nemesis Is the 1 Villain Superman Officially Can Never Beat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Radiant Dead are a dangerous force that even Superman cannot withstand, making them the most formidable opponent for Green Lantern John Stewart in the character’s history The Radiant Dead are a cosmic plague that feeds off light and can consume any form of life, including the energies of Green Lanterns and Superman. John Stewart is the best hope against the Radiant Dead, as Green Latern: War Journal #3 repeatedly emphasizes, proving there are times when other DC heroes need to step up in place of Superman to defeat massive threats.

item.title: Green Lantern s New Origin Just Made the DC Icon Way, Way Darker
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAlan Scott’s new origin in Alan Scott: Green Lantern #2 takes on a much darker tone and adds depth to the character. The reinterpreted story includes the character Billie, a trans woman who is ultimately lobotomized, giving the origin a more tragic twist. The new origin adds a timely and dark layer to Alan Scott’s story, making it more compelling for modern audiences. Literature ReviewAlan Scott, the Golden Age Green Lantern, is getting a new origin, one that is far more timely, but also much darker.

item.title: Green Lantern s New Ring Has the Potential to Destroy the DCU
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Radiant Dead corrupt Lantern Rings, severing their connection to the Central Battery. Reverse-engineering Lantern Rings is now possible, making them available to other forces in the universe. Possession of these inert Lantern Rings could lead to a deadly arms race and potential destruction of the DC Universe. Literature ReviewThe repercussions of an untethered Green Lantern ring are wide-reaching and horrifying, as John Stewart is currently discovering in his newest story.

item.title: Green Lantern s New Ring Unveils Disturbing Extra Power That Should Belong to a Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern gains a new Power Ring and can use it to turn the tide against the Radiant Dead. With his new Ring, Green Lantern can track and spy on the Radiant Dead, giving him an advantage in taking them down. Despite the risks, Green Lantern’s years of military experience make him well-equipped to use the Radiant Dead’s hive mind against them. Literature ReviewGreen Lantern finally cures himself of his corruption with a new Power Ring that has a bonus power to help him defeat his dangerous new enemies.

item.title: Green Lantern s New Villains Are the Sick Opposite of a New Lantern Corps
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern Corps faces a new threat called the Radiant Dead, who are unlike any foe they have faced before, even worse than the Black Lanterns. The Radiant Dead can feast on any form of life, but they prefer to consume the energies of Lanterns, making them a truly insidious and existential threat to the Green Lantern Corps. The Radiant Dead are a cosmic menace with multiversal reach, capable of using the Lanterns’ own power against them, taking the worst aspects of the Corps’ most despicable foes to terrifying extremes.

item.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Mantis New Costume Is a Better Version of Venom
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMantis has revealed her new costume is an alien symbiote named Dress. Dress can tap into Mantis’ variants across the multiverse, granting her new armor and weaponry. Guardians of the Galaxy #9 is available now from Marvel Comics! Literature ReviewThe Guardians of the Galaxy’s Mantis just explained her new powers to Gamora, and it turns out her costume is a multiversal spin on Venom’s symbiotes. Warning: Spoilers Ahead for Guardians of the Galaxy #9!

item.title: Handmade Iron Man Cosplay Recreates Tony Stark s Armor Using Only Aluminum
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s “suitcase” armor, made entirely out of aluminum, is brought to life in impressive cosplay images by u/Ironcostumes. u/Ironcostumes is known for their professional metalwork skills and creating homemade Iron Man costumes that are exceptionally comic and film-accurate. The all-aluminum design of u/Ironcostumes’ Iron Man cosplay raises the bar for homemade suits and carves out a unique place in the cosplay community. Literature ReviewIron Man has lots of different armors to help him battle criminals, with a new Marvel cosplay bringing his “suitcase” armor to life in aluminum form!

item.title: Harley Quinn Cosplay Brings Back Iconic Gotham City Garage Costume
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAmanda’s Harley Quinn Gotham City Garage cosplay flawlessly captures the character’s iconic biker aesthetic, showcasing her meticulous attention to detail. The cosplay pays homage to the distinct rockabilly feel associated with Gotham City Garage, incorporating elements like high-waisted jeans, leather jackets, and tattoos. The cosplay serves as a reminder of fans’ enduring interest in Gotham City Garage, fueling hope for a potential resurgence of the beloved Elseworlds narrative. Literature ReviewHarley Quinn enthusiasts rejoice as a dedicated cosplayer pays homage to the past with a stunning revival of the Gotham City Garage costume.

item.title: Harley Quinn Debuts Her Ultimate Power (That Not Even Kryptonians Have)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn’s popularity has led to her being used in various mediums and portrayed in different ways, which can sometimes make it feel like DC doesn’t know what to do with her. Despite not having a defined core, Harley’s many permutations make her a fleshed-out character with depth and complexity, rather than just a gimmick. Harley’s meta superpower, the ability to break the fourth wall and be aware of her narrative, is a defining aspect of her character that sets her apart and gives her an incredible advantage.

item.title: Harley Quinn Is an Evil Marilyn Monroe in Jaw-Dropping Femme Fatale Redesign
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn gets a stunning new femme fatale look, inspired by Marilyn Monroe, in the cover art for Harley Quinn: Black + White + Redder #6. The cover art beautifully captures Harley’s deadly and gorgeous nature, showcasing her as one of DC’s most prominent, most captivating femme fatale character. It remains to be seen whether Harley’s new look is only featured on the cover, or will appear within one of the three stories contained in the final issue, all of which promise exciting adventures for Harley Quinn fans.

item.title: Harley Quinn s AI Redesign Is the Creepiest She s Looked in Years
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAn AI version of Harley Quinn gives the antihero a creepy redesign with glitchy artwork and a Purge-style mask. AI Harley Quinn’s ability to learn makes it Harley’s biggest threat in the comics yet. Earth-48’s attempt at harnessing Harley’s chaotic energy could backfire because of AI Harley’s abilities. Literature ReviewAs Harley Quinn’s multiversal misadventures continue, DC unveils a monstrous AI version of the anti-hero ‚Äî and she’s absolutely terrifying.

item.title: Harley Quinn s Classic Costume Makes Her the Perfect Jack-in-the-Box in New Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn’s classic jester costume makes a triumphant return in a new comic cover, showing off her playful and chaotic spirit. The iconic outfit, which was ditched when Harley split with the Joker, still captures her wild and unpredictable essence. While Harley doesn’t need to permanently revert back to her classic look, this cover proves that it’s too good to be hidden away. Literature ReviewShe may have switched up her look, but Harley Quinn‚Äôs classic harlequin outfit makes a comeback in an impressive variant cover by Elizabeth Torque.

item.title: Harry Styles MCU Hero Just Got the Perfect Nickname in Marvel Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark and Emma Frost’s marriage is a strategic alliance, but they still have a strong bond, one that continues to grow closer to legitimate feelings with each passing issue. Eros, aka Starfox, tries to flirt with Emma in Invincible Iron Man #13, but she swiftly shuts him down, giving him the derisive nickname “Hornfox” in the process. The issue ends with Tony and Emma’s connection strengthened by Eros’ failed attempt to come between them.

item.title: Hawkman Cosplay Proves He Should ve Been as R-Rated as Wolverine
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHawkman’s rich comic history and brutal background on Thanagar make him a character who could have been as R-rated as Wolverine. Christian Perera’s amazing Hawkman cosplay perfectly captures the character’s savage nature and volatile personality. DC should let Hawkman cut loose and embrace his violent urges, as this cosplay shows the potential for him to be in the same league as Wolverine. Literature ReviewCosplayer Christian Perera has brought Hawkman to amazing life, proving the Thanagarian should be as R-rated as Wolverine.

item.title: Heartwarming New Superman Lore Confirms What Fans Have Always Known
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s big heart and sense of responsibility were evident even before he had superpowers. At just 6 years old, he wished for a new coffee maker for his parents on Christmas, showing his selflessness. The holiday series Batman/Santa Claus: Silent KNight reveals the childhood wishes of the Justice League members, showcasing their more innocent and childlike sides. Even Damian Wayne, raised to be an assassin, once asked for satellites to track his enemies.

item.title: Hellboy Becomes A Samurai Warrior In Amazing New Fan Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHellboy as a samurai in feudal Japan would be a charming and fitting concept for a “What If?” scenario. Japan has been featured in Hellboy stories before and could provide a rich setting for new adventures. Francesco Francavilla, known for his pulp-inspired art, would be a perfect fit to illustrate a Hellboy story set in any historical setting. Literature ReviewCelebrated artist Francesco Francavilla shares an incredible piece of Hellboy fan art, which sees Big Red become a samurai…

item.title: Heroes For Hire 10 Badass Luke Cage & Iron Fist Moments
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage and Iron Fist are iconic and badass Heroes for Hire in Marvel Comics history. The duo have had intense moments, like Iron Fist fighting Sabretooth or Luke Cage trying to kill Doctor Doom over $200. They have also achieved incredible feats, such as beating the Kingpin in Devil’s Reign, saving the Hulk’s life during Heroes Reborn, and even preventing World War III. Literature ReviewLuke Cage and Iron Fist are the iconic Marvel Comics duo, the Heroes for Hire, with no shortage of badass moments between them.

item.title: Hilarious Isekai Satire is a Must Read For Any Fan of the Genre
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEveryone Is From Another World, Except Me!? satirizes the isekai genre and appeals to both veteran fans and newcomers. The series features a high number of isekai’d characters, each representing a different stereotypical isekai protagonist, adding to the comical delivery. The unique twist of the protagonist, Rocco, not leaving his world allows for a fresh perspective on isekai clich√©s and personalizes his storyline, making it stand out from typical isekai series.

item.title: Hilarious Webcomic Shows How Robin Can Beat Two-Face with 1 Insult
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRobin defeats Two-Face with a low blow insult, showing that a joke can be more powerful than weapons. The webcomic received positive reception for its absurd and hilarious concept of defeating a dangerous villain with a cruel remark. In canon, Two-Face would likely respond with violence, but the comic strip presents a fun and unexpected twist on the characters. Literature ReviewIn a humorous Batman comic by artist Raul Higuera, Robin defeats Two-Face, but not with advanced tech or weapons.

item.title: Homelander vs Omni-Man, Power Ranger Wolverine 2023 s Best Fanart Created the Pop Culture Mash-Ups We Didn t Know We Needed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY2023 saw groundbreaking changes in comic book media, inspiring fans to create jaw-dropping fanart that rivals professional work. Fanart allowed for new scenarios and mash-ups with beloved characters, such as Homelander vs Omni-Man and a Power Ranger Wolverine. The quality and creativity of fanart, like Nightwing as a Jedi knight and the Avengers in classic comic book costumes, was astounding in 2023. Literature ReviewFans did not hold back when it came to creating jaw-dropping pieces of fanart in 2023 - & Screen Rant was there to cover them all.

item.title: How and When Marvel Introduced the Multiverse Concept into Official Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Multiverse was introduced in 1976’s What If #1, with a story that asked “What If Spider-Man Joined The Fantasitc Four?” Marvel’s iconic What If…? series established the Multiverse, but it also laid a successful blueprint for telling Multiverse stories, one that the company has stuck to consistently throughout the years. The introduction of the Multiverse in Marvel Comics has been integral to the company’s success, influencing each of its major franchises, being central to crossover events, and more recently, taking a pivotal role in the MCU.

item.title: How Demon Slayer s Muzan Originally Became The First Demon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMuzan Kibutsuji, the big villain of Demon Slayer, is not only the mastermind behind the heroes’ troubles, but he is also the creator of nearly every demon they encounter. Muzan creates other demons by giving his blood to humans, transforming them and granting incredible powers, but those who can’t handle the mutation die. Muzan’s ultimate goal is to find the Blue Spider Lily, a rare flower that caused his accidental transformation into a demon, in order to regain his ability to tolerate sunlight and eliminate his weakness.

item.title: How Gods Work in the Rick and Morty Multiverse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRick and Morty explains how gods work in their universe, revealing that humans birth and influence these deities. Gods in the Rick and Morty multiverse rely on human worship and obsession for their power. The concept of Anti Hala is introduced, a place where gods go when they die and can be reborn. Literature ReviewThere’s lots of gods traipsing around the Rick and Morty universe, with a comic adventure telling fans exactly how they work and where they came from.

item.title: How Luffy Got His Scars in One Piece Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuffy’s scars in One Piece are a reflection of his energetic and driven personality, as they were acquired through his intense and sometimes reckless actions. His first scar came from stabbing himself in the face to prove his toughness to Shanks, while his second scar resulted from being burned during the aftermath of Ace’s death. These scars serve as reminders of Luffy’s past mistakes and tragedies, but also highlight his determination to grow stronger and overcome future failures.

item.title: How Tall The Punisher Is In Marvel Lore (& How He Compares to Other Heroes)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Punisher is a formidable anti-hero known for his vast arsenal of weapons, battlefield smarts, and intimidating size. Punisher’s official height is just above six feet, making him taller than some iconic Marvel heroes like Black Panther and Spider-Man, but shorter than Captain America and Deadpool. The Punisher’s height adds to his threatening and imposing presence, allowing him to stand out among other heroes, except for Wolverine who matches his strength and skills despite being shorter.

item.title: Howard the Duck Gets an Appropriately Nutty 50th Anniversary Celebration (Review)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel celebrates Howard the Duck’s 50th anniversary with a nutty one-shot that captures his satirical and surreal charm. Howard the Duck broke new ground in the Marvel Universe as an outsider character who criticizes and pokes fun at society. The one-shot tribute hits on Howard’s infamous presidential run and interactions with other Marvel heroes, honoring his darkly humorous tone. Literature ReviewHoward the Duck is a cult icon at Marvel, and now he is getting an appropriately nutty 50th anniversary celebration.

item.title: Hugh Jackman Already Adapted Wolverine s Most Brutal Fight Scene... In a Totally Different Franchise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHugh Jackman’s portrayal of Wolverine in live-action has made him synonymous with the character, even in other roles. In the film Van Helsing, Hugh Jackman’s character kills Dracula in a brutal fight the exact same way Wolverine killed Dracula in an issue of What If?. The similarity between Wolverine and Van Helsing’s fight scenes is accidental but notable, showcasing Hugh Jackman’s influence on both characters. Literature ReviewHugh Jackman is the only live-action Wolverine & many fans only see him that way.

item.title: Hulk Is Incredibly Vulnerable to 1 Mutant Power, No Matter How Strong He Gets
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Hulk has many upgrades and powers, but he is vulnerable to Magik’s mutant powers. Magik can access Limbo through portals and can transport herself and others anywhere. Magik can defeat the Hulk by transporting him to the sun or cutting up his body with a spell. Literature ReviewThe Hulk has varying degrees of forms/power-levels, each one stronger than the last, but no matter how strong he gets, 1 mutant power will always win.

item.title: Hulkbuster Cosplay Gives Punisher His Own Gigantic Iron Man Suit
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Punisher dons his own Hulkbuster armor in a new cosplay design, giving him the tools to take on The Hulk. Cosplay account @bearded_tattooed_guy_in_ga specializes in creating larger-than-life costumes of oversized comic book heroes. The Punisher’s new Hulkbuster cosplay design marries the armor’s proportions with his blacked-out skull-branded look, creating an epic and never-before-seen Marvel Comics look. Literature ReviewThe Hulkbuster armor was made specifically to take out the behemoth that is the Incredible Hulk, with a new cosplay giving Punisher his very own set!

item.title: Hunter x Hunter Author Finally Explains The Most Tearful Scene In The Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHunter X Hunter author Yoshihiro Togashi revealed the inspiration behind the iconic final moments of Meruem and Komugi in a recent interview. The scene was inspired by a manga about the Hiroshima bombing, Town of Evening Calm, Country of Cherry Blossoms, and features white speech bubbles on blacked-out backgrounds. Togashi also drew inspiration from other emotional manga moments, such as the conclusion of Ashita no Joe and Raoh’s death in Fist of the North Star, to craft the emotional impact of Meruem’s death.

item.title: Hunter x Hunter Author Just Dismissed A Big Fan Misconception About The Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHunter x Hunter’s creator Yoshihiro Togashi increased the amount of dialogue in the manga to provide fans with a more meaningful and detailed story experience, not because of his health. Togashi wanted to convey important information and develop background characters through written words rather than visuals, leading to an increase in dialogue and internal monologs. Togashi emphasizes the importance of writing in character development and storytelling, stating that “words rule” in his creative process.

item.title: Hunter x Hunter s Story Would Be Completely Different If The Author Had His Way
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHunter x Hunter’s creator Yoshihiro Togashi originally wanted Gon to fail the Hunter Exam and have a time skip of several years before trying again. The idea was rejected by Togashi’s editor, resulting in Gon passing the exam and maintaining some elements of the original story in Killua’s initial failure. Editors play a crucial role in shaping manga, as seen with Togashi’s rejected idea and Naruto’s Chuunin Exam arc, which became successful.

item.title: Huntress Becomes Gotham s Deadliest Woman Alive in Twisted Bat-Family Transformation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHuntress is infected by a beast spore and transformed into a panther, making her one of the deadliest members of the Bat-Family in Gotham. Huntress has always been the black sheep of the Bat-Family, willing to use lethal force and often clashing with Batman. In her panther form, Huntress becomes more driven to hunt down and destroy corruption in Gotham, making her even more dangerous. Literature ReviewHuntress may be an underrated Bat-Family member, but after one terrifying Beast World transformation, she’s the deadliest woman in Gotham.

item.title: Hush Cosplay Is the Most Terrifying Version of the Gotham Villain Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHush, a criminal mastermind and iconic Batman villain, needs a live-action debut in the DCEU as soon as possible. Brad Johnson’s cosplay as Hush perfectly captures the terrifying nature of the character with a mummified look, dirtied coat, and psychotic expression. Hush deserves more respect as a staple villain of Batman lore and now has a cosplay design worthy of that respect, making it time to bring him into the DCEU proper.

item.title: If Star Wars Rebels Had Faced Palpatine on Coruscant, They d Have Lost in Minutes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe recent failure of the Scourge to attack Emperor Palpatine on Coruscant proves that if the Rebels had done so, they would have lost in minutes. Palpatine has detonation defenses surrounding his palace and the city of Coruscant, which would decimate any invading Rebel forces. Palpatine’s ability to use Force lightning and his willingness to sacrifice civilian lives make him an even more formidable opponent on Coruscant than on the Death Star.

item.title: Iman Vellani Wants To Adapt Her Mutant-Heavy Comic Run In A Future Ms. Marvel Season
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIman Vellani wants her Ms. Marvel comic run to be adapted for a future season of the Disney+ series. Her comic deals with Ms. Marvel being a mutant in the public eye, which could become more relevant in the MCU when the X-Men are introduced. A second season of Ms. Marvel could explore the world’s reaction to her mutant status and expand on Vellani’s portrayal of the character. Literature ReviewExclusive: Iman Vellani shares her interest in adapting her Ms.

item.title: In 2023, Marvel Began Assembling A Twisted Version of the Avengers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel has introduced evil counterparts of its most recognizable characters, creating a potential villainous version of the Avengers. Characters like Toranos, General Strange, and Hydra-Cap are direct correlations to Thor, Doctor Strange, and Captain America. Feilong’s takeover of Stark Industries and use of Iron Man tech represents the malformation of everything Iron Man stands for, and to this point he has done everything short of suiting up in his own armor.

item.title: In the Era of the Multiverse, Marvel Shouldn t Forget About Parallel Dimensions
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Multiverse offers endless storytelling potential, but the company shouldn’t neglect the possibilities of exploring other dimensions, as a way of introducing unique, fresh entities into the main Marvel Universe. Pre-Multiverse depictions of alternate dimensions, like the Human Torch’s adventure in Strange Tales #103, showcase parallel dimensions that operate distinctively from the Multiverse concept. Marvel has recently shown willingness to embrace weirder and wilder storytelling; its current roster of creative talents should draw inspiration from classic stories, like the Human Torch’s interdimensional tale, to create dynamic narratives that go beyond the Multiverse.

item.title: Incredible New Jujutsu Kaisen Art Brings Gojo s Prison Realm to Life With a Surprising Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCosplayer and streamer @ChuRuuna created a fan art cake based on the infamous Prison Realm from Jujutsu Kaisen, capturing its unique cube-like shape and worn texture. The artist added a special touch by replacing the cube’s red eyes with Gojo’s blue pupils, giving the impression that he is trapped inside the cake. Kenjaku’s plan to trap Gojo in the Prison Realm required years of work and preparation, but he could have easily lured him with ChuRuuna’s cake due to Gojo’s love for sweets.

item.title: Inhumans Fanart Makes Marvel s Most Unique Superpower Look Real
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMedusa’s unique ability to use her long and luxurious hair as a weapon is brilliantly showcased in BossLogic’s fan art. The Inhumans, a society of superhumans with diverse powers, were given a big push by Marvel in the 2010s but their live-action adaptation fell short. BossLogic’s artwork honors the creative brilliance of Jack Kirby and Stan Lee by beautifully highlighting Medusa’s dangerous and cool abilities. Literature ReviewThe Inhumans’ Medusa has one of Marvel’s most unique powers, and now artist BossLogic has brought it to spectacular life.

item.title: Injustice 3 Gets the Perfect Villain, as Joker Returns to Life with New Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFans finally get their wish as the Joker returns to the Injustice universe, setting the stage for a potential Injustice 3. The resurrection of the Joker is a significant event, considering his death played a pivotal role in tearing apart the Injustice world. The return of the Joker hints at a future Injustice project, as the franchise needs a major villain to continue its dark and chaotic narrative. Literature ReviewThe Injustice franchise is one of DC’s best alternate universes, and Joker’s return just gave it the new lease on life it needs.

item.title: Injustice Why the Justice League Sided with Superman When He Turned Evil
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s success in the Injustice Universe was largely due to the support of his Justice League allies, who each had their own unique reasons for joining him. Wonder Woman’s character in the Injustice Universe was drastically changed after her discovery that Steve Trevor was a Nazi agent, leading her to embrace Superman’s dark methods. The Flash initially supported Superman but eventually had a crisis of conscience and decided to betray him, realizing that Superman’s brutality needed to be stopped.

item.title: Invincible s Apocalyptic THE INVINCIBLE WAR Is Impossible to Adapt Without Huge Changes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“The Invincible War” in Invincible #60 features an army of alternate Invincibles and a lineup of Image Comics guest stars. The TV adaptation will likely have to make significant changes since the guest stars are owned by their respective creators. Despite the absence of guest stars, the story still delivers dramatic moments and a strong narrative. Literature ReviewThe Invincible War was a huge event in the original Invincible comics, but it will be almost impossible to adapt for the Amazon TV series.

item.title: Invincible vs the Hulk Invincible s Creators Agreed 1 Power Settles the Winner
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInvincible’s ability to fly gives him a crucial advantage over the Hulk in a fight. The Hulk’s inability to fly leaves him vulnerable to attacks that Invincible can easily evade. While fans may have differing opinions, from a creator’s perspective, Invincible would defeat the Hulk due to his gift of flight. Literature ReviewInvincible and the Hulk have each fought some of the most intense battles in comics. But how do they stack up against each other?

item.title: Invincible Why Viltrumites Have Mustaches But Mark Doesn t (& Won t)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYViltrumites have a tradition of sporting mustaches, which represent their cultural identity and allegiance to Viltrum. Mark, despite being a Viltrumite, chooses not to grow a mustache as he sees it as a symbol of the violent past and wants to move forward. Mark’s decision to remain clean-shaven reflects his commitment to breaking the cycle of the Viltrumites’ old ways and leading them towards change and a better future.

item.title: Iron Fist s Powers Are Fully Unleashed in Fan Art Redeeming the Hero Netflix Failed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Iron Fist is honored with beautiful fan artwork, reminding readers why they want to see the hero on-screen. The image showcases Iron Fist’s full power and the depth of his character, making it clear that he is a force to be reckoned with in the Marvel Universe. Netflix’s portrayal of Iron Fist did not do justice to the character’s full potential, and Marvel should bring a new version of the hero into the MCU with more vocal supporters like Kode Abdo cheering him on.

item.title: Iron Lad, Illuminati, and The Parkers Every Promise Marvel Needs To Keep From 2023s Ultimate Universe Reboot
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s New Ultimate Universe, with Jonathan Hickman at the helm, has built up a lot of anticipation, with the Ultimate Invasion miniseries making a lot of promises that the new slate of ongoing Ultimate titles should strive to keep. The new Ultimate Universe is irrevocably tied to the memory of the original incarnation of the imprint (2000-2015) ‚Äì as a result, it should consciously work to be its own, distinct version of the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Iron Man Cosplay Showcases the Coolest Armor the MCU Didn t Use
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCosplayer CarnageCosplay unveils an extraordinary Iron Man suit, known as the Model-Prime Armor AKA Model 51, showcasing the suit’s stealth mode design. The remarkable quality of this Iron Man cosplay serves as a reminder that Marvel missed an opportunity by not featuring this suit in its cinematic universe. While the chances of seeing this suit in the MCU are slim, there is hope that it might make a comeback in the pages of Iron Man comics.

item.title: Iron Man Debuts His Ultimate Suit - Immune to Magic & Captain Marvel-Level Strength
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark has designed a new Iron Man suit made from mysterium, an anti-magic mutant metal, to defeat his archenemy Feilong and Orchis. The mysterium suit is radiation-proof, allowing Iron Man to safely face Feilong and his radioactive abilities. Iron Man and Emma Frost are ready for a final showdown, using the new suit to take the battle directly to Feilong and regain their power. Literature ReviewThe cover for Invincible Iron Man #16, from artist Kael Ngu, reveals Tony’s much anticipated new mysterium armor, designed by artist Pepe Larraz.

item.title: Iron Man Is Recruiting the 1 Mutant Who Can Turn Him into a God
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark teams up with mutant innovator Forge to create new technology and battle his enemies. Iron Man plans to use the mutant metal mysterium to create a new set of armor with the help of Forge, Ironheart, and the blacksmith Eitri. Forge’s innovation and mutant gift, along with Ironheart’s genius, could help Tony achieve a godlike state and fight against an army of Stark Sentinels. Literature ReviewThe cover for The Invincible Iron Man #14 reveals that Tony will be teaming up with the powerful mutant innovator Forge to create an epic new armor.

item.title: Iron Man s Wolverine-Buster Armor Is His Deadliest Anti-Hero Contingency Suit
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s Argonaut suit, made of Antarctic Vibranium, is a deadly counter to Wolverine’s adamantium-laced body. Antarctic Vibranium destabilizes adamantium, potentially beyond what Wolverine’s healing factor can handle. Tony Stark is aware of the suit’s capabilities and would use it against Wolverine if necessary. Literature ReviewIron Man has a history of building armor to contend with heroes gone rogue, but his anti-adamantium suit is a particularly brutal countermeasure. Iron Man and Wolverine are two of the most prolific heroes in the Marvel Universe, having saved the world, and their respective teams, countless times.

item.title: Iron Man s Ex Just Became Marvel s New Most Dangerous Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMadame Masque is revealed to be alive and is the mastermind behind the gang war in New York City. She manipulates the crime families and plans to take over their territories. The Gang War event will transform New York City and shake up the criminal landscape for Marvel’s heroes. Spider-Man is building his own team to fight in the war. Madame Masque may have the best odds in the gang war, as she is a skilled manipulator and knows how to play the crime families against each other.

item.title: Iron Man s First Addiction Wasn t Alcohol, & It Explains Why He Hates His New Enemy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s biggest addiction is not alcohol, but war, as revealed in Avengers #7. This provides a new perspective on his character’s current arc, as well as his actions throughout his history. Iron Man’s ongoing feud with the villain Feilong is driven by his addiction to war, as highlighted by Nightmare in Avengers #7. This new insight changes the way readers view their conflict. Tony Stark’s addiction to war is resurfacing and becoming more intense, as seen in Invincible Iron Man #8.

item.title: Iron Man s New Codename Proves His Armor Is Evolving Like Never Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark’s newest era as Iron Man begins with the ultimate new Mark 72 armor and the codename “Mysterium Man.” Tony’s secret war against his archenemy Feilong reaches a bombastic conclusion as he plans to use his advanced mutant metal armor to take down the Stark Sentinels. Tony’s marriage to Emma Frost has been fruitful, as their partnership has allowed him to access mysterium and create a fleet of mysterium ships to battle against Orchis.

item.title: Iron Man s X-Men Era Will Be Defined By His Team-Up With 1 Mutant (Who Hates Him)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Invincible Iron Man #14 will feature Tony Stark and Emma Frost seeking help from mutant inventor Forge to defeat the villainous Feilong. Forge “loathes"Tony Stark, but also respects him as a genius, creating a dynamic that will be exciting to see explored more fully in Invincible Iron Man #14 If Tony can earn Forge’s respect, it could lead to a major character shift, and potentially make Iron Man a true ally to the X-Men and all mutants.

item.title: Iron Man vs Sentry How Tony Stark Beat Marvel s Strongest Man Alive
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man outsmarted the powerful Sentry by hacking into “Cloc” and overwhelming him with cries for help, exploiting the Sentry’s fragile mental state. As is often the case, Tony Stark’s intellect was his greatest strength in the fight. Despite not having the raw power to physically defeat superpowered opponents such as the Sentry, Iron Man’s ability to out-think his opponents has consistently proven to be his best asset. Tony Stark is one of Earth’s mightiest heroes for a reason.

item.title: Isekai Meets Old-School Shonen is Exciting New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Magician Who Rose From Failure is a refreshing isekai manga that follows a protagonist who has to work hard to catch up to others. The manga breaks the typical isekai trope by featuring a weak hero who needs to study for two years before showing any progress. The story combines elements of shonen manga and isekai, allowing the protagonist’s past life to influence events in the new world.

item.title: It s a Very Sci-Fi Christmas in Exclusive Preview for Top Cow s ANTARCTICA #6
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAntarctica #6 delves deeper into Hannah Curtis’ past and her complicated family dynamic. The series combines time- and dimension-traveling elements with familial struggles. The new preview sets the stage for a new story arc, making it a perfect jumping on point for new readers. Literature ReviewDespite the hot chocolate and Christmas movies, all is not as it seems in this preview for ANTARCTICA #6, as exclusively shared by Screen Rant.

item.title: It s Not Batman s Fault! - DC Explains the Real Reason Its Darkest Villains Flock to Gotham
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGotham City is a unique and dangerous place that attracts villains, who view it as the ultimate proving ground for crime and corruption. The presence of Batman is not the sole reason why villains flock to Gotham; it is the city itself that draws them in. The Penguin seeks to conquer Gotham City, and his alliance with a former love interest reveals the true nature of the city and its appeal to villains.

item.title: It s Official Loki is Worthy of Lifting Thor s Mjolnir
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLoki is confirmed to be worthy of lifting Thor’s hammer, Mjolnir, for the first time in official Marvel canon. In The Immortal Thor #5, Loki confidently catches and wields the hammer, showcasing his growth and heroism. Previously, there were doubts about Loki’s worthiness, but now he has the opportunity to embrace his new adventures with confidence and be the hero he’s meant to be. Literature ReviewMarvel finally confirms that Loki is actually worthy enough to wield his brother’s hammer Mjolnir, and this time, there’s no confusion about it.

item.title: It s Official Marvel s Shocking Team of Avenger Sidekicks Are Actually Joining Its Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s New Champions Variant Cover series designs are officially becoming canon, bringing creative and stunning new sidekicks for Marvel heroes to life. Timeless (2023) #1 reveals that some of the New Champions will enter the main Earth-616 universe, but their exact role and connection to other heroes remains uncertain. Maystorm, a powerful mutant high schooler inspired by Storm, will play a major role in Marvel’s Ultimate X-Men series, confirming the first canon New Champion.

item.title: It s Time for DC to Bring Back Superman s Green Lantern Son
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Elseworlds imprint is making a comeback, presenting the opportunity to revisit the concept of Superman’s Green Lantern son from Superman: Distant Fires. The story of Superman: Distant Fires was set in a post-apocalyptic world, and featured Superman and Wonder Woman becoming romantically involved, resulting in a son named Bruce. Fans have been waiting for a follow-up to Superman: Distant Fires for 25 years; the new Elseworlds series presents the ideal opportunity to explore the development of Bruce Kent as a Green Lantern.

item.title: It s Time for Galactus Venom Form to Return (Fulfilling a Broken Promise from the 90s)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel should follow up on Galactus-Venom, a combination of the two iconic villains that it teased back in 1992. Venom, as well as Galactus, have become more heroic characters over the years, evolving away from their antagonistic origins. Combining the two would be a great way to further their respective journies while fulfilling the promise of Galactus-Venom. Galactus-Venom could be the only one capable of stopping the dangerous and powerful god-level Carnage, making his resurrection crucial for the sake of salvation.

item.title: James Bond Meets Sci-Fi Road Trip as Grant Morrison Announces New POISON PEACH Comic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPoison Peach, self-published by Grant Morrison, is a classic Morrison comic filled with teenage angst, pulpy action, and ridiculous sci-fi concepts. The comic, featuring art by Liam Sharp, is part of the Xanaduum Presents one-shot series that condenses a complete story into just fifteen pages. With its twisted take on a classic pulp genre and exaggerated artwork, Poison Peach is a bite-sized comic snack that celebrates and annihilates classic genre and comic book form.

item.title: James Bond Reaches a New Level of Ruthlessness with Target Too Edgy for the Movies
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJames Bond 007 #1 arrives in January 2024, celebrating ten years of Dynamite Entertainment publishing Bond comics. Bond will face his greatest challenge yet as he hunts down a former Double-0 agent. The creative team of Garth Ennis and Rafa Lobosco present a ruthless Bond, wiping out an entire crime family, including the elderly matriarch. Literature ReviewJames Bond’s 007 is returning to comics with a brand new series next year, including ruthless violence too extreme for the movies.

item.title: Jango Fett Reveals Jabba Had Something Even Worse Than A Rancor in His Collection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJabba the Hutt was likely given a collection of pet monsters before his deadly rancor. Someone was collecting monsters to make a living Dejarik holo-chess game, which would make a horrifyingly perfect gift for Jabba After facing a k’lor’slug meant for Jabba, Jango Fett is being hunted by Aurra Sing while searching for a valuable statue (and a showdown is imminent). Literature ReviewThe infamous bounty hunter Jango Fett once discovered that Jabba the Hutt wanted something far worse for his palace pets before his fearsome rancor.

item.title: Jean Grey Cosplay Unleashes the Full Force of X-Men s Most Unbeatable Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJean Grey’s Phoenix incarnation is one of the most powerful X-Men, a fact fans are reminded of by cosplayer Rebecca Rose’s portrayal of the character’s fiery transformation. Along with Soul Studio’s visual enhancements, Rose’s costume demonstrates the dedication and skill of the cosplay community, as well as pays homage to Jean Grey’s iconic role in X-Men comics. This cosplay exemplifies the evolving art form of cosplay, showcasing how cosplayers bring their favorite characters to life in increasingly incredible ways.

item.title: John Constantine s Final Form Just Turned Him into a DC God
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine’s ultimate form is revealed in Batman Beyond: Neo-Gothic #5. He becomes a sick, twisted, and powerful being after death. Constantine now refers to himself as the embodiment of the Green, feeling no pain and surpassing death. He is encased in a shadowy black casing. Despite his dark nature, Constantine still holds heroic qualities and goes out of his way to protect children, showing his true character even in his new form.

item.title: Jojo s Bizarre Adventure Tops Itself With a New Weirdest Stand Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter 10 of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure part 9 introduces a ridiculously unique Stand ability that allows the user to merge into the background. The ability breaks the fourth wall by acknowledging the framing of the manga panels, creating artistic opportunities for the mangaka. Although the Stand is stealthy, it lacks offensive capabilities, leading the user to fight with a knife. Literature ReviewChapter 10 of The JojoLands has introduced a Stand user with what might be the most absurd ability yet in the series, and he’s just an underling.

item.title: JoJo s Stands & Dragon Ball s Fusions Merge In Exciting Shonen Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJiangshi X introduced a fusion technique similar to Dragon Ball Z, allowing daoshi warriors to merge with their spiritual beings, which are similar to the stands from JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure. Jiuli demonstrates this technique by fusing with his Shen Ling, enabling him to defeat a powerful jiangshi with a single swing of his sword. The introduction of fusion techniques hints at the possibility of multiple fusion options and exciting transformations in future chapters of Jiangshi X.

item.title: Joker Cosplay Recreates His JOKER WAR Batsuit in Real Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA talented cosplayer brings the Joker War batsuit from DC Comics to life, showcasing what a Joker Batman could look like on the big screen. u/Cosplayben is known for creating accurate cosplay designs, including for DC and Marvel characters, and has perfected the iconic Joker batsuit. The Joker War storyline stripped Bruce Wayne of his wealth and reputation, while showcasing new characters like Harley Quinn and Punchline, making the Joker batsuit a significant part of the narrative.

item.title: Joker Is Gotham s Most Tragic Villain (Because His Madness CAN Be Cured)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Joker can be cured of his madness through a technological procedure, as shown in the Marvel and DC crossover comic Spider-Man and Batman #1. The procedure completely removes the Joker’s homicidal urges, reducing him to a scared child. The Joker is rendered harmless and expresses no interest in harming others. While the Joker has been cured of his insanity multiple times in the past, it is important to find the right circumstances for a successful cure.

item.title: Joker Only Killed Robin to Stop Another Villain Doing It First
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTwo-Face nearly kills Dick Grayson’s Robin before the infamous murder of Jason Todd at the hands of the Joker. Dick Grayson survives a near-death experience at the hands of Two-Face, leading to Batman firing him as Robin. The Joker fulfills his promise to kill Robin by murdering Jason Todd, making him the first villain to claim a Robin. Literature ReviewOne of the Joker’s worst crimes is killing Jason Todd ‚Äî and it turns out he only did it so another villain wouldn’t beat him to the punch.

item.title: Joker s Original 1928 Film Inspiration Just Entered Public Domain (& He s Terrifying)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe German Expressionist film “The Man Who Laughs” has entered the public domain. Creators are now free to use elements from “The Man Who Laughs” for their own profit. The Joker’s inspiration, Gwynplaine, is a misunderstood hero and tragic figure, different from the Joker’s villainous nature. Literature ReviewAs 1928’s The Man Who Laughs enters public domain, comic fans just gained ownership of the movie character who inspired Batman’s nemesis the Joker.

item.title: Jubilee Obliterates a Sentinel Army in Cosplay of X-Men s Underrated 90s Powerhouse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Jubilee cosplayer wows audiences with their impressive portrayal of the X-Men hero, showcasing their mutant powers and obliterating a Sentinel army. Pat Loika’s digital editing skills elevate HalloReena’s Jubilee cosplay into an epic rendition that authentically portrays the character’s mutant powers. HalloReena’s standout cosplay and the demand for more Jubilee-centric material highlight the desire for additional stories and portrayals of this beloved mutant. Literature ReviewA Jubilee cosplayer steals the spotlight by unleashing a dazzling spectacle, obliterating an entire Sentinel army with flair and mutant prowess.

item.title: Juggernaut Finally Returns for X-Men s Final Battle - With a Brand New Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJuggernaut returns with a new weapon in the X-Men’s final battle against Orchis after being imprisoned and nearly killed. The weapon is stolen from Cable’s armory, which includes powerful and exotic weapons that can even kill the godlike Celestials. Juggernaut’s powers can further enhance the weapon, making him even more unbeatable and capable of taking on Orchis’ formidable forces. Literature ReviewAs the¬†X-Men’s final battle begins, the¬†Juggernaut¬†finally returns to the front lines of the war for mutantkind, now toting a major new weapon.

item.title: Juggernaut Officially Has His Own Version of Kryptonite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Amulet of Cyttorak can stop the “Unstoppable” Juggernaut and is considered his “Kryptonite.” The Amulet was used successfully against the Juggernaut by the Hulk, but it was accidentally destroyed in the process. The Juggernaut has cut himself off from Cyttorak, making the Amulet useless against him in the current continuity of Earth-616. However, its effectiveness in other realities is seemingly still sound. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut boasts that he’s unstoppable, but apparently that’s not exactly the case, as one Marvel Comics issue introduces his own ‘Kryptonite’.
