item.title: Juggernaut s Friendship with a Founding X-Men Hero Gives New Meaning To Their Darkest Moment
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Juggernaut and Jean Grey have both committed genocide, which forms a dark connection between them. Jean offers support and endorsement to Juggernaut, recognizing his redemption and growth. Marvel Comics has the opportunity to explore the shared pain and redemption of these characters as their friendship develops. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut has become rather close with one founding member of the X-Men, though there is a hidden, dark undertone to their new-found friendship.

item.title: Juggernaut s Son Proves a Huge Fan Theory About His Powers Is 100% True
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJ2’s existence confirms a fan theory that Juggernaut’s powers can be transferred through non-magical means. Dr. Stasis wanted to steal Juggernaut’s powers for Orchis, which poses a threat to the entire Marvel Universe. J2’s existence proves that Juggernaut’s powers can indeed be transferred through blood and DNA. Literature ReviewWith the last few issues of X-Men comics, one question/theory has been raised in regard to his powers, something which his son, J2, already confirmed.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Creator Confirms the Manga Will End in 2024
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Jujutsu Kaisen manga is nearing its conclusion and will most likely end in 2024, according to the author, after the main villain Sukuna fully awakening and major character deaths. The manga has reached 90 million copies in circulation and is expected to surpass the 100 million mark. A teaser video of upcoming chapters hypes up the incredible battle between Gojo and Sukuna, but fans are saddened by the news of the series coming to an end soon.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Has Already Revealed Yuji s Cursed Technique
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYuji’s true Cursed technique could be Blood Manipulation, learned from Choso and Noritoshi Kamo, as hinted in recent chapters. Yuji’s apparent ability to use Flowing Red Scale explains his improved performance against Sukuna and his connection to the Death Painting Wombs. It is strongly implied that Kenjaku gave Yuji the Blood Manipulation Technique, making him one of his experiments like the Death Paintings. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen may have already left all the clues to Yuji’s true Cursed Technique and it may be completely different than fans expected.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Has One Power That Can Kill Sukuna Higuruma s Cursed Technique Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHiguruma Hiromi, a Grade 1 Sorcerer, has the potential to kill Sukuna and end his reign of terror. Higuruma’s innate technique uses a domain expansion and a shikigami called Judgeman to determine guilt and deliver justice. While Higuruma’s technique may be a threat to Sukuna, defeating him will not be easy and Sukuna may have a plan to counter it. Literature ReviewWhile the King of Curses must be feeling good after Gojo‚Äôs defeat, he faces a more pressing problem in Higuruma Hiromi‚Äôs cursed technique.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Is About To Reveal Megumi s Fate
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMegumi’s fate in Jujutsu Kaisen is uncertain, but there are two possible outcomes: he may be alive but incapacitated, or he could already be dead with Sukuna possessing his corpse. Even if Megumi is still alive, he is likely in poor shape emotionally and mentally. The burden he has carried and the deaths he has witnessed will have taken a toll on him. Despite his current condition, Megumi still has a role to play in the story.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Just Teased Sukuna Will Win Again...Because Of Gojo
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #244 of Jujutsu Kaisen teases that Sukuna will again, thanks to a mistake made by Gojo that prevents Higuruma from executing his cursed technique on Sukuna. Gojo’s decision to have the battle on a national holiday unknowingly prevents Higuruma from enacting the death penalty, closing off another path to victory against Sukuna. Even if the death penalty is out, Higuruma’s plan to confiscate Sukuna’s Cursed Technique is uncertain, as it depends on Judgeman successfully convicting Sukuna.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Killed Its Strongest Hero And Biggest Villain In The Same Way
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKenjaku’s defeat in Jujutsu Kaisen #243 mirrored Gojo’s demise, highlighting the unbearable pride of being a master sorcerer. Takaba’s unique cursed technique, coupled with his desire to be a comedian, led to Kenjaku’s downfall in a surprising turn of events. Gojo and Kenjaku’s overconfidence in their cursed techniques caused them to overlook fatal details, resulting in their defeat. Their legacies will continue through their surviving students and associates. Literature ReviewWhile Gojo and Kenjaku are mortal enemies, the mindsets they held during their final battles show why the two have more in common than fans think.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Needed to Kill Its Most Interesting New Character To Give Yuji His Power-Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHiguruma passes the torch to Yuji, giving him the power to kill Sukuna in the latest chapter of Jujutsu Kaisen. Higuruma’s fate is ambiguous, but his death opens up the possibility of increasing Yuji’s chances against Sukuna. Yuji may be able to wield the Executioner’s Sword even after Higuruma’s death, which could potentially end up strengthening his technique. Literature ReviewThe battle against Sukuna in Jujutsu Kaisen takes an interesting turn as the series sacrifices a fan-favorite character to redeem its protagonist.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Huge Inspiration Is More Evident Than Ever In Its Best Arc
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGege Akutami, the creator of Jujutsu Kaisen, is a huge fan of Tite Kubo’s Bleach and Yoshihiro Togashi’s Hunter X Hunter. The Shibuya Incident arc in Jujutsu Kaisen shows Gege’s appreciation for Hunter X Hunter, with similarities in character design, narration, and the basis of cursed energy. Togashi also loves Jujutsu Kaisen and drew inspiration from it, showing a mutual respect between the two creators and making both series better.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Huge Villain Death Brings Back The Series Biggest Mystery
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKenjaku’s unexpected defeat opens up the possibility of finally unraveling the mystery behind Yuji’s mother, Kaori. Kenjaku’s backup plan may involve using Yuji as a vessel for his own return, and it sheds light on his lifelong interest in human-curse hybrids. The death of Kenjaku presents an opportunity for Jujutsu Kaisen to dive deeper into Yuji’s past and origins, which has been a major point of intrigue in the series.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Sukuna Finally Comments on Yuji s Power Level, & It s Devastating
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSukuna deems Yuji Itadori “boring” and not strong enough to be a worthy opponent. Itadori receives a devastating attack from Sukuna, but he may have learned a new skill to defeat him. Despite Sukuna’s power, Itadori has the potential to surprise him and beat him in the end. Literature ReviewDespite Yuji Itadori’s stunning victories, Jujutsu Kaisen’s most powerful villain has some brutal words concerning the main character’s powers. Summary

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2 Episode #23 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJujutsu Kaisen Season 2 episode #23 will end the Shibuya Incident arc and establish the series’ status quo. The involvement of a new set of sorcerers and curses may be necessary, as many characters from season 1 are dead or otherwise disposed of. The episode will showcase a battle between Geto’s body and special-grade sorcerer Yuki Tsukumo, potentially ending with explosive revelations and powerful abilities. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen’s Season 2 episode #23 will be the season finale, ending the Shibuya Incident arc on an epic note that will have major consequences.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Shocks Fans With Another Unexpected Death
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #243 of Jujutsu Kaisen delivers an unexpected twist as Yuta successfully cuts off Kenjaku’s head, but his death may not be certain. Kenjaku, being a cunning man, likely has a contingency plan in case of such a situation, raising doubts about Yuta’s victory. Takaba’s fate too remains undecided, with fans hoping he isn’t truly dead. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen’s latest battle has taken an unexpected turn with yet another shocking death in the final pages of its latest chapter.

item.title: Justice League Confirms 2 Underrated Heroes Are Strong Enough to Beat Godzilla
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam and Supergirl team up to take down Godzilla in Justice League vs. Godzilla vs. Kong #3. The combined strength of the Justice League members is needed to defeat the rampaging Titans. Shazam and Supergirl’s power level surpasses Superman’s and they are strong enough to defeat Godzilla. Literature ReviewGodzilla might have won his first bout with Superman, but two Justice League members team up to successfully get revenge for the Man of Tomorrow.

item.title: Justice League Meets a Star Trek Icon in Official DC Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperstar artist Dan Mora provides a heart-warming variant cover of Captain Kirk joining the Justice League in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #25. The cover shows a smiling William Shatner surrounded by the League, although Green Arrow seems displeased. Fans have enjoyed previous celebrity appearances on the book’s cover, ensuring more fun covers will be created in the future. Literature ReviewThe Justice League are set to meet one of the biggest icons in the Star Trek universe in a special new variant cover by Dan Mora.

item.title: Justice League s White Martians Can Be Their Best Villains with 1 Change
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDark Knights of Steel reveals the White Martians as the main antagonists and showcases their impressive power and skill at subterfuge. However, their weakness to fire proves to be their downfall, as fire can easily defeat them in both the alternate universe and official DC continuity. While fire as a weakness may seem underwhelming, finding new and creative ways to defeat the White Martians can make them a bigger and more exciting threat to the Justice League.

item.title: Justice Titans DC s Absolute Strongest Justice League was a Perfect Fusion of 2 Teams
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice Titans, a fusion of the Justice League and the Teen Titans, are an absurdly powerful team in the extended DC Universe. Batman and Superman find themselves in a fusion of Gotham City and Metropolis called “Gothamopolis” and encounter the Justice Titans. The Titans have become their own team fully on par with the Justice League, and the fusion of these two teams in the Justice Titans creates an unstoppable force.

item.title: Kang Beat the Avengers Worse Than Thanos for 1 Reason - He s a Human
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKang the Conqueror defeated the Avengers in the major “Kang Dynasty” storyline by spreading them too thin and forcing major powers to surrender. Kang humiliated the Avengers by making the Wasp sign the articles of surrender, breaking their spirits in a way Thanos never did. While Thanos has defeated the Avengers in more obvious ways, Kang’s victory is significant because of the human element involved. Literature ReviewThanos may be the Mad Titan, but Kang the Conqueror is ultimately just another human foe for the Avengers - meaning he’s even more dangerous.

item.title: Keanu Reeves First Novel Continues Story of His Best-Selling BRZRKR Comic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKeanu Reeves is collaborating with author China Mieville on a new novel set in the universe of his successful BRZRKR comic series. BRZRKR has become one of the biggest success stories in 21st-century comics, selling out and becoming a multimedia franchise. The new novel, The Book of Elsewhere, is just the beginning for BRZRKR, with a live-action movie and anime series in development. Literature ReviewKeanu Reeves has joined forces with novelist China Mieville to bring fans the first prose book set in Reeves’ BRZRKR universe.

item.title: Kick-Ass Hit-Girl Just Died in Official Continuity (& Gets an Unexpected Replacement)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHit-Girl is killed in Big Game #5, shot by Wanted protagonist Wesley Gibson, aka the Killer. Hit-Girl used time travel to save every other Millarverse hero, bringing heroes like Kingsman’s Eggsy back to life. She’s replaced by the Mindy McCready of the new timeline in what feels like a betrayal of the character. Literature ReviewKick-Ass’ assassin superhero dies a gory death in Big Game, and Chlo√´ Grace Moretz’s superhero is replaced by an unlikely candidate.

item.title: Kid Venom Art Gives Marvel a Superpowered Take on Blue Eye Samurai
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTaurin Clarke’s variant cover for Kid Venom: Origins #1 presents a visually captivating picture of Kid Venom. The distinctive blue color, anime-esque artistry, and incorporation of Edo-era influences in Clarke’s cover bestow Marvel’s Venom Kid with a look that resonates with the visual aesthetic of Blue Eye Samurai. The release of Kid Venom: Origins #1, along with its behind-the-scenes content, hints at a promising future for Kid Venom and suggests that the character may play a significant role in upcoming Marvel storylines.

item.title: King Kong Should Have Died to Another MonsterVerse Titan Before Ever Fighting Godzilla
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCamazotz, a powerful Titan, nearly prevented the Godzilla vs. Kong battle by being far stronger than Kong. Without Monarch’s G-Team, which saved Kong from Camazotz, the outcome of the film would have been radically altered. If Kong had died, the story could have focused on Godzilla fighting Camazotz, though Godzilla ultimately could have prevailed with the help of Mothra. Literature ReviewWhile Kong and Godzilla eventually did get to fight on the big screen, another contender for Skull Island nearly killed the MonsterVerse hero.

item.title: Kodansha s December Giveaway Is The Perfect Chance To Check Shonen Jump s Rival
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKodansha Publishing is running a month-long giveaway campaign, offering free digital volumes of its manga series every day for the month of December. This campaign is an effort by Kodansha to promote its manga content, which includes popular titles like Attack on Titan and Vinland Saga, and compete with Shueisha’s dominant position in the international market. Readers can access the free volumes by signing up for Kodansha’s free reader account, and the account also grants access to future giveaway campaigns.

item.title: Legendary Sport Manga Author Announces His Retirement
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe creator of Captain Tsubasa, Takahashi Yoichi, announces his retirement due to age and health reasons. His two ongoing manga will conclude in April. Captain Tsubasa has been a landmark in anime and manga, pioneering the sports genre. The demanding nature of being a mangaka is likely a factor in the choice of retirement. Drafts for a final “World Cup” arc will allow other creators to continue the series. Takahashi’s influence is likely to remain in future Captain Tsubasa projects.

item.title: LGBTQ+ Romance Heartstopper Just Set a Major Record
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHeartstopper Vol. 5 has become the fastest-selling graphic novel ever in the UK, selling over 60,000 copies in just three days. The success of Heartstopper showcases the growing market and popularity of LGBTQ+ stories, despite challenges and censorship attempts. While volume 6 will be the final installment in the series, the record-breaking success of Heartstopper suggests that it could become one of the fastest-selling graphic novels worldwide. Literature ReviewThe worldwide LGBTQ+ sensation Heartstopper has just broken a major record, as the franchise secures its place in pop culture history.

item.title: Like It Or Not, Batman Now Learned to Fight Crime from Santa Claus
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s canonical backstory reveals that Santa Claus was one of his mentors, teaching him skills he still uses today. The addition of Santa Claus to Batman’s training may seem odd, but it fits within the larger, fantastical world of the Dark Knight’s adventures. This unique twist adds a fascinating layer to Batman’s mythos, demonstrating the diverse range of influences on his crime-fighting abilities. Literature ReviewYes, Virginia, Santa Claus is seriously one of the mentors who trained Batman and helped turn Bruce Wayne into the crime-fighter he is today.

item.title: Lilo & Stitch Series Officially Introduces Its New Villain - THE CLUSTER SOVEREIGN
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Lilo & Stitch comic introduces a brand-new villain, the Cluster Sovereign, who wants to create an army of Stitch. The comic maintains the original movie’s aesthetic, with cute and cuddly yet dangerous giant robots as the new villains. The series will take Lilo and Stitch on an international adventure, with future issues set in New York City and India as the Cluster Sovereign hunts them down globally.

item.title: Lion-O Makes Franchises History as ThunderCats New Series Begins
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLion-O claims the Sword of Omens for the first time in the new Thundercats comic series by Dynamite Entertainment. The previews show Lion-O’s struggle to become a responsible leader and prove his worthiness to use the sword. The new series takes a “year one” approach, showing the Thundercats’ arrival on Third Earth and the events that shaped Lion-O into the character fans know and love. Literature ReviewDynamite Entertainment’s new Thundercats series begins with a bang, showing Lion-O use the Sword of Omens for the first time.

item.title: Loid Vs. Yor - SPY x FAMILY Gives Fans the Fight They ve Waited For With One Catch
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSPY x FAMILY Chapter 79 delivers on the anticipation of a fight between Loid and Yor, but with a twist. The fight between Yor and Loid turns out to be all in Yor’s imagination, but the series has built up to this moment. The potential clash between Loid and Yor hints at future conflicts and raises excitement for the series’ direction. Literature ReviewYor and Loid from SPY x FAMILY are certain to clash once they discover each other’s identities and the manga is showing what that may look like.

item.title: Look Out Blue Lock - New Shonen Sports Manga Was One of 2023 s Most Underrated
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Days of Diamond is a popular sports manga that could surpass Blue Lock as the best sports manga of the year. The manga focuses on the personal and team pressures of being a talented athlete and explores the contemporary youth sports scene. The Days of Diamond has memorable characters, such as Jiro’s supportive mother and teammate Tougou, and features dynamic artwork that brings the baseball action to life.

item.title: Luke Cage Officially Has the Worst Secret Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s new secret identity is not a secret anymore, as his true identity has been exposed in just two issues. Despite wearing a mask, Luke Cage’s recognizable bald head should have made it easy for people to figure out his secret. It is unclear who exposed Luke Cage’s secret identity, but it was someone who knew that he had become a hero again. Literature ReviewAs a Gang War rages on in the streets of New York City, Mayor Luke Cage returns to his heroic roots with a disguise that shouldn’t fool anyone.

item.title: Luke Cage s New Costume Changes His Character on a Fundamental Level
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s new masked identity challenges his long-held beliefs against secret identities, signaling a change in mindset. As Mayor of New York, Luke Cage confronts the limitations of his position and adopts a new masked identity to continue his superhero duties. Luke Cage acknowledges the complexities of secret identities and realizes that operating in secret is necessary to protect both himself and other heroes. Literature ReviewAs a gang war kicks off in New York, Mayor Luke Cage dons a mask for the first time in his career, fundamentally changes the character.

item.title: Luke Skywalker s Latest Feat Makes His Force Connection Even More Legendary
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe final issue of Marvel’s Dark Droids crossover finds Luke Skywalker possessed by the Scourge, a viral artificial intelligence, becoming a living conduit between machine intelligence and the Force. The Scourge needed someone with Luke’s power to access, as it seeks to become the Force itself, once more indicating that Luke is the most powerful Force user in the galaxy. Despite Luke’s valiant efforts, he is not the hero of the story, as another character ultimately defeats the Scourge and saves the galaxy.

item.title: Mace Windu Returns to Star Wars with Andor-Style Prison Break
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMace Windu is returning to Star Wars in an Andor-style prison break storyline, reinforcing his badass reputation. Mace Windu goes undercover as a guard to bust someone out of prison and faces conflict with the prison warden. This new comic effectively merges Mace Windu with the popular Andor storyline, featuring a prison break and utilizing Mace Windu’s Jedi skills to his advantage. Literature ReviewMace Windu is about to return to Star Wars canon in an all-new storyline, one that - based on a preview - looks a lot like Andor’s prison break arc.

item.title: Madripoor Knights Revisiting This Classic Uncanny X-Men One Shot Ahead of Chris Claremont s New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUncanny X-Men #268 offered a tantalizing glimpse into Wolverine’s mysterious past, fueling speculation about his origin at a time when it was still unknown, making it a highlight for collectors and fans. Jim Lee’s artwork in Uncanny X-Men #268 is among his very best, showcasing his talent and contributing to his rise to “superstar” status in the comic industry. The story in Uncanny X-Men #268 is being revisited in the new Wolverine: Madripoor Knights series, giving fans a perfect reason to revisit the original one-shot issue from 1990.

item.title: Madripoor Knights Wolverine, Captain America & Black Widow s New Team Officially Assemble in First Look Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Widow, Captain America, and Wolverine team up in Chris Claremont’s latest limited series, Madripoor Knights, following up on the story from his Uncanny X-Men #268 one-shot. The series explores the dynamics established in the previous story, and will feature the trio battling against the Hand assassin organization. Madripoor Knights is, in a way, a career retrospective for Claremont, showcasing his signature style and delivering a thrilling adventure for new and old fans of Marvel comics alike.

item.title: Magneto Has a Genius Solution for Dealing with Supervillains
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMagneto’s advice to “block him and move on” is an effective strategy for dealing with trolling, even when it comes to powerful villains like Doctor Doom. This simple measure of blocking a telepathic connection with Doom prevented further infiltration and conflicts between Krakoa and Latveria. Magneto’s practical advice can also be applied to everyday situations, such as dealing with trolls on social media. Literature ReviewMagneto’s suggestion for Charles Xavier deal with mental trolling from Doctor Doom sounds familiar to anyone who has spent time on the internet.

item.title: Mandalorian Armor Has a Secret Achilles Heel, Star Wars Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMandalorian beskar armor, while incredibly tough, has a major vulnerability - a gap between the helmet and the breastplate, which a skilled sniper like Aurra Sing can exploit (as shown in Star Wars: Revelations.) The need for maneuverability means not every part of the body can be protected by beskar, making the gaps in the armor a significant weakness. However, Aurra Sing is a galaxy-class sniper, and this weakness can only be exploited by the best of the best.

item.title: Mark Millar Explains Why He Doesnt Want to Create a Shared Universe With His Netflix Adaptations‚Ä¶Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMark Millar prefers to see his characters adapted as stand-alone franchises before considering a crossover. Netflix is currently focusing on developing Millarworld titles like Magic Order, Huck, and Prodigy. Millar hopes to eventually see a crossover in the future, with subtle connections between his franchises laying the foundation over the next decade or more. Literature ReviewMark Millar recently discussed his upcoming projects at Netflix, explaining why he’d rather build to an on-screen crossover than start with one.

item.title: Marvel & DC s Future Heroes Meet in Epic Spider-Man 2099 & Batman Beyond Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man 2099 and Batman Beyond team up in epic fanart crossover, fulfilling fans’ dreams of a superhero collaboration between characters from DC & Marvel’s distant futures. Artists @arifinity_ and @mn_arts_616 skillfully depict the futuristic versions of these iconic characters with realistic details. While an official crossover may never happen, fans can enjoy this fanart as a satisfying alternative for the ultimate superhero team-up. Literature ReviewMarvel and DC have exciting futures featuring new versions of iconic characters, with new fanart bringing Batman Beyond and Spider-Man 2099 together!

item.title: Marvel Confirms 1 Shock MCU Hero Is a Bigger Tech Genius Than Tony Stark
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYProfessor Xavier is a genius on the level of Iron Man, in terms of technological skills and intelligence. Charles Xavier’s mutant powers give him a natural advantage, making him an underappreciated tech genius among many in the Marvel Universe. Xavier’s ability to enter and borrow knowledge from other minds, including those of geniuses like Tony Stark and Reed Richards, further enhances his technological prowess. Literature ReviewTony Stark is one of Marvel’s foremost technological geniuses, but one surprising X-Men character has proven himself to be Iron Man’s superior.

item.title: Marvel Confirms a Star MCU Hero Has Officially Turned Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShang-Chi surprises readers and crime bosses alike by joining Marvel’s “Gang War,” showcasing his morally-gray attitude and willingness to fight. Shang-Chi’s criminal ties and struggle between good and evil have recently been explored, highlighting his complex origin story and internal conflict. Shang-Chi’s heel turn could be a strategic move to gain information for his friends, suggesting a larger plan and adding an intriguing twist to the event. Literature ReviewAs the heads of the crime families throw down in Marvel’s Gang War, an MCU hero appears - not to stop them, but to get their own piece of the pie.

item.title: Marvel Confirms Spider-Man Has It Rough Across the Entire Multiverse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Howard the Duck’s 50th Anniversary Special,Spider-Man’s heart is broken when he realizes that there may not be any universe within the Multiverse where he’s “doing okay.” Peter Parker has faced a great deal of loss and trauma in his life, making him one of the most beaten-down heroes in comics. The new Ultimate Marvel Universe may offer a version of Spider-Man who is well-adjusted, and continues to mature as a person and a hero.

item.title: Marvel Finally Reveals What Happened to X-Men s Most Powerful Mutant (To Set Up His Return)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLegion, a reality-warping mutant, has been hiding within Nightcrawler’s heart and Hopesword. Legion’s powers are crucial in the battle against Mother Righteous and the rise of Dominion. Nightcrawler’s discovery of Legion’s presence within him reveals a powerful resource for the X-Men’s cause. Literature ReviewSince Sons of X, Legion has been hiding from the Dominion-seeking Mother Righteous, and Uncanny Spider-Man #5 finally reveals where he escaped to. Warning: contains spoilers for Uncanny Spider-Man #5After more than six months of not knowing the whereabouts of the X-Men’s most powerful mutant, the reality-warping hero called Legion, David Haller finally reveals where he has hidden himself in the pages of Uncanny Spider-Man #5.

item.title: Marvel Heroes Prefer Miles Morales Spider-Man to Peter Parker s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s current “Gang War” crossover event shows that Miles Morales is the favored Spider-Man among NYC’s hero set, while Peter Parker is falling out of favor with numerous superheroes. Heroes like She-Hulk and Blade have shown a preference for Miles Morales, gifting him special suits and showing him respect, while their dynamic with Peter Parker has become more tense recently. The Amazing Spider-Man #39 makes it clear that Peter Parker has a likability problem, with his toxic traits and failure to show up for his superhero friends accruing, leading to disdain from other heroes.

item.title: Marvel Is Finally Done Ignoring Its Ultimate Anti-Zombie Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage finally joins the zombie battle in Marvel Zombies: Black, White & Blood #3, using his unbreakable skin to fight off the undead horde. The anthology format of Marvel Zombies: Black, White & Blood allows for unique and diverse stories featuring different Marvel characters and alternate universes. Luke Cage was supposed to be the protagonist in the original Marvel Zombies run, but his appearance was changed. Now, fans can see how he would fare in a true zombie apocalypse.

item.title: Marvel is Laying the Seeds for Miles Morales to Get His Own Sinister Six
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales is facing the possibility of his villains teaming up against him, much like Peter Parker’s Sinister Six. The issue introduces low-grade villains teaming up, hinting at a potential escalation with deadlier adversaries in the future. As Miles becomes a better superhero, his enemies are getting fed up and may resort to teaming up as their only option to take him down. Literature ReviewMiles Morales might finally get his own version of the Sinister Six as the young Spider-Man proves he’s too tough for just one villain to take down.

item.title: Marvel Is Officially Rebooting a Beloved MCU Character for 2024
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUltimate Spider-Man (Vol. 2) #1 reimagines J. Jonah Jameson with a notably softer personality, deviating from previous portrayals by depicting him as a father figure to a non-Spider-Man Peter Parker. In the course of the issue, Jameson and his Managing Editor, a still-alive Ben Parker, quit the Daily Bugle to start a new publication together, departing from Spider-Man canon. The relationship dynamics between Jameson, Ben, and Peter are highlights of Ultimate Spider-Man (Vol.

item.title: Marvel Is Rewriting Blade Lore in a Way That Could Hugely Improve the MCU
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel is rewriting Blade’s lore to improve his role in the MCU, as evidenced by a preview scene in Blade #6. Blade seeks Dracula’s help in fighting the Adana, showcasing a shift in their adversarial relationship. By adding depth to Blade and Dracula’s relationship, the MCU could enhance the upcoming Blade movie. Literature ReviewIn a preview for Blade #6, the vampire hunter enters into a new relationship with his greatest enemy and the MCU should take note.

item.title: Marvel Is Rewriting Blade s Personality Ahead of His MCU Debut
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel is modernizing Blade’s character, giving him unexpected tender moments to showcase his vulnerability. Blade’s stoic nature is being deconstructed, with Marvel emphasizing his cheesy dad jokes and ability to have a vulnerable moment with his daughter. Marvel is peeling back the layers of Blade to make him a more multi-faceted character, retaining his badass persona while also showcasing different aspects of his personality. Literature ReviewMarvel Comics is rewriting the vampire hunter Blade’s personality ahead of his MCU debut and it’s revealing all new layers to who he is.

item.title: Marvel Kills Off an MCU Character Ahead of Her Upcoming Big Break
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Thunderbolts series reveals that the Contessa has been dead for a long time, making her future in the MCU uncertain. The Contessa’s death implies that she never made it out of prison after surrendering in Secret Warriors, aligning with the Marvel Universe’s timeline. Thunderbolts both revives and kills off the Contessa, setting her up for a prominent role in the upcoming Thunderbolts film but also making her sudden replacement unexpected.

item.title: Marvel Made Civil War Smarter By Undermining It with 4 Simple Words
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUltimate Iron Man’s suggestion that register, license, and regulate the Hulk would be a “terrible” idea highlights the inherent problems of the Superhuman Registration Act, championed by the Earth-616 version of Tony Stark. The reversal of stances between Iron Man and Captain America’s Ultimate variants shows that they could have better understood each other’s sides, meaning the Civil War conflict that tore apart Marvel’s heroes could have been avoided. Iron Man and Captain America are close friends in many different timelines ‚Äì making it all the more tragic that they led opposite sides in the Marvel’s original Civil War.

item.title: Marvel Officially Confirms Kamala Khan s New Codename as a Member of the X-Men
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKamala Khan takes on the new codename Captain Krakoa as a member of the X-Men, honoring Cyclops and continuing the fight for mutants. Kamala’s new title pays tribute to both Cyclops and her original inspiration, Carol Danvers, cementing her status as a full-fledged hero. In the dark future timeline of Rise of the Powers of X, Kamala remains true to her heroic nature, showing her growth as a leader and her unwavering commitment to fighting for her fellow mutants.

item.title: Marvel Officially Names the 2 Most Important X-Men Characters of the Last 5 Years
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe end of the Krakoan era in the X-Men comics focuses on the present-day battles against Orchis and the future fight against artificial intelligences. The story revolves around the characters of Charles Xavier and Moira MacTaggert, who have been crucial to the Krakoan era from the beginning. Xavier and Moira’s meeting on a park bench is a pivotal moment that is repeatedly referenced throughout the Krakoa era, highlighting their importance to the overall story.

item.title: Marvel Officially Updates Its Ranking of Gods with the DEMIURGE PRIMORDIAL
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe introduction of the Demiurge Primordial in Immortal Thor #5 reveals a new and more powerful figure in the Marvel Universe’s hierarchy of gods. The Demiurge is an important cosmic being who created life on Earth and the Elder Gods, and intervened to save the planet from destruction. The Demiurge Primordial’s power and status as a multiversal being could potentially rival that of Galactus and Eternity, leading to a major change in the rankings of Marvel’s gods.

item.title: Marvel Reveals the Songs on New Star-Lord s Awesome Mix Tape
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHoward the Duck replaces Star-Lord’s songs with Doobie Brothers tracks on the Awesome Mix, creating potential conflict. Star-Lord’s mixtapes are essential to his character, and he puts a lot of thought into them. While Star-Lord may be mad at first, he could potentially enjoy the change and embrace the new mix. Literature ReviewStar-Lord is known through the galaxy for his Awesome Mixes, and now he has a new one, courtesy Howard the Duck.

item.title: Marvel s Black Panther vs Moon Knight War Has Begun (With a Huge Killmonger Upgrade)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKillmonger wields an electric ax and takes out Moon Knight’s forces in the new Ultimate Black Panther #1 trailer. The trailer introduces a new Black Panther and a new Wakanda in the Ultimate Universe. The Maker lurks in the background, raising questions about Moon Knight’s motives and what he has become in the new world. Literature ReviewMarvel has released a new trailer for Ultimate Black Panther #1, which will see T’Challa fight the armies of Moon Knight.

item.title: Marvel s Cancellation of Avengers Inc. Series Exposes Huge Problems With Its Business Model
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s cancellation of Avengers Inc. highlights a flawed business model that doesn’t consider fan interest beyond single-issue sales. The decision to cancel the series prematurely overlooks factors such as collected editions and international readership. Marvel needs to reevaluate its business model to accurately gauge fan interest and avoid prematurely canceling promising series. Literature ReviewThe cancellation of Avengers Inc. speaks to a bigger problem with the Marvel Comics brass and their decision making process that needs to change.

item.title: Marvel s Copyright Battle for Spider-Man Is Over, & It s the Result Fans Wanted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel settled its copyright dispute with Steve Ditko’s estate, the co-creator of Spider-Man and Doctor Strange, amicably. The settlement ensures fair compensation and credit to creators’ estates, without returning the rights to the characters to Marvel. Legal battles over creators’ rights have been a recurring issue in the comics industry, leading to heated disputes and tensions among fans and creators. Literature ReviewThe estate of Steve Ditko, co-creator of Spider-Man, has settled its copyright dispute against Marvel in a satisfactory fashion.

item.title: Marvel s Huge Gang War Event Is Setting Up a New Hulk - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Gang War event intensifies as a new Hulk may join the chaotic battle, with Typhoid Mary spilling She-Hulk’s gamma-irradiated blood. She-Hulk’s blood is a dangerous substance that can cause uncontrollable gamma transformations, posing a threat to anyone exposed to it. The potential for She-Hulk’s blood to create a new Hulk in the Gang War adds more excitement and suspense to the storyline. Literature ReviewOne of the deadliest substances in the Marvel Universe has accidentally been unleashed in the course of the supervillain Gang War: Hulk blood.

item.title: Marvel s Huge Nightcrawler Origin Retcon Has Been In The Works For 40 Years
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAfter years of the idea being considered at Marvel, X-Men Blue: Origins confirms that Mystique and Destiny are Nightcrawler’s biological parents. The retcon to Nightcrawler’s origin adds depth to his and his mothers’ histories, incorporating trans and queer representation directly into their storyline, after years of having it obliquely hinted at by various creators, including legendary X-scribe Chris Claremont, who originated the idea. This important revelation in X-Men history makes the comics more meaningful to marginalized people and sets the stage for future stories for Nightcrawler, Mystique, and Destiny.

item.title: Marvel s Most Blatant Batman Rip-Off Has Daredevil s Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil teams up with the Shroud, Marvel’s version of Batman, to take down the Owl. The Shroud’s backstory is inspired by Batman’s, but he gained a similar Radar Sense to Daredevil’s. The Shroud has vision powers similar to Daredevil’s and can control darkness. Their partnership is memorable. Literature ReviewDaredevil has teamed up with countless heroes across the Marvel Universe, but the most surprising team-up was with Marvel’s version of Batman.

item.title: Marvel s Most Hated New Hero Proves Squirrel Girl Can Team-Up With ANYONE
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSquirrel Girl shows why she’s the best teammate in Marvel, by teaming up with the newest, most hated hero in the Marvel Universe, Spider-Boy. Squirrel Girl quickly becomes friends with Spider-Boy, with the story “Ballonacy” showing that they make an excellent crimefighting duo, based on one encounter. Trust is a key factor in Squirrel Girl’s success, as she quickly trusts Spider-Boy’s instincts and sees potential in him that other heroes haven’t acknowledged.

item.title: Marvel s Most Iconic Queer Couple Just Made History (Changing X-Men Lore Forever)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s most iconic queer couple, Mystique and Destiny, are revealed as the biological parents of Nightcrawler, bringing depth to their characters and retconning a controversial plotline. The story explores themes of queer love, betrayal, and sacrifice, deepening the lore around Mystique and Destiny’s long lives. Mystique and Destiny’s future remains uncertain, but their complex and tragic relationship continues to be a focus, offering opportunities for redemption and further storytelling.

item.title: Marvel s Most Powerful 1v1 Battle of All Time Just Started
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Timeless one-shot features the most intense 1-on-1 fight in the publisher’s history between Power Man and Moon Knight. In Marvel’s far future, each hero has been upgraded beyond imagining, now possessing the powers of the Hulk, the Sentry, Doctor Strange, Iron Man, and more. Timeless #1 is coming December 27 from Marvel Comics, and will set up Marvel’s 2024 stories. Literature ReviewWhat if every major Marvel superpower was granted to one of two fighters, then they went to war?

item.title: Marvel s Most Powerful God Is Transformed in Living Tribunal Redesign
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s powerful god, the Living Tribunal, undergoes an epic redesign emphasizing his alien qualities. The Living Tribunal, who answers only to Marvel’s version of “God,” will soon make a comeback in a new, body-less form. The Living Tribunal’s new appearance raises questions about its origin and adds to the cosmic and otherworldly feel of the character. Literature ReviewMarvel’s new GODS series is redefining their cosmic pantheon, and now its most powerful member gets an epic redesign.

item.title: Marvel s Most Powerful Healing Factor Has a Truly Terrifying Side Effect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Goblin #2 revealed that one version of Green Goblin’s healing factor is more powerful, and far more unsettling, than either Wolverine or Deadpool’s. Phil Urich’s resurrection reveals the horrifying side effects of the Goblin serum’s healing factor. The consequences of gaining a healing factor through the Green Goblin serum are tragic, making it the most powerful, but also the most terrifying healing ability depicted in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Marvel s New Hulk Declares Themself the 1 True Version - & They ll Kill Bruce Banner to Prove It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYApril Booth wants to become the one true and best Hulk, and her goal is to kill the original Hulk, even if it means killing all the Hulks, including She-Hulk. April and her husband, Mark, stole She-Hulk’s blood samples to gain powers but their experiments went wrong, leaving April as a Hulk monster. Bruce Banner, the original Hulk, is insulted and passionate about April’s challenge to become the Hulk, and Hulk takes it as a personal attack on his individualism.

item.title: Marvel s New Spider-Man is Officially Removing Peter Parker s Biggest Weakness
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightcrawler takes down thieves by using his teleportation powers, proving he has an advantage over the Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man. Nightcrawler has mysteriously become New York’s new Uncanny Spider-Man, hiding in plain sight and reinventing his origin story. Nightcrawler as the Uncanny Spider-Man showcases what makes him a hero and brings a new mutant spin to the Spidey brand. Literature ReviewAs X-Men’s Nightcrawler becomes the new Uncanny Spider-Man, he’s using his mutant powers to make Peter Parker’s biggest weakness obsolete.

item.title: Marvel s Original Art Icons Take The Spotlight in The Atlas Artist Edition , Joe Maneely The First
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Atlas Artist Editions spotlight original art icons like Joe Maneely, giving fans a comprehensive look at his impressive body of work. Maneely, highly accomplished but little known, was regarded as even more accomplished than some of his cohort, including Steve Ditko and Gene Colan. Maneely’s untimely death prevented him from illustrating Marvel’s superhero titles, making him one of the biggest “what could have beens” in comic history. Literature ReviewMarvel and Fantagraphics will release the first look at the career of Marvel icon Joe Maneely, and ScreenRant has an exclusive first look.

item.title: Marvel s Secret Invasion 10 Skrull Reveals That Left Fans Stunned
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYElektra was the first Marvel character revealed as a Skrull, creating distrust within the Avengers and kicking off the invasion. Black Bolt’s Skrull imposter was a placeholder to buy time until the real Black Bolt could be weaponized. Jarvis, Iron Man’s butler, turned out to be a Skrull with masterful tactical skills, impacting SHIELD technology and Tony Stark’s suits - and that’s just three of the 10 most shocking Skrull reveals in Secret Invasion.

item.title: Marvel s Seventh Infinity Stone Makes Shock Return for Magneto s Epic Resurrection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMagneto’s resurrection is drawing closer, and the first look at the interiors of Resurrection of Magneto #1 reveals the presence of the long-forgotten seventh Infinity Stone, the Ego Stone. The Ego Stone was thought to be gone forever, but it has now reformed and joined the other Infinity Stones, playing a role in Storm’s quest to bring Magneto back from the afterlife. Ororo will face various challenges on her journey, including the Amenthi villain Tarn the Uncaring, the Infinity Stones, the Living Tribunal, and even darker forces who have their own plans for Magneto’s return.

item.title: Marvel s Spider-Man Boss is Ready to Live Up to His Video Game Potential
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man villain Tombstone is set to receive a redemption arc in the comics, mirroring his reformation in the PlayStation Spider-Man video games. Tombstone, a notorious crime boss, chooses to work with Spider-Man in order to protect his daughter and end the gang war in New York. This team-up with Spider-Man is a significant turning point for Tombstone, as it shows his commitment to protecting his loved ones and potentially turning his back on a life of crime.

item.title: Marvel Won t Replace Kamala Khan s Comic Powers with Her MCU Ones - For Now
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel reassures fans that they won’t be retconning Ms. Marvel’s powers in the comic series. The series explores Kamala Khan’s identity as a mutant and her journey into the mutant community. Ms. Marvel’s powers don’t define her, and she will always be Ms. Marvel regardless of any changes in her powers. Literature ReviewMs. Marvel fans can rest assured that Marvel won’t retcon who Kamala Khan is in favor of hewing closer to her MCU counterpart - for now at least.

item.title: Marvel Zombies Are Officially Spreading to Peach Momoko s Beloved Momokoverse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel Zombies: Black, White & Blood #3 takes the horrifying Marvel Zombies universe and collides it with Peach Momoko’s enchanting Momokoverse. The new anthology series provides a more intimate and tragic look into the brutal world of Marvel Zombies. The Momokoverse is no stranger to monstrous threats, and the heroes of Peach’s universe will fiercely defend their magical forest against the Marvel Zombies. Literature ReviewMarvel Zombies: Black, White & Blood #3 will see the titular monsters attacking Peach Momoko’s enchanting folktale Momokoverse.

item.title: Matt Murdock Didn t Just Give Up His Secret Identity - He Proved He Was Daredevil in a Court Of Law
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMatt Murdock was forced to reveal his secret identity as Daredevil in court in order to prevent a white supremacist group from blackmailing him into representing one of their members. Despite the risk, Matt embraces his true identity as a superhero, taking away the power of the Sons of the Serpent and facing the risks of not hiding his identity head-on. Revealing his secret identity allows Matt to start fresh as Daredevil, in a pivotal moment for the long-running Marvel hero.

item.title: Matthew Murdock Is the Most Important Half of Daredevil s Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil believes his vigilantism is useless without his ability to advocate for better laws. Through his legal practice, Daredevil represents disenfranchised clients and fights for justice. Daredevil’s ability to change laws sets him apart from other heroes who rely solely on physical force. Literature ReviewDaredevil admits that his vigilantism is useless if he is not also able to address the wrongs in the legal system as lawyer Matt Murdock.

item.title: MCU Fans Deserved Iron Man vs Namor - If Only to Introduce Tony s Argonaut Armor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s Argonaut suits, from Iron Man (Vol. 4), were designed for peacekeeping, but went out of Tony Stark’s control and started a fight with Atlantis. The Sub-Mariner suit, specifically designed for battles in water, easily defeated Namor, showcasing its power. Tony Stark’s exceptional genius and ability to create advanced suits comes at the cost of sometimes causing more trouble than they solve. Literature ReviewTony Stark has built a legacy around designing new iterations of his Iron Man armor, and one variation makes him the perfect opponent for Namor.

item.title: MCU s Skurge Just Redefined Thor Lore Forever (With the Secret of His Death)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSkurge’s heroic sacrifice in Avengers Inc. #3 redefines his character and establishes a special connection between him and Thor. Skurge’s theft of Thor’s heroic death has forged a bond between them, with potential dire consequences for both characters. The crossover with Immortal Thor suggests that Thor’s encounter with the Elder Gods may lead to the end of both him and Skurge. Literature ReviewSkurge stole the scene in Thor: Ragnarok, but now he shares a bond with the Thunder God–and it may spell doom for both.

item.title: MCU s Yelena Belova Names The 1 X-Men Hero She Doesn t Respect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYelena Belova, the White Widow, is exploring her identity and making new discoveries about herself in her new series. Yelena has made a list of her likes and dislikes, including her dislike for Cyclops, the X-Men leader, because he refused to gossip with her. Yelena is becoming a part of her community, making friends, and exploring her own opinions after a life of being controlled by others. Literature ReviewWhite Widow has struck out on her own, figuring out who she is when not under someone’s control.

item.title: Meet Starchild and Red Son Superman s Twin Children Officially Have New Identities
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s twin children, known as the Super-Twins, now have their own superhero identities as Starchild and Red Son. The twins’ new names come from their own family’s mythos, the House of Ra, allowing them to have identities independent of Superman. The future of Starchild and Red Son is bright, with their first major steps to becoming true heroes and the potential for their own superhero costumes. Literature ReviewDespite living in the shadow of their adoptive father, Superman, the “Super-Twins” of Warworld have finally earned superhero identities of their own.

item.title: Mighty Thor Cosplay Brings Back the Comic-Accurate Helmet the MCU Botched
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGennlyCosplay’s Mighty Thor costume accurately replicates the character’s comic book look, with attention to detail in the armor components and colors featured in the source material. Unlike the MCU’s interpretation, Gennly Cosplay’s cosplay stays true to the source material, including the winged helmet with its golden symbol, making it a faithful portrayal that surpasses the movie adaptation. Gennly Cosplay goes beyond accuracy by sharing behind-the-scenes images and notes about her design process, allowing fans to appreciate the artistry and effort involved in creating her stunning costume.

item.title: Miles Morales Spider-Man Can Disable Iron Man s Armor with One Punch
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales proves he could take down Iron Man with a single punch, showing his surprising effectiveness against Stark tech. Miles’ venom blast disables Iron Man’s most dangerous suit, the Extrembiote armor, causing it to overload and explode. Even though Tony Stark and Miles Morales are friends, there’s no reason to think Miles couldn’t defeat Iron Man in a serious fight. Literature ReviewIron Man is one of the most technologically advanced characters in comic books, which is why it’s surprising Miles can take him down with one punch.

item.title: Miles Morales Showcases New Form of Spider-Sense as Spider-Man s Powers Evolve
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales’ therapy sessions have evolved his powers, giving him X-ray vision. Misty Knight recruits Miles for a mission using his newfound spy abilities to investigate a new villain. Miles’s therapy has helped him regain control of his Spider-Senses and develop new powers, making him the go-to Spider-Man in the Marvel Universe. Literature ReviewBy working through his trauma in therapy, Miles has not only regained his Spider-Man powers, he’s evolved them beyond what even Peter Parker can do.

item.title: Mind-Blowing Spider-Verse Image Showcases Marvel s Best Spider-Man Cosplayers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Spider-Verse is a beloved concept in the world of comics, featuring multiple versions of Spider-Man from different dimensions. @wens.1998 is a talented and versatile cosplayer who brings iconic Spider-Man moments to life through impressive costumes and photography. The jaw-dropping cosplay image showcases various Spider-Men, including live-action movie versions, solidifying the community’s love for the character and his many iterations. Literature ReviewThe Spider-Verse is a sprawling multiverse full of unique versions of Spider-Man, with this cosplay image uniting creators from across the community!

item.title: Mind-Blowing Venom Art Proves 1 Marvel Artist Was Born to Draw Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeach Momoko’s “Nightmare” variant cover for Venom #28 taps into the character’s body horror aspect. Momoko’s distinct style captures Venom’s gross essence while also showing hints of his complexity. Marvel should seize the opportunity to have Momoko draw more Venom covers or even do interiors for an issue. Literature ReviewA forthcoming “Nightmare” variant for Venom #28 proves that superstar artist Peach Momoko was born to draw him. A new piece of mind-blowing Venom art proves that one superstar Marvel artist was born to draw him.

item.title: Mistress Harsh New Batman Villain Has a Major Secret Tie to Robin s Origin
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne’s brutal training in the League of Assassins comes back to haunt him with the return of his former teacher, Mistress Harsh. Gotham City is in chaos as Batman and Robin face attacks from unknown enemies, including upgraded villains and new adversaries. The flashback in Batman and Robin #4 reveals Mistress Harsh as a harsh and perfectionist trainer who now seeks revenge on Damian for not living up to her expectations.

item.title: Moon Knight s Death Clears Up a Major Misconception About Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMoon Knight’s death reveals that other heroes, including Captain America and Hawkeye, respected and protected his territory during his absence. Moon Knight’s funeral brings forth a revelation that he is actually respected and admired by his fellow heroes. Marc Spector’s passing leads to the Midnight Mission continuing his work, with heroes like Hawkeye and Captain America stepping up to keep his dream alive. Literature ReviewMoon Knight does not seem to enjoy the best reputation in the Marvel Universe, but his recent death calls this into question.

item.title: Moon Knight s Death Honors His Legacy as a Jewish Superhero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMoon Knight’s final moments showcase his Jewish heritage through the recitation of the Shema, a significant prayer in Judaism. The careful handling of Moon Knight’s death and his connection to Judaism is a welcome surprise in pop culture, where Jewish elements are often underrepresented or stereotyped. Moon Knight’s recitation of the Shema before sacrificing himself emphasizes his role as a stand-out Jewish superhero and honors his legacy within the Marvel universe.

item.title: Moon Knight s Personas Officially Get New Codenames as Separate Heroes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMoon Knight’s alternate personas get new codenames in the finale of his latest comic series, reflecting their unique characteristics. The Traveler, The Embracer, and The Pathfinder are the new names, representing Jake’s traveler status, Steven’s analytical mind, and Khonshu’s god-tier power. While the physical manifestation of these personas is unlikely, the codenames add an interesting layer to Moon Knight’s struggle with his dissociative identity disorder. Literature ReviewMoon Knight’s personality disorder has given him a few different personas over the years, with each one officially getting new superhero identities.

item.title: Most Dragon Ball Fans Missed Goku s Ultimate Family Team-Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGoku, Bardock, and Gohan teamed up in an epic battle against Dark King Demigra in the Super Spacetime Tournament. The family team-up results in a satisfying and devastating blow to the villain, showcasing the power of three generations of Saiyans. Despite Goku not recognizing his father, Bardock and Gohan’s presence is significant beyond the magnitude of their joint attack. Literature ReviewOne of Dragon Ball’s most epic moments occurred when Goku joined forces with his father and his son, proving their family’s incredible strength.

item.title: Most Underrated Avengers Members Ever Form Their Own Team in Epic Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChris Ouellette has shared “B-List/Replacement Avengers” fanart on Instagram. The art creates a roster out of War Machine, Ant-Man, Yellowjacket, Trick Shot, Yelena Belova, White Vision, U.S. Agent, Mr. Fixit, and Thunderstrike. Hopefully, Marvel sees the art and gives this team their own series, similar to 2010’s Chaos War: Dead Avengers. Literature ReviewIn this awesome art, the Avengers’ most underrated members form their own team - including Hawkeye’s brother, Thor’s successor, and the gray Hulk.

item.title: Move Over THE FAR SIDE - Roger Ebert s Comics Rival Gary Larson s Best
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRoger Ebert, known for his film criticism, also had a talent for creating comics similar to Gary Larson’s The Far Side. Ebert entered The New Yorker’s cartoon caption contest numerous times before finally winning first place in 2011. Ebert’s winning caption paved the way for the publication of several of his other caption entries, several of which deserved to win. Literature ReviewKnown for his brutal movie reviews and uplifting journalism, Roger Ebert also co-created some hilarious comics that rival Gary Larson’s The Far Side.

item.title: Move Over, Doctor Doom - Reed Richards Finally Has a Villain Who Equals His Genius
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMetamind is a powerful villain who challenges Reed Richards’ genius and may even surpass him. Metamind is a living brain with the combined intelligence of billions of people, capable of manipulating anyone with a phone. Metamind’s primary objective is to connect with similar life forms across the universe, posing a significant threat to the Fantastic Four and potentially the entire cosmos. Literature ReviewFantastic Four just introduced a new villain that has the intelligence of billions, making it more of a challenge for Reed Richards than Doctor Doom.

item.title: Move Over, Justice League - DC Just Elevated Its Version of the Fantastic Four to Godhood
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Challengers of the Unknown have received a massive power upgrade, now able to kill the powerful character, the Monitor. The Challengers of the Unknown are DC’s version of the Fantastic Four and have a long history in the DC Universe. The Challengers of the Unknown are now even more powerful than the Justice League, with advanced technology and the ability to scan and control the multiverse. Literature ReviewDC’s version of the Fantastic Four just got a major upgrade in power, putting them in the same category as the Justice League.

item.title: Ms. Marvel s Mutant Power Could Eliminate Her Classic Stretching Abilities
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMs. Marvel’s mutant powers may cancel out her Inhuman abilities, according to Emma Frost. Kamala Khan’s Inhuman stretching powers may not last forever, as revealed in Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant #4. There is speculation about whether Marvel will change Ms. Marvel’s powers to match the MCU, but no such change has been made yet. Literature ReviewMs. Marvel’s mutant power is a huge source of speculation, but a warning from Emma Frost suggests it could be a more dramatic change than expected.

item.title: Ms. Marvel s Powers are Officially More Durable Than MCU s Mister Fantastic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMs. Marvel’s embiggen powers make her immune to getting torn apart, unlike Reed Richards in the comics universe. As Orchis searches for mutants at Empire State University, a campus-wide fight erupts between Ms. Marvel and a Stark Sentinel. Kamala’s durability is showcased as the giant robot fails to cause any damage to her body, suggesting she may be more durable than Reed Richards. Literature ReviewMs. Marvel’s embiggen powers have similarities to Mister Fantastic, but there is one major difference that makes Kamala Khan more durable.

item.title: My Hero Academia Calls Back To Its Most Iconic Battle in All for One s Defeat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVictory over All for One was a team effort, highlighting the importance of collaboration in My Hero Academia. Bakugo’s acknowledgment of his teammates’ contributions shows his growth as a hero. All for One’s defeat resulted from a series of heroic actions, not just Bakugo’s efforts, and it calls back to a great moment at the end of the Paranormal Liberation War. Literature ReviewThe end of My Hero Academia’s big fight against All for One hearkens back to the series’ greatest moments, reminding fans this was a team effort.

item.title: My Hero Academia Creator Reveals The One Hero Who Saved His First Big Arc
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShie Hassaikai arc in My Hero Academia is significant and gets quite dark, with the first character death in the series. Series creator Kohei Horikoshi struggled to write such a dark arc and found inspiration in the character Fat Gum. Fat Gum’s good-natured attitude and role in the storyline helped Horikoshi push through and complete the arc. Literature ReviewWhen writing one of My Hero Academia’s largest and darkest arcs, series creator Kohei Horikoshi found himself relying on a particular hero for help.

item.title: My Hero Academia Finally Confirms Its Most Discussed Romance Is Actually True
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOchako’s long-awaited confession of love for Deku not only pleases fans, but also brings a fresh approach to the expected romance. Ochako’s strategy to address Toga’s obsession with their shared love for Deku proves effective in reining her back in. The most impactful element of Ochako’s confession is not her love for Deku, but her appreciation for Toga’s unique smile, fulfilling the villain’s desire for acceptance. Literature ReviewIn My Hero Academia chapter #394, Ochako Uraraka finally says the words about Deku that fans have been waiting for since the beginning of the series.

item.title: My Hero Academia Has Exactly One Chance to Reveal Deku s Father
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeku’s father, Hisashi Midoriya, has yet to make an appearance in the My Hero Academia manga despite being mentioned as alive. Fans have grown curious about Deku’s father’s extended absence and want to know more about him. The best opportunity for Hisashi to appear in the manga would be in an epilogue chapter after the final battle, showcasing how the heroes’ lives have progressed. Literature ReviewMHA creator Kohei Horikoshi promised fans would see Deku’s father in the manga, but with the finale closing in, there’s really only one chance left.

item.title: My Hero Academia Has Its Own Version of One-Punch Man
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn My Hero Academia: Team-Up Missions Chapter #20, the pro hero Blackbelt resembles One-Punch Man’s Saitama in terms of feeling underappreciated despite his rapid takedowns of enemies. The trio of Momo, Kaminari, and Hatsume try to help Blackbelt gain recognition for his efforts, eventually capturing his speed on a high-speed drone camera and showing the public how impressive he really is. Despite Blackbelt’s desire for popularity and his use of affectations, he has been a hero for 10 years in obscurity, indicating that fame isn’t his only concern.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals One Hero Predicted All For One s Defeat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHawks may have pinpointed the weakness that led to All For One’s defeat, his inability to anticipate his own emotions, leading to him losing control over his Quirks. All For One’s plan to steal One For All was flawed from the start, as he failed to consider his own capacity for negative emotions and his ability to control Shigaraki. Bakugo’s provocation and ability to elicit strong emotional responses from All For One ultimately brought about his downfall.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals The Gruesome Fates Of Deku s Predecessors
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia Chapter #408 reveals the disturbing deaths of the previous One for All users, showing the brutality they suffered at the hands of All for One. Most inheritors of One for All were not chosen like Midoriya; they received the power in dire situations. All for One shows no mercy and will stop at nothing to obtain the Quirk. One for All seems to be more of a curse than a blessing, preventing its users from living normal lives and eventually leading to horrific ends.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Bakugo has a Surprising Anime Inspiration
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s character in My Hero Academia draws inspiration from Akira’s Tetsuo, as both characters have a contentious relationship with the protagonist and share similar traits. Despite Bakugo’s early villainous traits, he is able to develop as a character and become more than just a hateful individual, ultimately growing into a hero. Bakugo’s strong desire to be a hero differentiates him from Tetsuo, as he intends to use his powers to help people, unlike Tetsuo, who never had such intentions.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Ending Isn t Just Great, It s Redeeming the Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia’s Final War arc redeems the series from its recent writing issues, bringing back its core themes and delivering an impactful ending. The arc focuses on exploring the emotional depth of characters like Himiko Toga, highlighting the flaws in hero society and the struggles faced by individuals who don’t conform to societal standards. The conflict between Toga and Ochaco is resolved through pacifism and communication, showing the power of kindness and the ability to change someone’s perspective.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Shigaraki Proves Just How Powerful He Really is With One Big Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShigaraki’s next target in My Hero Academia is Mt. Fuji, and his power has the potential to cause a catastrophic volcanic eruption. Destroying Mt. Fuji would have a huge psychological impact, as it is a symbol of Japan and its people. Despite facing an uphill battle, Deku and the heroes are determined to prove that Shigaraki is not invincible. Literature ReviewShigaraki has already had some incredible displays of power within the series, but his latest threat puts him on a completely different level.

item.title: My Hero Academia Still Has A Big Mystery To Address Before Its Ending
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia may finally address the mystery surrounding Shigaraki’s unknown friends, Mikkun, Mon, and Tomo. The recent events in chapter 410 indicate that the series is heading towards its final battle, making it a perfect opportunity to revisit Shigaraki’s tragic past. Past precedent in the series suggests that flashbacks and origin stories for villains, such as Himiko Toga and Dabi, are not out of place, leading to the possibility of a deeper dive into Shigaraki’s backstory.

item.title: Naruto Only Kills One Villain in the Entire Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNaruto, despite being a violent series, rarely kills its villains and promotes kindness and teamwork. Naruto only directly kills one person throughout the series, a Sand Village jonin named Yura. There is speculation that the death of Yura was actually caused by Pain, allowing Naruto to maintain his moral superiority. Literature ReviewNaruto Uzumaki is involved in plenty of fights in the Naruto series, but he actually only kills a single villain during the entire story.

item.title: Naruto Was Never The True Symbol of His Series Themes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRock Lee, despite not having the ability to use ninjutsu and genjutsu like other shinobi, overcame all obstacles to become an amazing ninja through taijutsu. Rock Lee’s success is due to his incredible willpower and refusal to give up on his dreams, even with a significant disadvantage. Compared to Naruto, who had advantages like the Uzumaki clan’s chakra and the power of a jinchuriki, Rock Lee’s journey to become a shinobi was much more difficult and exemplifies the themes of the series.

item.title: Ncuti Gatwa s Doctor Who Relaunch Will Include His Own Comic Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNcuti Gatwa’s debut as the 15th Doctor in Doctor Who is part of a major comeback for the franchise, which is celebrating its 60th anniversary in 2023. Titan Comics will be releasing a new Doctor Who comic series starring Gatwa’s Doctor, written by Dan Watters, to coincide with the show’s release. The return of Doctor Who to the public’s consciousness includes not only the TV show, but also potential new television shows and a release on Disney+ in America.

item.title: New Black Panther Costume Is the Deadly Upgrade He Needs to Kill Moon Knight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSet in the newly established Ultimate Universe, Black Panther fights to stop Moon Knight and his brutal control of Africa. The Black Panther’s new armor will be essential in his mission to free the world from the evil Maker’s Council. Ultimate Black Panther #1 is coming February 7, 2024. Literature ReviewAs the Ultimate Black Panther is revealed, fans get to see the awesome redesigned costume he’ll be using to kill Moon Knight.

item.title: New Far Side Comic Finally Breaks One of the Franchise s Oldest Rules
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGary Larson has released a new Far Side comic, showing dung beetles shopping for Christmas. Larson has revealed that he was originally banned from publishing a dung beetle comic for over a decade. While censors rejected many Far Side comics, it still found both huge success and frequent controversy. Literature ReviewThe Far Side’s Gary Larson just released a new Christmas comic strip - however, its subject matter would have been banned when the franchise started.

item.title: New G.I. Joe Cover Is a Brilliant Callback to Classic Snake Eyes Moment
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYG.I. Joe: A Real American Hero #302 has sold out at the retailer level, prompting a second printing with an all-new variant cover. The new variant cover is a homage to the famous G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero #21 cover; known as the “Silent Interlude” issue, the issue featured Snake Eyes, in what was billed as “the most unusual G.I. Joe story ever” The “Silent Interlude” issue was controversial at the time, but is now widely regarded as one of the greatest Joe comics, showcasing Snake Eyes’ infiltration of Cobra HQ.

item.title: New Gaming Manhwa Mocks One of Isekai s Most Controversial Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSurviving The Game As A Barbarian throws shade at Rising of the Shield Hero by downplaying the importance of shields in its storyline. The manhwa takes a unique twist on the Isekai genre by portraying Isekai’d heroes as “possessed evil spirits” who are killed on sight in the real world. Bjorn’s kindness towards an elf in Surviving The Game As A Barbarian may be a response to the controversial relationship in Rising of the Shield Hero.

item.title: New Ghost Rider - Shock Avengers Villain Gets Fiery Redesign as the New Spirit of Vengeance
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel introduces the new Ghost Rider, Parker Robbins (aka the Hood), who was a major Avengers villain in the ’00s. The Hood, armed with a demonic cloak and dark mystical abilities, becomes the new Ghost Rider and plans to take over the criminal underworld. Ghost Rider: Final Vengeance #1 is coming March 13 from Marvel Comics. Literature ReviewA former Avengers villain and Infinity Stone wielder has been announced as Marvel’s new Ghost Rider, taking over from the original.

item.title: New Nemesis Series Marks Millarworld s Move to Dark Horse Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMark Millar’s Millarworld is moving from Image Comics to Dark Horse Comics, bringing over 20 franchises and 40 graphic novels with it. Five new series are planned for 2024, with Nemesis: Rogues’ Gallery the first to be announced. Millar has also confirmed that Dark Horse will publish several hardcover collections of past series. Literature ReviewAs Mark Millar’s Millarworld moves from Image to Dark Horse, 5 new series are announced for 2024, including Nemesis: Rogues’ Gallery.

item.title: New Red Lantern s Official Debut Showcases the Villain Who Changed DC s Entire History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s new Red Lantern, whose debut has been highly anticipated, has already rewritten parts of the Green Lantern lore and DC’s history. The new Red Lantern hails from the Soviet Union and has a daughter in the present day, adding to the mystery surrounding his character. The Crimson Flame, a source of the Red Lantern’s powers, remains a central mystery, with its vengeful nature adding a unique twist to the character.

item.title: New Robin Is Officially the Most Powerful in DC History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s future daughter, Elizabeth Prince, takes on the mantle of Wonder Robin and proves to be the strongest Robin ever. Elizabeth, also known as Trinity, effortlessly defeats Killer Croc and impresses Damian Wayne with her power.
