The scene in Wonderful Toys highlights Damian’s yearning for his mother’s affection, shedding light on the complex relationship defined by betrayal, tragedy, and a longing for maternal love. DC’s Christmas special serves as a pivotal chapter in Damian’s character development, allowing readers to see the vulnerable child beneath his hardened exterior.

item.title: Robin Calls Out the 1 Justice League Hero He Doesn t Respect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs revealed in World’s Finest: Teen Titans #5, Robin holds a negative view of his teammate, Speedy due to their similarities to their respective mentors, Batman and Green Arrow. Green Arrow has often been compared to Batman, with similarities in their rich boy origins and vigilante personas. The Teen Titans team depicted in World’s Finest has engaged readers with complex characters, featuring young protagonists who don’t always act heroically, who continue to grapple with trust and identity.

item.title: Robin s Animal Transformation Proves He SHOULDN T Be the Next Dark Knight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne undergoes a shocking transformation into a half-cat creature in Nightwing #109’s backup story “Beast World Prologue.” The transformations in “Beast World” reflect the personalities of those infected, showing Damian is his own person, not a carbon copy of Batman. Damian is urged to forge his own identity instead of feeling pressured to follow in his father’s footsteps, highlighting his individuality and need for his own life. Literature ReviewThe events of ‚ÄúBeast World‚Äù finally come for Robin as he gains a new animal form that reveals a surprising inner truth about Damian Wayne.

item.title: Robin s New Power Officially Makes Him Immune to a Classic Superman Weakness
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRobin’s special ability helps him deal with the insidious Black Mercy, something that Superman couldn’t do. Damian and Jon save Trinity from the Black Mercy’s grip by using Damian’s negativity to disarm the plant. Robin’s cynicism gives him an advantage against the Black Mercy, unlike Superman who fell victim to it due to his optimism. Literature ReviewSuperman once fell to the terrifying power of the Black Mercy, but Robin possesses a secret ability that helps him overcome the psychic plant.

item.title: Robin s Perfect Gift Gives Him the Childhood He Always Deserved
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne, the son of Batman, never had a normal childhood due to growing up in the League of Assassins. In Batman/Santa Claus: Silent Knight #4, Santa Claus gives Damian the gift of a true childhood memory by letting him help deliver presents. Damian’s upbringing was filled with training and preparing him to conquer the world, making it a miracle that he even knows who Santa Claus is. Literature ReviewBatman and Robin are the most iconic duo in comic books, but recently Robin has gotten an even better mentor ‚Äî and with him, a heartwarming gift.

item.title: Rogue & Deadpool s Combined Powers Just Created Marvel s Ultimate Healing Factor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Uncanny Avengers #5, Deadpool and Rogue’s powers combine to show the full potential of a healing factor, saving Rogue’s life and proving Deadpool’s ability to survive a nuclear blast. This instance tests the limitations of Rogue’s powers, by having her absorb Deadpool’s healing abilities through bone-on-bone contact, rather than skin-on-skin. The combined forces of Deadpool and Rogue prove to be incredibly powerful, allowing them to survive and carry on a conversation inside nuclear explosion.

item.title: Rogue Cosplay Proves Why the Avengers HAD to Recruit Her
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRogue cosplay by Janine (@j9lives) perfectly captures the character’s classic look, complete with the iconic green-and-yellow bodysuit and red hair with a white streak. Rogue’s journey from villain to hero in the Marvel Universe is exemplified by her membership in both the X-Men and the Avengers, showcasing her growth and redemption. Janine’s portrayal of Rogue highlights the character’s strength and vitality, with her standing triumphantly on the head of a destroyed Sentinel, symbolizing her power and status as a Marvel icon.

item.title: Santa Claus Becomes a True DC Hero with a Genuinely Cool Take on the Fortress of Solitude
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSanta Claus has his own version of Superman’s Fortress of Solitude, called The Glacier, where he keeps dangerous creatures he has captured over the years. The release of these creatures by Krampus turns Santa’s Glacier into a menace within the DC universe, raising questions about the potential threat posed by Superman’s zoo in the Fortress of Solitude. Santa’s Glacier puts him on the same level as other A-list DC heroes like Superman and Batman, solidifying his place among the elite heroes in the DC universe.

item.title: Sasquatch Cosplay Brings Hulk s Impossibly Powerful Rival to Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAn incredible Sasquatch cosplay brings the powerful rival of the Hulk to life, capturing the character’s distinct orange fur and conveying his size and majesty. Sasquatch, like the Hulk, gained his powers through gamma radiation experiments, but his transformation is through a spirit possession, and he once dragged a naval destroyer ashore. Sasquatch and the Hulk have a long history of fighting, with each showdown being intense and inconclusive, making a true battle between the two incredibly destructive.

item.title: Sasuke s Final Boruto Fight Isn t Just Disrespectful, It s An Insult To Fans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSasuke’s final battle in Boruto: Two Blue Vortex #5 is an insult to fans who have followed the character for years. Having Sasuke lose against Code, the least intimidating villain in the series, is incredibly unsatisfying. The lack of showing the battle robs both Sasuke and Code of character moments they desperately need. Literature ReviewSasuke’s final stand in the Boruto manga failed to give the character the send-off he deserved or make the villain that took him down intimidating.

item.title: SCRAPPER Finale Settles Why You Need to Be Reading Blade Runner with Dogs (Exclusive Preview)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYScrapper #6, the finale of the hit series, reveals more of the villainy of SMITE, an evil organization. The story blends elements of Blade Runner with Disney’s Bolt, creating a unique and mature cyberpunk canine-centered quest for justice. Scrapper is coming to an end but might have a future in multimedia ventures. Literature ReviewScreen Rant has an exclusive preview of Scrapper #6, the conclusion to Image Comics’ hit series that brings dogs to the forefront of sci-fi heroism.

item.title: Shazam Family Meets E.T. in a Perfect Spielberg Homage Cover
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam! #8 variant cover recreates iconic E.T. bike chase scene with Billy Batson and foster siblings, but instead of a friendly alien, he’s accompanied by his nemesis Mister Mind. Variant cover showcases the pure-hearted nature of Billy Batson, as he helps even his greatest foe, highlighting his character’s willingness to lend a hand to those in need. The whimsical homage to E.T. in the Shazam! variant cover captures Billy’s heroic spirit and represents his role as a champion who saves both friends and foes.

item.title: Shazam s Version of Kryptonite Turns Him into Justice League s Deadliest Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam’s greatest weakness is mind control, which turns him into a living weapon with no one to stop him. This weakness harms others more than Shazam himself, as he is physically invulnerable. If a villain gains control of Shazam, he becomes the deadliest member of the Justice League. Literature ReviewShazam is the World’s Mightiest Mortal, but his historical weakness has proved that Billy Batson’s mind isn’t nearly as mighty as his body.

item.title: Shazam vs Black Adam DC Offers Crucial New Info on Who s Stronger
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam acknowledges that he is unsure if he is stronger than Black Adam, despite his confidence in his mortal form. Both Shazam and Black Adam possess the same strengths endowed by the Wizard and have never been able to triumph over each other. It remains uncertain who is stronger between Shazam and Black Adam, but hopefully, a future battle will settle it once and for all. Literature ReviewFans may have wondered if Shazam can truly beat Black Adam in a fight and now thanks to an upgrade, the Earth‚Äôs Mightiest Mortal has an honest answer.

item.title: She-Hulk s Ex-Fianc√© Just Saved the World Without Throwing a Punch
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWyatt Wingfoot proves that peaceful negotiations can stop a world-threatening invasion, showcasing a different approach to superhero storytelling. Despite lacking superpowers, Wyatt’s level-headedness and outstretched hand with a peace offering successfully convinces the villain to consider peace talks with Earth. Sensational She-Hulk #2 highlights the character’s ability to tell unique stories, breaking the mold by exploring non-violent solutions in a typically action-packed genre. Literature ReviewShe-Hulk and the Fantastic Four have an endless array of incredible powers at their disposal; one of their allies just showed them all up.

item.title: Shonen Jump Finally Gives an Epilogue to One of its Most Recent Successes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Mashle one-shot manga explores the aftermath of Mash’s story and how it has improved the treatment of magic-less individuals. Mash’s success shows that relying solely on magic is not the only way to achieve success in a magic-filled world. The one-shot manga expands the Mashle universe, leaving room for potential future stories with new characters. Literature ReviewMashle‚Äôs Mash Burnedead may have turned in his school cape for a pastry chef smock, but he‚Äôs still fighting magic in new and unpredictable ways.

item.title: Shonen Jump is The Best It s Been In Years Here s Why
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShonen Jump’s current lineup of manga is the best it has been in years, rivaling the era of the “Big Three”. The magazine has a history of relying on flagship series, but has faced challenges when these series end, and it has to find replacements. Shonen Jump has addressed the issue of canceling series too soon and now allows them more time to develop, resulting in more satisfying endings.

item.title: Shonen Jump Loses Best-Selling Manga Spot For The First Time In 20 Years
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlue Lock is the first manga to dethrone Shonen Jump in two decades; it is the top-selling manga of 2023. The surge in Blue Lock’s popularity can be attributed to the anime adaptation and the manga’s tie-in with the World Cup 2022. Kodansha’s achievement is significant and showcases their potential to compete with Shueisha in the manga industry. Literature ReviewShonen Jump has locked the annual best-selling manga position for the past 20 years, and an unlikely manga just broke the record.

item.title: Shonen Jump May Have Found its Jujutsu Kaisen Replacement With Exciting New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShadow Eliminators could be a replacement for Jujutsu Kaisen once it ends, but it needs to meet Shonen Jump’s tough standards. Shadow Eliminators and Jujutsu Kaisen share similarities in terms of cursed spirits and moral-driven protagonists. For Shadow Eliminators to truly replace Jujutsu Kaisen, it needs a complex power system like Cursed Energy or do the unexpected and go for something simpler. Literature ReviewShadow Eliminators is a new Shonen Jump series that’s giving similar vibes to Jujutsu Kaisen, and could replace the hit manga when it ends.

item.title: Shonen Jump Reignites a Controversial Storyline With One Ridiculous Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTurbo Granny takes center stage as the search for the missing jewel resumes in Dandadan chapter #129. The story has been building up to this moment for years, with multiple sidetracks and new characters introduced along the way. Turbo Granny’s role is elevated from comic relief to a more consequential character, and her mission at the police station is sure to bring more comedic and absurd moments. Literature ReviewShonen Jump’s Dandadan keeps getting sidetracked, but chapter #129 continues a controversial storyline that’s the reason why the series is R-Rated.

item.title: Shonen Jump Releases Spinoff of its Next Massive Hit Ahead of Anime Adaptation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKaiju No. 8: B-Side gives secondary characters a chance to shine with their own background stories, enriching the main storyline. The spin-off focuses on Soshiro Hoshina, Kafka’s superior officer, revealing how he came to occupy his position and his connection to Mina. Kaiju No. 8: B-Side adds important context and background information, making Kaiju No. 8 a deeper and more engaging story, perfect for fans to read ahead of the anime’s premiere.

item.title: Shonen Jump s Big Event Will Stream Internationally In English
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJump Festa 2024 will be streamed internationally for the second time with simultaneous English interpretation, allowing non-Japanese-speaking fans to catch the latest news on their favorite manga and anime series. The event will have three stages - Jump Super Stage RED, Jump Super Stage BLUE, and Jump Studio - featuring panels for both popular series and up-and-coming titles. Fans are excited about the news concerning Dandadan, My Hero Academia, and One Piece, which will close the event as usual.

item.title: Shonen Jump s Big New Title is One Change Away From Living Up to the Hype
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKagurabachi’s popularity is soaring, but the story needs a dedicated arc exploring Chihiro’s father and the origins of the enchanted swords to create a cohesive narrative. Revealing Chihiro’s father’s backstory and the significance of the swords would help viewers understand the magnitude of these powerful weapons and their relevance to the plot. As Chihiro seeks revenge for his father’s murder, he will uncover more about his dad’s past, making an in-depth backstory necessary to enhance the series and meet expectations.

item.title: Shonen Jump s Cthulhu Manga Takes New Direction With Fresh Lovecraftian Monsters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGhost Reaper Girl takes a dramatic turn with the introduction of two Lovecraftian monsters, Hastur and Bastet, who play a crucial role in the current plot. The inclusion of characters created by other Lovecraftian authors shows that mangaka Akissa Saik√© considers their work as canon and expands the scope of the story beyond Lovecraft’s original writings. The Drops of Decay, a poison featured in the manga, is not found in Lovecraft’s mythology, but Saik√© incorporates ideas of poison and decay from Lovecraft’s works to create original elements in Ghost Reaper Girl.

item.title: Shonen Jump s New Series Brings A Much-Needed New Approach To Sports Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Green Greens takes a character-driven approach instead of relying heavily on action and sports sequences. The debut chapter focuses more on the friendship between the two protagonists rather than showcasing golf as the main focus. The success of the character-driven approach suggests that manga creators can prioritize character development over action to create a compelling series. Literature ReviewWhile golf is at the center of the new Shonen Jump series Green Green Greens, the early focus is on the characters and that’s the best thing about it.

item.title: Shonen Jump s Upcoming Anime Kaiju No. 8 Already Made History For a Big Reason
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKaiju No. 8 is the first anime ever to stream on X, a social media platform, making it stand out among new 2024 anime. The announcement of Kaiju No. 8 streaming on X flew under the radar due to the other exciting news at Jump Festa. It is unclear how the production team will recoup their investment if the anime is available for free on X, but fans may need to pay to watch it.

item.title: Shonen Jump Settled Dragon Ball s Gogeta Vs. Vegito Debate Long Ago
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWeekly Shonen Jump declared in 1995 that Dragon Ball Z’s Gogeta would win in a short match, while Vegito would win in a long battle. Gogeta and Vegito’s power levels are so similar that either can potentially win a duel, but Potara’s fusion has fewer faults. While both Fusion Dance and Potara Earrings have pros and cons, the rareness of the Earrings makes Fusion Dance a better option for most fighters.

item.title: Silver Surfer s Ultimate Form Finally Made Him More Powerful Than Galactus
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTimeslip was a ’90s initiative to reimagine Marvel characters, including Silver Surfer and Galactus. In this reality, Silver Surfer assembles a weapon to kill Galactus, but then discovers he must replace his former master. The guilt destroys Silver Surfer, turning him into an inhuman force of destruction who splits planets in two with his new, blade-like board. Literature ReviewWhen Silver Surfer finally found a way to kill Galactus, he had to become something even worse to keep the universe from collapsing.

item.title: Sith History Changes Forever, As the Tech They Tried to Destroy Returns After Centuries
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe “Dark Droids” crossover event in Marvel’s Star Wars comics changed the history of the franchise, introducing a thrilling new villain and recontextualizing the role of the ancient Sith in the galaxy. The Scourge, a viral artificial intelligence, was a catastrophic threat to galactic civilization, spreading its consciousness among droids and turning them against their makers. The Scourge surpassed the Sith as the greatest threat to the galaxy, seeking to possess all lifeforms in the galaxy, biological and mechanical.

item.title: Skullcrawlers, Psychovultures & Mother Longlegs 10 Deadliest Skull Island Megafauna in MonsterVerse Continuity (Besides Kong)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSkull Island is teeming with a variety of dangerous megafauna, including Skullcrawlers, Psychovultures, and Mother Longlegs. These monsters make up the island’s unique ecosystem. Some of the deadliest creatures on Skull Island include the Sirenjaw, a crocodile-like creature with plants growing from its body, and the Death Jackals, cannibalistic predators that rarely attack other living organisms. The Magma Turtles, with lava pumping through their veins, and the Spore Mantis, which encases its prey in sap, are also among the deadliest creatures on Skull Island.

item.title: Sonic Almost Sacrificing a Chaos Emerald Shows How He s Grown as a Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSonic’s recent actions show that he is more considerate of others and willing to act on their behalf, even if it goes against his own goals. In contrast to Sonic’s growth, Tails is shown to prioritize science over respecting the privacy of others, highlighting Sonic’s heroic nature even more. Other characters, like Tangle and Rouge, prioritize obtaining a Chaos Emerald over anything else, making Sonic’s ability to give up the Emerald even more impressive.

item.title: Sonic s Latest Villains Were Defeated by the Last Hero Fans Would Expect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVanilla the Rabbit surprises readers with an unexpected victory over Rough and Tumble in Sonic #66, redeeming her previous lackluster appearances. Vanilla’s act of intimidation impresses the Chaotix, who try to warn her about the villains, but she clearly has the situation under control. Vanilla’s unexpected achievement subverts expectations and highlights her victory while overshadowing her earlier embarrassing blunder in the Metal Virus Saga. Literature ReviewNo fan who has been following IDW’s Sonic the Hedgehog since the Metal Virus Saga would think this character actually saves the day in issue #66.

item.title: Sonic s Speed & Attitude Will Always Work Against Him, & His New Special Proves It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSonic’s speed and attitude hinder his ability to strategize and care for others, as seen in the winter-themed competitions in Winter Jam. The one-shot plays with readers’ expectations by teasing new powers for established characters, but ultimately debunking them. Winter Jam incorporates tropes more effectively than the main continuity, potentially paving the way for more compelling storytelling in the future. Literature ReviewHow the Winter Jam one-shot portrays Sonic the Hedgehog is unlike IDW’s other 2023 seasonal-themed specials or even the main continuity.

item.title: Sonic Teases a New Replacement Vehicle for His Beloved Tornado Biplane
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTails may be testing a new transport vehicle to replace the Tornado biplane in the upcoming Sonic the Hedgehog comic. The new vehicle is a “new extreme gear design” that can carry two people and is being tested by Sonic and Tails. Despite the potential of the new design, past stories suggest that the Tornado biplane will continue to be a major element in the comics. Literature ReviewThe official solicitation of Sonic the Hedgehog #68 reveals that Sonic and Tails are testing out a new extreme gear board.

item.title: Sorry Batman 1 Bat-Family Member Has the Best Plan for Battling Wonder Woman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatgirl Cassandra Cain shows Batman how to properly defeat Wonder Woman by overwhelming her with speed and gadgets. Batman’s previous methods against Wonder Woman, such as trickery and avoidance, have never worked due to her power set. Even Batman struggles to take down Wonder Woman, but Cassandra’s approach of outsmarting and overwhelming her from a distance proves effective. Literature ReviewWonder Woman is one of DC’s most powerful fighters, one who Batman has never quite been able to take down ‚Äî but one Bat-Family member has a plan.

item.title: Sorry Bruce Wayne Catwoman Thinks Gotham Needs a Brand New Batman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCatwoman believes Gotham needs a new kind of Batman, one that focuses on protecting the suburbs where regular people are affected by petty crimes. A man with amnesia who believes he is Batman has been protecting the suburbs, gaining praise from Catwoman. Catwoman tries to prevent the real Batman from interfering with amnesiac Batman’s work, arguing that the Bat-Signal is rarely lit for people who truly need help. Literature ReviewCatwoman and Batman have long had a complicated relationship, but one event finally makes Catwoman admit that Gotham needs a better Batman.

item.title: Sorry Deadpool - Only 1 Marvel Hero Is Officially Unkillable (& It s Not Who You Think)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMr. Immortal surpasses even cosmic deities in his immortality, making him the most unkillable hero in the Marvel universe. While his healing factor is powerful, Mr. Immortal’s ability to heal only kicks in for serious, life-threatening injuries. Though he may be relatively obscure, Mr. Immortal has the potential to outlive all other heroes in the universe and make a mark on the Avengers. Literature ReviewDeadpool is known for his incredible healing factor, but one Avenger will outlive the Merc With The Mouth - and everyone else in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Sorry Deadpool - X-Men Upgrades an Iconic Mutant With Marvel s Best Healing Factor Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIceman’s lack of corporeal form is actually his ultimate strength, as his disembodied consciousness can jump into nearby moisture and live until he can refreeze and rebuild. Holding onto his physical body has been a liability for Iceman, but being unattached to a corporeal form makes him almost unkillable. Iceman’s new power allows his consciousness to escape into any atmospheric moisture, making him impossible to cage and giving him a healing factor that exceeds even Deadpool’s.

item.title: Sorry Joker 1 Surprising Gotham Villain Threatens Robin s Life in Official Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne’s fate hangs in the balance as a variant cover for Batman and Robin #7 hints at Man-Bat potentially killing Robin. The absence of Batman intensifies the gravity of the situation, making it a bleak picture for the young hero. If Robin survives, the aftermath could explore a fresh narrative of recovery and physical therapy, avoiding the repetition of past storylines. Literature ReviewThe fate of Damian Wayne is uncertain as DC teases that an unexpected villain may be the next Gotham Rogue to join the infamous ‘Killed a Robin’ club.

item.title: Sorry Nightwing - DC Confirms the 1 Hero Batman Can Trust Most, & It s Not Dick Grayson
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman is in danger, and the only person he can rely on is Catwoman, as he fights against the Orgham family and the Azmer demon inside him. The rest of the Bat-Family is too busy or disconnected to rescue Batman, highlighting Catwoman’s unwavering dedication to him. Despite their rocky relationship, Catwoman is willing to save Batman from his darkest moment, promising to never let him fall. Literature ReviewBatman has a ton of allies that he can call on in times of need, but the one hero he trusts more than anyone is someone fans might not expect.

item.title: Sorry Raven But Starfire Has a New Best Friend and Together Theyre Unstoppable
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStarfire and Wonder Girl’s friendship deepens as they face intense battles and life-threatening situations, forming an unbreakable bond. The trust between Starfire and Wonder Girl is evident as they rely on each other’s abilities and put their lives in each other’s hands. The Titans’ new direction in Dawn of DC allows for exploration of new relationships, moving beyond the friendship between Starfire and Raven. Literature ReviewStarfire and Raven may have once been DC’s ultimate best friends forever duo, but it looks like Kori has a new bestie and together their undefeatable.

item.title: Sorry Wonder Woman Diana s New Daughter Reveals Her TRUE Role Models
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s daughter, Trinity, sees Superman and Robin as her brothers and wishes to be like them. The Black Mercy, a parasitic alien plant, is used in the story to show people their greatest desires. The new Trinity (Trinity, Superman, and Batman/Robin) is established as a fun departure from their parents, with a comedic and lighthearted tone. Literature ReviewThough Trinity loves and admires her mother, a new story reveals that Wonder Woman’s daughter really wants to be like Jon Kent and Damian Wayne.

item.title: Sorry, But Colossus Codename Makes No Sense
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYColossus’ current codename fails to highlight his most important qualities, including his Russian heritage, and doesn’t fully embody his power of nearly-invulnerable organic steel skin. A name change for Piotr Rasputin could be the perfect way to usher in Colossus’ new era and acknowledge his major character development. Exchanging the name Colossus for something more appropriate, which suits him better than his current moniker, would be an appropriate development for the character after suffering greatly as Colossus during recent storylines.

item.title: Sorry, Star Wars - Peacemaker s Mandalorian Armor Officially Returns to DC Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeacemaker’s Mandalorian armor, which hasn’t been seen in decades, makes a comeback in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #22. The armor gives Peacemaker unique abilities and a more formidable presence in battle. The design pays homage to Star Wars and reminds DC fans of a time when the brand had more creative freedom. Literature ReviewPeacemaker has a lot of different armors and helmets he uses to bring peace to the masses, with his Mandalorian-like design returning to DC Comics.

item.title: Soul Trek Green Lantern Officially Names His Psychedelic New Healing Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern’s new ability, the soul trek, allows him to heal wounds and trauma, making it a powerful tool in his fight against the Radiant Dead infection. The soul trek is not just limited to healing, but has the potential to help Green Lantern overcome any injury, no matter how severe. If successful, the soul trek will be a game-changer for Green Lantern, providing him with the ability to heal and recover from any villain’s attack.

item.title: Spawn 10 of the Most Spine Tingling Covers From the 1990s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe cover art of Spawn comic books in the ’90s often showcased terrifying and shocking images, such as the Violator in his true form. Spawn’s face is grotesquely scarred and sutured in the middle with a shoelace, a result of Batman’s attack on him. The Clown persona of Violator is displayed using a severed human head as a hand puppet, adding to the repugnance and horror - and these are just some of the truly spine tingling Spawn covers from the ’90s.

item.title: Spider-Gwen Battles an All-New Doctor Octopus in Giant-Size Special
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Gwen is set to have a big year in 2024 with her own Giant-Size issue and a new limited series, making it the perfect time to dive into her upcoming comics. Giant-Size Spider-Gwen #1, part of Marvel’s celebration of the 50th anniversary of Giant-Size comics, will feature Gwen Stacy battling a new Doctor Octopus to save her best friend, MJ Watson. The limited series Spider-Gwen: Smash, launching in December, follows Gwen and her band as they face a mysterious assassin and team up with Dazzler to battle Earth-65’s Hulk.

item.title: Spider-Gwen Cosplay Is the Multiversal Crossover Every Spider-Woman Fan Wanted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Spider-Gwen cosplay brings together multiple variants of the character from across the multiverse. The team-up of Spider-Gwen cosplayers highlights the character’s popularity and her evolution from being a love interest to a multi-faceted hero. The concept of a Ghost Spider team-up, featuring different versions of Spider-Gwen, has been explored in recent Marvel comics, showcasing the creative and fun opportunities that variants provide in the Marvel universe. Literature ReviewSpider-Gwen has teamed up with her own Marvel universe variants in a group cosplay showing how fun a Spider-Woman/Ghost Spider collective could be.

item.title: Spider-Gwen Cosplay Turns Her into Carnage s Creepiest Host Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Spider-Gwen/Carnage cosplay from @biancabellcosplaya reveals a creepy and fierce side to the heroine. Gwen has a symbiote bond with Venom that is altered in the cosplay. The cosplay explores an alternative symbiote path for Spider-Gwen and highlights the visual impact of a bond with Carnage. Literature ReviewA cosplay from @biancabellacosplay presents what a Gwen Stacy and Carnage combination would look like, replacing Venom as her symbiote pairing. A cosplay of Spider-Gwen reveals just how creepy the heroine can be when she becomes a host to Carnage.

item.title: Spider-Gwen is Finally Joining Marvel s Main 616 Universe For Good
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Gwen, a popular character from Earth-65, is finally making her way to Marvel’s main Earth-616 universe. The character’s move to Earth-616 marks a new era of storytelling and will bring her in contact with iconic Marvel heroes and villains. Spider-Gwen’s transition to Earth-616 has been long-awaited and is expected to elevate her status as one of Marvel’s top characters. Literature ReviewThe upcoming series Spider-Gwen: The Ghost Spider will see the heroic Gwen Stacy of Earth-65 become a permanent resident of Marvel’s Earth-616.

item.title: Spider-Gwen s New Nightmare Powers Show How Sick the Spider-Verse Can Get
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Gwen: Smash #1 features a dark and nightmarish variant cover by Peach Momoko that reveals the sinister potential of the Spider-Verse. The series focuses on Spider-Gwen and her band, the Mary Janes, as they embark on a tour, but face challenges from a looming assassin. Marvel’s nightmare variants, including this Spider-Gwen iteration, offer a grotesque and thrilling makeover that could introduce new fighting techniques and encounters for Spider-Verse heroes.

item.title: Spider-Gwen Smash #1 Gives Gwen Stacy the Unique Adventure She Deserves - Outside Spider-Man s Shadow (Review)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Gwen: Smash #1 focuses on Gwen Stacy as the headliner in her own universe, without being a sidekick to Peter or Miles. The series introduces familiar faces like the Mary Janes and Dazzler, building out Gwen’s New York and her band’s shot at stardom. The comic showcases Gwen’s unique story, separate from Peter Parker’s, and highlights her circle of friends, her band, and her family. Literature ReviewSpider-Gwen: Smash spins a web that only Gwen Stacy can handle: her band is on tour with Dazzler, but a secret supervillain is a harsh music critic.

item.title: Spider-Man Already Named the 1 Hero Everyone Hates More Than Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil’s impulsive nature and lack of consideration for consequences make him an unpopular teammate, even among superheroes like Spider-Man. Spider-Man and Daredevil’s different approaches to a hostage situation reveal their contrasting personalities, with Daredevil being reckless and Spider-Man being cautious. Despite their differences, Spider-Man reaches out to Daredevil because he needs his help as a lawyer, highlighting Daredevil’s unique skills outside of his heroics. Literature ReviewSpider-Man is a hero who often has difficulties with team-ups, from his infamous bad luck to his constant commentary, but there’s one hero even worse.

item.title: Spider-Man Cosplay Brings an Iconic, Deadly Canon Event to Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne of Spider-Man’s most iconic moments of strength and determination has recreated through a breathtaking cosplay from professional Caleb Weeks. The cosplay pays homage to a scene from Amazing Spider-Man #33, which was also recreated in Amazing Spider-Man #500, in a moment showcasing Spider-Man’s never-give-up attitude. This faithful recreation captures the essence of Spider-Man, and goes so far as to inspires fans to always get back up and save others in need.

item.title: Spider-Man Cosplay Recreates His Ultra-Dark BACK IN BLACK Comic Era in Real Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Spider-Man fan pays tribute to the iconic Back in Black storyline with stunning cosplay that captures the emotionally charged moments of the narrative. The cosplayer’s meticulous recreation of iconic covers, like The Amazing Spider-Man #543 cover, showcases the themes of revenge, sacrifice, and the repercussions of revealing a superhero’s secret identity. The cosplay is not only a tribute to the Back in Black era but also a celebration of Spider-Man’s rich lore, incorporating elements from the 1980s Venom storyline and paying homage to characters like Eddie Brock.

item.title: Spider-Man Has Never Led His Own Super-Team for One Big Reason
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man lacks experience leading a superteam, as shown in The Amazing Spider-Man #39 where none of his assembled heroes even consider following his directions. Peter Parker’s poor leadership skills are on full display during Marvel’s latest crossover event, the city-wide “Gang War” gripping New York City. The crossover event highlights that Spider-Man is not a natural leader, and is better suited as a supporting player in a major team.

item.title: Spider-Man Lore Changes Forever as Marvel Spills the Secrets of the FIRST Goblin (Before Norman Osborn)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel is finally addressing the forgotten story of Nels van Adder, aka the Proto-Goblin, Marvel’s first Goblin before Norman Osborn’s Green Goblin. The comic will explore Peter Parker’s early days as Spider-Man and delve into the secret history of the Osborn family. Spider-Man: Shadow of the Green Goblin #1 is coming from Marvel Comics April 3, 2024. Literature ReviewAfter 26 years, Spider-Man’s Proto-Goblin finally returns, spilling the secrets behind Norman Osborn’s fateful origin as the Green Goblin.

item.title: Spider-Man Miles Morales List of Mentors Puts Batman s Training to Shame
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales has had the opportunity to learn from multiple mentors without having to leave his city, earning costumes and advice along the way. Unlike Batman, Miles can continue to add mentors to his repertoire even after becoming a hero, continuously improving his skills. Miles Morales gets to learn from experts in various fields of study during his superhero career, without needing to leave his home base like Batman did.

item.title: Spider-Man Proves a Forgotten MCU Team are Marvel s Most Pathetic Villains
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man effortlessly defeats the low-level Tracksuit Mafia alongside Tombstone and She-Hulk in The Amazing Spider-Man #40. The Tracksuit Mafia is a silly yet dangerous gang, known for their humor and brutal acts of violence. The gang, originally associated with Hawkeye, is expanding beyond their previous encounters and becoming a threat to other Marvel street-level heroes. Literature ReviewThese MCU villains was always thought of as a joke, but their appearance in The Amazing Spider-Man’s Gang War story shows what pushovers they are.

item.title: Spider-Man s Exes Reunite as Marvel s Best Dynamic Duo in JACKPOT & BLACK CAT
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMary Jane and Black Cat reunite in an all-new series, teaming up to take down an emerging threat. The series will explore Mary Jane’s evolution as a hero and her new superhero moniker, Jackpot. A classic Spider-Man villain with history with the heroines will be the antagonist, creating a thrilling mystery for readers to solve. Literature ReviewMary Jane and Black Cat are teaming up once again, and this time they’ll be taking out a blackmailer while MJ shows off her new powers as Jackpot.

item.title: Spider-Man s First Words to Joker Show Why He s the Ultimate Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man’s encounter with the Joker in the 1990s crossover Spider-Man and Batman reveals his darker emotions, but he maintains control and resists the urge for vengeance. Peter Parker has maintained his status as one of the most relatable superheroes, stemming in large part from his vulnerability and ability to grapple with moral dilemmas. Uncle Ben’s death shapes Spider-Man’s moral compass, and in the long-term perhaps prevented him from becoming a darker and more vengeful hero.

item.title: Spider-Man s New Origin Makes 1 Huge Change That Alters His Entire Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Ultimate Spider-Man origin story presents a daring, fresh take, with an adult Peter Parker choosing to be bitten by a radioactive spider. In the debut issue of the new series, Tony Stark sends a hologram to Peter, informing him of his destiny as a superhero, and urging him to reclaim his stolen future. Peter’s active choice to become Spider-Man recontextualizes his entire character, making his origin more heroic, but potentially more tragic as well, while making good on the Ultimate Universe’s promise to do something new and exciting with the character.

item.title: Spider-Man s New Villain Has Been Hiding in Plain Sight from the Start
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man’s latest villain, Re-Po, is revealed to be a collections agent from Peter Parker’s past who hounded him for unpaid hospital bills. Re-Po kidnaps Randy Robertson and plans to kill him as part of Peter’s unpaid interest, but Spider-Man saves the day. This revelation adds new context to the Dark Web arc and shows that eating the fruit from the Tree of Exquisite Liberation not only kills but also transforms the eater into a servant of Limbo.

item.title: Spider-Man vs Izuku Midoriya Unites MHA & Marvel Fandom in Jaw-Dropping Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man and Deku face off in a stunning fan art, showcasing their powers and potential fight. The presence of the Venom symbiote hints at a possible reason for their conflict. The artist, Thirdphp, has a history of creating superhero matchups and this piece adds to their collection of powerful character face-offs. Literature ReviewSpider-Man is up against Deku’s All for One in an astonishing piece of fanart that pits two friendly neighborhood superheroes against each other.

item.title: Spider-Man vs Shang-Chi Settles Marvel s Most Hated Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man and Shang-Chi, both disliked heroes, will face off in Marvel’s Gang War event, with their deadly fight potentially reshaping New York City. Spider-Man is used to being hated, but he’s currently on the outs with his friends and dealing with the consequences of being an outlawed hero in New York. Shang-Chi, who was raised by a criminal syndicate, is trying to change the Five Weapons Society for good, but his actions and alliances have made him a target and put him in conflict with Spider-Man.

item.title: Spider-Punk & Wolverine Unite as Marvel s Most Badass Possible Team Assembles
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine and Spider-Punk are stand-out members of a team-up in Marvel’s 2023 Stormbreakers variant covers, creating a highly powered and highly entertaining team. The Stormbreakers program showcases Marvel’s top young artistic talents, building on the success of its prior Young Guns initiative. Fans eagerly anticipate the potential character dynamics between Wolverine and Spider-Punk, with many hoping for an upcoming story that brings them together. Literature ReviewMarvel’s Stormbreakers 2023 class of artists will assemble the most badass possible team with a series of variant covers, for issues coming in 2024.

item.title: Spider-Punk Arms Race Trailer Unleashes the Spider-Verse s Breakout Hero with New Villains & Allies
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Punk returns with his Spider-Band in the Arms Race miniseries, facing off against new villains including Doctor Octopus and the Lizard Gang. Marvel is introducing a punk version of Black Panther, expanding the world of Earth-138 with new heroes and villains. Spider-Punk: Arms Race is coming February 28 from Marvel Comics. Literature ReviewSpider-Punk is back, as new miniseries Arms Race confronts him with new villains and introduces a new ally in the form of a punk Black Panther.

item.title: Spider-Verse s Most Disturbing Hero Is Reborn in Nightmare Fuel Miles Morales Redesign
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales now has his own version of a disturbing hero called Spiders-Man, who is made up of a collective hive mind of spiders. The cover art for Miles Morales: Spider-Man #13, created by Peach Momoko, showcases the darker side of the Marvel Universe. This new iteration of Spiders-Man, with spiders comprising the costume itself, adds an even creepier spin to the concept and could potentially become a permanent addition to the Spider-Verse.

item.title: Spider-Woman Is Body-Horror Nightmare Fuel as Her Powers Finally Go Haywire
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Nightmare variant covers feature horrifying situations for their characters, including Spider-Woman losing control of her powers. Peach Momoko’s artwork in the Nightmare cover for Spider-Woman #2 gives the character an unsettling, insect-like appearance. The Nightmare variant showcases Spider-Woman’s worst fears and presents her as pure nightmare fuel. Literature ReviewSpider-Woman lives in fear of her powers going berserk, and now in a Nightmare variant by Peach Momoko, she finally loses control.

item.title: Spy x Family Brings Big Changes To Anya, Proving It s Still Moving Forward
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAnya’s character undergoes a big change in Chapter #92 of Spy x Family, showing the series is more than just gag comedy. Tatsuya Endo is branching out from the early gags and giving more depth to background characters like Millie Myers and introducing new ones like the Authens. The chapter focuses on Anya’s schoolwork and her improvement in Classical Language with the help of the Authens, proving that education can be fun and giving her a long-term goal of world peace.

item.title: Spy x Family Fixes A Major Continuity Error in the Most Genius Way Possible
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpy x Family finally explains the inconsistent spelling of Anya’s name, revealing that she herself was misspelling it all along. Anya’s habit of misspelling her own name adds to her endearing and relatable character, showcasing her childish tendencies and struggles with academics. Despite being the butt of jokes, Anya’s struggles and mannerisms accurately depict a child’s perspective, contributing to the series’ perfect balance between funny and cute. Literature ReviewSpy x Family has finally addressed one of its biggest continuity errors involving Anya, and the explanation has been hiding in plain sight all along.

item.title: Stan Lee s Classic Catchphrase is a Rallying Cry in the Marvel Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStan Lee’s posthumous trend of comic cameos continues with a catchphrase cameo in Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant #4. His signature catchphrase, “Excelsior!”, inspires a rallying cry within the Marvel Universe to help Ms. Marvel save the day. Stan Lee’s impact on the Marvel Universe is still felt as his catchphrase unites the troops and helps swing the pendulum in a superhero’s favor. Literature ReviewA classic catchphrase often associated with the legendary Stan Lee makes an appearance in Ms.

item.title: Stan Lee Wouldn t Believe How 2023 Rewrote the Cosmic Hierarchy of Marvel s Gods
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel is expanding its cosmology, with the introduction of multiple new deities and god-level characters in 2023 representing a concentrated effort to tell stories at a higher power-level. Jonathan Hickman’s G.O.D.S. series is working to redefine the Marvel cosmos at large, in the vein of the author’s 2019 reboot of the X-Men franchise. Al Ewing’s Immortal Thor is revealing the true history of the Marvel Universe; together, the work of Ewing, Hickman, and many other creators at Marvel is both testing the limits of classic characters, and introducing exciting new ones, proving Marvel is more willing to take creative risks than it has in some time.

item.title: Star Trek Confirmed Tasha Yar Is Queer with 1 Surprising Romance
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWhile not explicitly queer in The Next Generation, fans have long considered Tasha Yar as being coded lesbian or bisexual. While it took a few decades, the franchise eventually agreed, pairing her with Ro Laren in ‘The Last Generation.’ The story sees the two meet when the timeline is rewritten, turning Starfleet’s heroes into anti-Klingon freedom fighters on a conquered Earth. Literature ReviewStar Trek fans have long speculated that Tasha Yar was an early queer hero, and while it took decades, the franchise eventually agreed.

item.title: Star Trek Confirms Starfleet Has Finally Rescinded Its Brutal General Order 7 Death Sentence
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Trek: Defiant #10 confirms that Starfleet has repealed General Order Seven, a brutal law that put to death anyone attempting contact with the Talosians. The law seemed out of step with Star Trek’s progressive ideals, but it was implemented due to the harrowing experience Captain Pike had with the Talosians, who intended to use him to sire a new slave race. While General Order Seven has been repealed, not just anyone can freely visit Talos IV.

item.title: Star Trek Every Story Arc From the 1990s Starfleet Academy Series, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Starfleet Academy was a risky yet successful endeavor, introducing new characters and compelling storylines outside of existing Trek shows. The series skillfully intertwined with the larger Star Trek franchise, delivering poignant sequels and references to iconic episodes. The arcs in Starfleet Academy tackled complex themes like loss, loyalty, and identity, while building a rich and interconnected narrative. Literature ReviewMarvel’s 1990s Starfleet Academy comic was years ahead of its time, and now here is every arc from the book, ranked.

item.title: Star Trek Has Been Hiding a Rick and Morty Reference Right Under Fans Noses
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Trek: Picard’s Academy comic reveals a surprising connection to Rick and Morty through the characters Doqtis and Marta, whose names resemble the original version of Rick and Morty, Doc and Mharti. The comic explores Picard’s struggle to make friends at Starfleet Academy due to his family trauma, but Doq, an El-Aurian like Guinan, provides support despite Picard’s dismissal of the need for friends. As the cadets face off against Romulans in their important Evasive Maneuvers exam, Doq and Marty will be by Picard’s side, hopefully coming up with escape ideas that are less disgusting than what would be seen in Rick and Morty.

item.title: Star Trek Just Upgraded TOS Talosians into a Major New Galactic Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTalosians, the powerful alien race from the Original Series, are elevated to a galactic threat in Star Trek: Defiant #10. Starfleet has kept the Talosians prisoner on their planet, but a group has managed to escape, causing nervousness and potential conflict. Worf realizes the moral wrongdoing of Starfleet’s treatment of the Talosians and takes steps to rectify the situation. Literature ReviewThe Talosians are one of the oldest, and most mysterious, races in the Star Trek universe, and now they are its biggest threat.

item.title: Star Trek Officially Calls Out Captain Picard s Most Embarrassing Blunder
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain Picard is called out for being fooled by time-traveling con man Berlinghoff Rasmussen in Star Trek: Defiant #10. The Orion medic on the Defiant expresses disbelief that Picard was so easily fooled and admires Rasmussen’s scheme. Rasmussen’s ability to fool Picard shows that he is a skilled con man and an embarrassment to both Picard and Worf. Literature ReviewCaptain Picard is a moral and astute leader, but he once almost got taken in by a time traveling con-man, and it now gets a call out.

item.title: Star Trek Reveals the Romulans Have Weaponized the Vulcans Emotion-Purging Ritual
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRomulans have weaponized the Kolinahr ritual, using it to sharpen their emotions for war. The Romulans have a corrupted version of Kolinahr, turning it into a tool of hatred and anger. The Romulans’ use of Kolinahr makes them one of the deadliest races in the galaxy. Literature ReviewThe Kolinahr ritual helps Vulcans purge emotions, but their cousins the Romulans have weaponized it, turning it into a tool of war.

item.title: Star Trek Reveals the Secret Behind the Most Important Fight of Picard s Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn “Star Trek: Picard’s Academy #2,” a comic book, Picard witnesses a student being bullied but chooses not to intervene, believing it’s the bullied student’s responsibility to handle the situation. The comic book connects to the “Tapestry” episode of “Star Trek: The Next Generation,” suggesting that Picard’s decision to help a friend in a fight may have been influenced by his earlier failure to protect a bullied student. The inclusion of time travel in the “Tapestry” episode adds complexity to the theory, implying that Past Picard allowed himself to be stabbed in order to save Future Picard, potentially changing his motivations in the original brawl.

item.title: Star Trek s Dr. McCoy Quit Starfleet As a Tribute to Captain Kirk (Not an Insult)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMcCoy quit Starfleet as a tribute to Kirk, not out of anger or insult. McCoy didn’t feel safe going on missions without Kirk and believed no other captain could protect him like Kirk did. McCoy’s decision to leave Starfleet was driven by his lack of trust in any other captain. Literature ReviewFor years, fans debated why Doctor McCoy left Starfleet, and now one Star Trek comic has revealed his stunning reason.

item.title: Star Trek s Harry Kim Admits Serving on Voyager Basically Destroyed His Career
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarry Kim reveals that serving on Voyager almost ruined his Starfleet career - now he’s a badass operative on the Tzenkethi homeworld. Harry’s time on Voyager showed him a bigger galaxy and made him feel wasted on other ships, leading him to become a Starfleet operative. After being a perpetual ensign on Voyager, Harry is finally getting the chance to show what he’s made of, no longer being underestimated.

item.title: Star Trek s New Deadliest Species Wield the Opposite of 24th Century Technology
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Tzenkethi, a low-tech species in the Star Trek universe, pose a significant threat to the Federation despite their lack of advanced technology. The Tzenkethi rely on hard math, instinct, pattern recognition, and augury, eschewing 24th-century innovations like replicators and AI. With their new, even larger and more powerful ships, the Tzenkethi are a grave threat to the Alpha Quadrant, causing fear in the Federation and Starfleet. Literature ReviewThe Tzenkethi are the new big bads of the Star Trek universe, and they are shockingly low tech compared to Starfleet.

item.title: Star Trek s Original Ban on Female Starship Captains Is Even Weirder Than It Seems
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Trek: Mission’s End #5 reveals that there was a real unofficial ban on women captains in the Star Trek universe, which contradicts the franchise’s progressive vision for humanity. Kirk informs Ambassador Casady that they can’t pursue a relationship because it would be unprofessional, now that the ban on women starship captains has been lifted. The ban on women captains in Starfleet is seen as a shameful chapter in its history, but it is important to note that it did not last long and was eventually corrected.

item.title: Star Trek Turned 2023 into the Year of Scotty - & He More Than Earned It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYScotty’s diverse experiences on different starships have given him a depth of knowledge beyond his peers. He practically wrote the book on starship engineering. Scotty proved that not even god-like beings are a match for him, as he helped develop a method of detecting and defeating them. In 2023, Scotty had the opportunity to say goodbye to his old friend Captain Kirk, found unexpected depth in his own psyche, and his iconic catchphrase took on a new meaning as a symbol of his skills and knowledge.

item.title: Star Trek vs Alien Crossover Was Meant to Give Picard His Ultimate Challenge
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Trek and Alien crossover would have given Captain Picard his biggest challenge, with Xenomorphs, the Borg, and the Romulans involved. The scrapped book, Acceptable Losses, had the potential for an explosive and epic story that fans were deprived of. While Starfleet has advanced technology and weaponry, a crossover would have posed a significant fight, especially with the presence of the deadly Xenomorphs, Romulans, and the Borg. Literature ReviewA proposed Star Trek/Aliens crossover would have pit Captain Picard against his biggest challenge: assimilated Xenomorphs.

item.title: Star Wars Coolest Purple Lightsaber Returns, As Monster Hunter Ty Yorrick Gets a New Mission
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTy Yorrick, a purple lightsaber-wielding monster hunter, returns in a new comic series in 2024, facing old enemies and friends in the High Republic era. Ty has taken on an apprentice named Drewen, a Segredo, who will play a more prominent role in the upcoming miniseries. Ty’s adventures as a former Jedi and mercenary will take place behind enemy lines, clashing with the Nihil. Literature ReviewStar Wars’ monster hunter, Ty Yorrick, will return in a new series this Spring from Dark Horse Comics.

item.title: Star Wars Force Adept Zeen Mrala Returns in a Win for LGBTQ+ Representation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Wars comics are leading the way for the franchise in LGBTQ+ representation, with IDW and Dark Horse successfully portraying the relationship between Zeen and Lula. The new Dark Horse series explores the tragic elements of Zeen and Lula’s relationship, with Lula potentially being dead and Zeen searching for her. The issue ends with a passionate kiss between Zeen and Lula, making it a significant moment for LGBTQ+ representation in Star Wars.

item.title: Star Wars Forgotten Solo Twins Have Perfect Parallels in Superman Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlue Earth kidnaps Otho-Ra in an attempt to turn her against Superman and her family, mirroring Star Wars’ conflict between Jacen and Jaina Solo. Norah Stone is revealed to be Janan al Ghul, who plans to lead Otho astray to the dark side, creating a conflict between the twins. Superman’s family embracing classic Star Wars tropes hints at a growing conflict within the seemingly idyllic House of El, as Otho is tempted by her darker urges.

item.title: Star Wars New Jedi-Killer Gives Grievous A Run For His Money
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGeneral Viess, a brutal military commander, returns in Star Wars: The High Republic to ally with the Nihil’s leader Marchion Ro. Viess betrays and hands over an entire world over to the Nihil, while also offering to turn them into a formidable military force. Viess owns her own collection of lightsabers from Jedi she’s slain, one that would likely make General Grievous jealous. Viess becomes the Nihil’s new Minister of Protection while also seeking revenge on her old rival Jedi Master Porter Engle.

item.title: Star Wars New Sith Could Explain Why Palpatine Is So Powerful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPalpatine may be able to harness the emotions of others, as has been teased with Star Wars’ new Rogue Sith. This ability could explain Palpatine’s power and frequent lack of negative emotions such as rage and fear. The upcoming Star Wars #42 will soon reveal more about Palpatine and the Rogue Sith and the dark side ability that may share. Literature ReviewStar Wars is about to debut a brand-new “Rogue Sith”, one who may help explain the full extent of Emperor Palptine’s power in the dark side.

item.title: Star Wars New Twist Could Explain Why Yoda Turned The Jedi Against Attachment
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYoda’s strong belief in the ’no attachments’ rule may be explained by a love story in the High Republic era that will assuredly end in tragedy. In Star Wars: The High Republic Adventures, a Force-sensitive named Zeen falls in love with a Jedi Padawan named Lula and is willing to do anything to get her back. Zeen’s willingness to follow Lula, even if it means abandoning Jedi principles, reflects why Yoda believed attachments could lead to corruption, just like it did with Anakin Skywalker.

item.title: Star Wars Rare Wookiee Jedi Was Just Officially Promoted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBurryaga, one of the High Republic’s most popular characters, is officially becoming a Jedi Knight. Burry and Bell Zettifar, who both lost their masters to the Nihil, have a deep bond as friends and allies. The High Republic Phase III is focusing on the increased promotion of Padawans to Knights in the wake of the Nihil’s destruction. Literature ReviewBurryaga is becoming a Jedi Knight during The High Republic Era, teasing an increased role in future stories in the wake of Starlight’s destruction.

item.title: Star Wars Already Introduced Kenobis Perfect Season 2 Villain (Not Darth Maul)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDespite being advertised as a limited series, there is still a very real possibility of another season of Obi-Wan Kenobi. The first season of Obi-Wan Kenobi had a definitive ending, but there is still another adventure Kenobi could embark on before the events of Episode IV: fighting Darth Krayt. Obi-Wan Kenobi Season 2 could bridge the gap between Star Wars’ past and future, with an epic season-long arc introducing Darth Krayt as a future villain and establishing personal stakes for Kenobi.

item.title: Star Wars Anakin Skywalker s Father Finally Revealed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAnakin Skywalker’s birth mystery is solved - his mother, Shmi Skywalker, reveals that there was no father and she can’t explain what happened. Qui-Gon Jinn believed that the Force itself created Anakin in Shmi’s womb, making him the Chosen One who would bring balance to the Force. The revelation confirms that Emperor Palpatine personally manipulated the Dark Side of the Force to create Anakin, making him Anakin’s true ‘father’.

item.title: Star Wars Basically Just Confirmed Palpatine Could Return 1 More Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSith can survive after death by encoding their consciousness into a red Kyber crystal, allowing for a potential return. Palpatine is familiar with cheating death and has previously returned in a clone body. Luke Skywalker’s encounter with a Sith-controlled crystal foreshadows the possibility of Palpatine utilizing this method to come back to life. Literature ReviewSomehow, Palpatine could return once more, as a new comic reveals a way to preserve a Sith consciousness, even once the original Sith has died.

item.title: Star Wars Confirms the Ancient Sith Saved the Galaxy from Something Way Worse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar WArs: Dark Droids has revealed the Sith had previously defeated the original Scourge virus, and saved the galaxy from its hunger. The Scourge wants to ’eat’ the entire Star Wars galaxy, and absorb or wipe out all other forms of life. The Sith may need to save the galaxy again by defeating the new form of the Scourge, which poses an even larger threat. Literature ReviewThe Sith may be an immense force of evil in the galaxy, but they’re also an essential protection against something far, far worse.

item.title: Star Wars Finally Explains How & Why Droids Feel Pain (& It Actually Makes Sense)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDroids in the Star Wars universe can actually feel pain, as revealed in Star Wars #41, shedding light on their physical and survival instincts. The knowledge of droid pain receptors was acquired by Lando Calrissian from L3-37, his former piloting droid. Droid sacrifices and losses, like K-2SO in Rogue One and IG-11 in The Mandalorian, become more significant and heartbreaking when considering their ability to feel pain. Literature ReviewAlthough the majority of Star Wars’ droids have been considered mindless, programmed machines, comics from Marvel have confirmed they can feel pain.

item.title: Star Wars Fixes Lando Calrissian s Movie Arc By Making His Betrayal Way, Way Worse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLando Calrissian’s betrayal of Han Solo and his friends on Cloud City in The Empire Strikes Back is revealed to be even worse in the comics, as he endangered the entire Rebel Alliance by giving sensitive Rebellion secrets to Jabba the Hutt. Princess Leia’s decision to have Lando arrested and put on trial for his betrayal is understandable, as it was a breach of trust and endangered the entire Rebellion.

item.title: Star Wars Introduces Perfect New Term for Its Deadliest Type of Droid
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the Star Wars crossover “Dark Droids” Triple Zero receives the official designation as a “homicide droid” which is fitting considering his gruesome history and love of killing. Triple Zero, an evil counterpart to the protocol droid C-3PO, specializes in torture and maiming rather than communication like Threepio. He was created by the Empire and turned on his own creators. Triple Zero considers BT-1, another deadly droid, to be his only friend due to their shared affinity for mass murder.

item.title: Star Wars Just Made a Powerful Battlefront II Ability Official Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Wars Battlefront II’s Lando Calrissian character has a powerful ability called Sharp Shot, which has now been made official canon in the Star Wars universe. Lando’s Sharp Shot ability is showcased in the latest issue of Star Wars #41, where he displays impressive marksmanship and takes down enemies effortlessly. The comic may also be referencing a glitch from the Battlefront game, where Lando’s Power Blast ability had no cooldown, allowing him to defeat enemies with a single shot, similar to what he does in the issue.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals a Major Original Trilogy Hero Is Secretly Rich
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYR2-D2 has a surprising amount of credits and uses them to hire infamous bounty hunters IG-88 and 4-LOM to save C-3PO in Star Wars: Dark Droids: D-Squad #3. It is possible that R2-D2 has access to Rebellion funds or has hacked into Imperial accounts to acquire his substantial amount of credits. R2-D2’s wise use of his funds and the help of these bounty hunters might just enable him to save his friend and end the threat of the Scourge in the Dark Droids crossover.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals R2-D2 Has A Girlfriend in New Canon (Yes, Really)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYR2-D2 surprisingly has a girlfriend named Qutee, whom he reunites with in the new Dark Droids crossover. Qutee was part of the original D-Squad, a special unit of droids during The Clone Wars, and seemingly shared a lasting bond with R2-D2. Unfortunately, Qutee’s fate is unknown as she was shot during a battle with Imperial droids in the recent issue, possibly leaving R2-D2 without his old flame. Literature ReviewStar Wars’ new Dark Droids crossover has revealed that R2-D2 surprisingly has his very own girlfriend (someone he’s known for quite a long time).

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Future With Darth Vader s Return To Mustafar
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader returns to Mustafar and his castle in Star Wars: Revelations #1, setting up exciting stories for 2024. Revelations will feature tales from all over the Star Wars timeline, including the new series Mace Windu, Jango Fett, and Jabba the Hutt. Marvel’s ongoing Star Wars series and The High Republic are set to continue with new storylines in 2024 as well. Literature Review2023’s Star Wars: Revelations has been revealed with a new preview, one that features Darth Vader’s return to Mustafar, Mace Windu, and more.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Original Dark Prototype for Palpatine s Sith Inquisitors
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Wars reveals the dark prototype for Palpatine’s Inquisitors: Jedi who were corrupted and used by the Nihil. The Nihil, like the Empire, recruited fallen Jedi who held actual power and played a significant role in their evil efforts. The fallen Jedi of the High Republic era were a precursor to Palpatine’s Inquisitors, with the same level of authority and skill in the dark side of the Force. Literature ReviewEmperor Palpatine corrupted many Jedi and turned them into his Inquisitors, but another Star Wars villain did the exact same thing centuries before.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Origins Of The Sequels Most Ignored Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Darth Vader #42, readers are introduced to Lieutenant Enric Pryde, revealing his more humble origins before his role as a key General in The Rise of Skywalker. Pryde becomes a hostage and bait for Darth Vader in a trap set by elite Rebel soldiers. While Vader initially shows little interest in Pryde, it will be interesting to see if he can prove his value to the Dark Lord in future issues.

item.title: Starfox Harry Styles MCU Hero Returns to Marvel Canon with New Link to Tony Stark
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man enlists the help of controversial Eternal, Starfox, to restore his fortune and assist the X-Men. Tony Stark’s tech and fortune have been stolen by Feilong, and he teams up with Emma Frost and the X-Men to retrieve them. Starfox’s unique power of manipulating emotions makes him a valuable ally, and his recent reintroduction in the MCU has sparked renewed interest in his character. Literature ReviewWith his money gone and everything going wrong, Iron Man is teaming up with the Eternals‚Äô most controversial member Starfox for a mission into space.

item.title: Static s New Costume Is an Eye-Catching Throwback to the Static Shock Animated Classic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStatic: Shadows of Dakota #7 will debut a new superhero suit for Static, comining elements from his previous outfit with nods to his animated era. The issue will conclude the current run of Static’s adventures and bring the ongoing conflicts to a head. The new suit honors the beloved animated series while staying in continuity with the current story, blending the past and present of Static’s character. Literature ReviewStatic: Shadows of Dakota #7 will conclude the hero’s current adventures, but will segue into his next alongside a suit that blends his history.

item.title: Steve Rogers New Nemesis Combines the Powers of Captain America & The Hulk
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Captain America #3, the Emissary is introduced as one of the most dangerous enemies Captain America has ever faced, with a combination of deadly qualities including a killer mentality, superhuman abilities, and fusion with a demon. Despite being a Captain America’s solo series, he isn’t alone in facing this new threat, as he enlists the help of Misty Knight and Dr. Strange to combat the Emissary. Defeating the Emissary will require all of Captain America’s power and the assistance of his allies, as he strives to survive against this formidable new antagonist.

item.title: Storm s New Asgardian Look Proves She s Always Been a True Goddess
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStorm has proven her worthiness to hold Mjolnir and has taken on the role of Thor, with a new Thor-inspired costume design. Storm has always been referred to as a goddess and has had previous encounters with divine powers, including wielding her own Asgardian hammer. The Marvel Universe explores the idea that gods are created through worship, suggesting that Storm’s divinity is validated by her followers and supporters. Literature ReviewThor may be the God of Thunder, but the X-Men have a goddess of their own, and she‚Äôs proven once and for all that she‚Äôs just as worthy of being Thor.

item.title: Storm s New Nickname Proves She Needs to Lead the X-Men in 2024 Reboot
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStorm’s dedication to fighting for the oppressed has been a constant throughout her life, making her the ideal leader for the X-Men. The Genesis War showcases the opposing definitions of “strength” between Storm and Genesis, with Storm advocating for the strength of asking for help and relying on others. With the Krakoan Era ending and mutantkind facing increasing hatred, Storm’s effective leadership and commitment to all mutants make her the perfect candidate to lead the X-Men in their new era.

item.title: Sukuna s Victory Over Gojo In Jujutsu Kaisen Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSukuna’s stolen cursed technique, Ten Shadows and Mahoraga, shifted the balance of the fight in his favor by allowing him to adapt to Gojo’s attacks and create openings for himself. Gojo’s critical miscalculation was underestimating Mahoraga’s ability to adapt to the environment, allowing Sukuna to target not Gojo, but the space he was in, thus making Limitless useless. Sukuna still has untapped potential with other cursed techniques, indicating that he ultimately surpassed Gojo in power.

item.title: Super Saiyan Blue Was Created For a Simple Reason Most Dragon Ball Fans Missed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDragon Ball Super’s Super Saiyan Blue transformation was chosen to be blue because its predecessor, Super Saiyan God, was red. The blue color creates a dramatic contrast with the red hue of Super Saiyan God and emphasize the transformation’s difference in appearance. A hypothetical Super Saiyan “White” transformation was considered, but it was ultimately decided against due to its similarity to the plans for the next villain. Literature ReviewThe truth behind the origins of Dragon Ball Super’s Super Saiyan Blue is actually rather simple, according to an interview with Akira Toriyama.

item.title: Superboys Secret Origin Redefines His Greatest Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperboy’s powers are revealed to come from the Chained, a powerful telekinetic villain. The Chained’s telekinetic abilities are far stronger than Superboy’s, and he can level buildings. This revelation adds complexity to Superboy’s already complicated past and puts a weight on his shoulders. Literature ReviewSuperboy‚Äôs origin gets a wild update when Lex Luthor reveals that Conner Kent‚Äôs powers have a direct connection to Supeman‚Äôs new enemy, the Chained. Warning! Spoilers ahead for Superman #8!

item.title: Supergirl Goes Bananas in a Hilarious Twist on One of DC s Most Iconic Covers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Ape-ril Special, featuring a monkey-themed twist on Crisis on Infinite Earths cover, excites fans and prompts speculation about further integration of the iconic narrative. Bernard Chang’s variant cover showcases Monkey Prince cradling a banana peel, paying whimsical homage to the original cover’s Superman and fallen Supergirl. The Ape-ril Special offers a unique departure from the norm, introducing the all-ape superhero team, the Jungle League, in an unforgettable, one-off story that may contain other thematic and narrative elements tied to Crisis on Infinite Earths.

item.title: Supergirl s Dreamer Explains Her New Powers in Official DC Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDreamer’s powers have evolved and she can now see the future in real-time while awake, causing confusion and uncertainty. Nia Nal, also known as Dreamer, is struggling to navigate her new powers and distinguish between future events and present reality. Titans: Beast World Tour - Metropolis #1 will feature Dreamer’s first official adventure with her updated powers, and it remains to be seen how she will learn to control and use them effectively.

item.title: Supergirl s Dreamer Just Became Essential to DC s 2024 Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe character Dream is set to have a major role in DC Comics’ future, positioning her as a vital player in the company’s upcoming storytelling events. In Action Comics #1060, Dreamer’s true role in the DC Universe, is revealed as she is blackmailed by Amanda Waller to go after a rogue meta-human. Amanda Waller sees Dreamer’s incredible precognitive abilities as a way to make herself even more powerful and intends to manipulate the young hero for her own gain.

item.title: Supergirl vs King Kong Flips the Kaiju Ape s Original Movie Ending
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSupergirl takes on Kong in a battle that puts a twist on a famous movie ending. The Legion of Doom has unleashed kaijus on the DC Universe, including Godzilla and Kong. Supergirl’s Kryptonian powers may give her the edge in her fight against Kong. Literature ReviewAs the MonsterVerse continues to invade the DC Universe, Supergirl steps in to save a fellow hero by picking a fight with the legendary Kong.

item.title: Superman 78 Just Introduced a Jaw-Dropping First to Christopher Reeve Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
